The company aims to meet the growing demand for improved remote work setups and productivity tools by collaborating with major tech platforms.

title: Target, General Mills and 3M among Minnesota brands calling for ‘de-escalation’ amid ICE tensions
summary: Over 60 CEOs from Minnesota-based companies, including Target, 3M, and General Mills, have signed an open letter calling for "de-escalation" following recent ICE-related conflicts in the state that led to two fatal shootings. The letter emphasizes finding "real solutions" and fostering progress, a rare public stance for corporations especially during ongoing aggressive ICE raids. This development comes amid other controversies, such as a consumer boycott for Target and tech/finance CEOs attending a private screening of 'Melania' shortly after one of the shootings.

The article ranks these seven companies, with a particular focus on Alphabet, providing an informed opinion on future portfolio positioning.

title: Apple unveils the new Black Unity Apple Watch band

Apple is also making grants to organizations worldwide that promote creativity and connection in under-resourced communities.

title: Meet the Man Running a “Modern-day Manhattan Project” in Fort Worth

This initiative, backed by General Motors, Apple, and the Department of Defense, aims to reduce America's dependency on China for essential materials used in advanced technologies. The company is focusing on developing domestic manufacturing capabilities and a skilled workforce to anchor key industries in the U.S.

title: Qualcomm, Skyworks PT trimmed as handset outlook weakens By Investing.com

Memory price increases and supply shortages are key factors impacting production, particularly affecting Android makers, while Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is gaining market share in China.

title: Jensen Huang Gets Much, Much Richer
summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, has become the ninth richest person in the world with a net worth of $155 billion, largely due to Nvidia's dominant position in the high-end AI chip market. The company, which Huang started in 1993, now has a market cap of $4.57 trillion and has seen its stock rise 1,344% in the past five years. Despite some skeptics pointing to potential challenges from competition and a possible slowdown in AI industry growth, Nvidia's recent earnings show continued strong revenue and earnings growth.

title: Apple unveils long-awaited updated AirTag (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Apple has announced a new version of its AirTag item finder, featuring an extended range compared to its predecessor. title: TikTok’s Khaby Lame Secures Landmark $900M Deal with Rich Sparkle Holdings, Redefining Creator Economy Scale
summary: TikTok star Khaby Lame has finalized a groundbreaking $900 million to $975 million all-stock deal with U.S.-listed Rich Sparkle Holdings. This transaction involves the partial sale of Lame's operating company and grants Rich Sparkle exclusive global commercial rights to his brand for 36 months, aiming to transform his viral persona into a platform-integrated business empire. The deal also includes the development of an AI-powered digital twin of Lame and targets over $4 billion in annual sales.

title: 26th January – Threat Intelligence Report
summary: This Threat Intelligence Report for January 26, 2026, highlights recent cyber incidents including ransomware attacks by RansomHub on Luxshare and an alleged database leak from Under Armour. It also discusses AI-related threats such as prompt injection flaws in Google Calendar assistant, web attack techniques using LLM APIs to generate malicious JavaScript, and advanced language models creating zero-day exploits. The report further covers vulnerabilities, patches for Zoom and Fortinet, and details from Check Point Research on AI-authored malware, KONNI phishing campaigns, and a new ransomware family called Osiris.

title: 149M logins exposed in unsecured database, inc 900k Apple accounts
summary: A security researcher has discovered an unsecured cloud database containing 149 million account logins, including 900,000 for Apple accounts. This follows a similar discovery last year of a database with 184 million records. The data is believed to be collected by infostealers, emphasizing the importance of using unique, strong passwords and password managers to prevent credential stuffing attacks.

title: Apple Has 27% Upside, JPMorgan Says, Even As Memory Costs Surge And App Store Growth Slows

Despite concerns about rising memory costs and slowing App Store growth, the bank projects a 27% upside for Apple due to strong iPhone 17 demand and other growth areas beyond the App Store. Bank of America also anticipates record first-quarter revenue for Apple, driven by robust iPhone sales and double-digit growth in Services, even as Apple rekindles its chip partnership with Intel for non-Pro iPhone models.

The change reflects a significant dynamic shift in the semiconductor industry, with Nvidia's AI chip demand driving TSMC's growth and investments.

While the antenna build-out reinforces existing offerings, near-term catalysts for GSAT's investment narrative still depend on monetizing wholesale capacity, expanding government and defense demand, and achieving consistent profitability.

title: Luck or Strategy? Why Boeing uses "7" in all its aircraft names
summary: Boeing's iconic use of the number "7" in its aircraft names, such as the 707 and 787, originated from an internal numbering system in the 1950s where the 700 series was designated for commercial jet transports. The success of the Boeing 707 solidified this "7X7" pattern as a brand, making it instantly recognizable globally. While the company is nearing the end of available "7X7" combinations with only the 797 remaining for traditional designs, Boeing is exploring new naming conventions like 7A7-7Z7 or leveraging letters for variants to accommodate future revolutionary aircraft designs.

title: T-Mobile Activates Free Cellular Starlink in the US As Winter Storm Rolls In
summary: T-Mobile has activated free Starlink cellular service for its customers in areas expected to be affected by Winter Storm Fern, allowing basic text messaging connectivity via satellite when traditional cellular service is disrupted. While T-Satellite typically costs an additional $10 per month, T-Mobile is waiving the fee for compatible phones during the storm. This service also broadcasts Wireless Emergency Alerts and is a proactive measure by carriers to maintain communication during severe weather.

title: Garmin Ltd. Bets Big on Wearables, Aviation, and Auto Tech — And It’s Working

This strategy supports a strong stock performance for GRMN, driven by demand for advanced sports wearables, resilient aviation business, and sticky marine contracts.

title: From Google X to Panasonic: Yoky Matsuoka joins Analog Devices board

Her appointment expands the board to 11 members and is seen as a strategic move to leverage her expertise in integrating hardware, software, and AI for human-centric systems. Dr. Matsuoka, a MacArthur Genius Award recipient, brings a wealth of experience in technology, robotics, and neuroscience to ADI.

title: Healthcare Triangle Top Nasdaq Stock by Volume - Market Recap Jan 23, 2026 - News and Statistics

(NASDAQ:GOOG) by 8.3% in the third quarter, holding 51,451 shares valued at $12.53 million, which represents 1.5% of its portfolio. Her addition expands ADI's board to 11 members as the semiconductor company continues to strengthen its leadership and financial position, with recent positive analyst upgrades and a 23-year streak of dividend increases.

(Nasdaq: ADI) has announced the appointment of Dr. Yoky Matsuoka to its Board of Directors as an independent director and a member of the Corporate Development Committee, effective January 20, 2026. Her background includes leadership roles at Google (healthcare, Google/Nest CTO, Google X co-founder), Apple, and Quanttus, as well as a distinguished academic career in AI and robotics, making her a valuable addition to ADI's mission to bridge the physical and digital worlds.

title: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) faces push for China supply-chain risk audit

This audit would assess the financial risks, supply-chain vulnerabilities, intellectual property exposure, and human rights issues associated with Apple's significant reliance on China for manufacturing and revenue. The NLPC argues that Apple's current disclosures are insufficient and do not adequately quantify the potential impacts of tariffs, forced labor concerns, and intellectual property theft on the company's long-term value.

title: Apple Expands Hardware Chief’s Role in Latest Sign of CEO Candidacy
summary: Apple has expanded the role of its hardware chief, John Ternus, to include overseeing design work. This move strengthens Ternus's position as a potential successor to current CEO Tim Cook, who turned 65 recently. The change, which happened at the end of last year, significantly broadens Ternus' critical responsibilities within the company.

title: RansomHub Ransomware breach exposes sensitive Apple Inc Data
summary: Apple Inc. is reportedly linked to a significant data breach through its supplier, Luxshare, where the RansomHub ransomware group exfiltrated over 1 terabyte of sensitive data, including unreleased product designs. The breach, which occurred in December 2025, involved Luxshare failing to meet ransom demands, leading to the publication of the stolen information. Apple is currently conducting an internal investigation, highlighting the critical importance of third-party security in complex supply chains.

Analysts have mixed views, but the overall consensus is a "Moderate Buy," suggesting the current dip might be a buying opportunity given its robust growth areas.

title: Stifel raises Coherent stock price target to $220 on AI networking growth

Coherent also recently announced new products like an electro-optic modulator, portable laser power meters, and a programmable optical filter, while Raymond James also raised its price target for the company.

title: Apple Pay Finally Launches in India After 10-Year Wait
summary: After a decade of regulatory hurdles and banking complications, Apple Pay is finally entering India's digital payments market with an expected launch by the end of 2026. The delay was primarily due to India's data localization requirements and the incompatibility of Apple's biometric authentication methods (Face ID/Touch ID) with India's payment framework. Apple Pay's strategy will involve offering a premium payment experience to its growing user base in India, focusing on seamless ecosystem integration, enhanced security, and superior international transaction capabilities, rather than competing directly with existing UPI giants.

title: Vicor Corporation stock hits all-time high at 165.55 USD

Although the stock appears overvalued with an RSI suggesting overbought conditions, its strong fundamentals and significant cash reserves are driving investor confidence.

title: Apple asks Indian court to stop antitrust body from seeking its financials
summary: Apple is seeking a court order in India to prevent the country's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), from requesting its global financial records. This move is part of a larger dispute where Apple challenges the validity of penalty rules and faces accusations of abusing its app store position. Apple fears a potential $38 billion fine if its global turnover is used for penalties, and argues that complying with financial requests now would undermine its legal challenge against India's current penalty regulations.

title: Berkshire Hathaway: Exiting Kraft Heinz Could Be First Move to Pare Down Equity Investment Portfolio

Despite the sale, Morningstar maintains its fair value estimate for Berkshire Hathaway, viewing the stock as slightly undervalued.

Despite recent stock optimism fueled by a nascent contract manufacturing business and government investment, the CEO noted that the payoff could be years away, as the company works to rebuild its position in the AI-driven computing era.

Despite current unprofitability, ZenaTech boasts strong liquidity and has been actively expanding its market presence through new drone launches and acquisitions, while also aligning with U.S. government regulations on foreign-made drone equipment.

title: Apple Spent Years Downplaying AI Chatbots. Now Siri Is Becoming One

This shift, according to Bloomberg, indicates Apple's concession that chatbots are a preferred interface for AI, moving away from its previous philosophy of subtly embedding AI within device features. The new Siri, code-named Campos, will be deeply integrated across Apple's operating systems and offer an experience more akin to ChatGPT.

title: Warren Buffett Was Never Just a Value Investor. Here’s the Real Secret to His Investing Success

His outperformance can largely be explained by factor exposures to intangible value and quality, rather than non-replicable stock-picking skill. The article suggests that individual investors can replicate Buffett's returns by systematically investing in companies with high intangible value and quality, a strategy applicable across various markets.

(NASDAQ:GOOG) by 31.4% in the third quarter, selling 6,196 shares and reducing its total holdings to 13,513 shares, valued at $3.29 million. Despite this, Alphabet remains a substantial part of Rakuten's portfolio, accounting for about 1.2%. The article also details movements by other institutional investors and provides a comprehensive financial overview of Alphabet, highlighting its recent earnings, dividend announcement, and analyst ratings, alongside current market sentiment influenced by AI developments.

title: OVERSEA CHINESE BANKING Corp Ltd Trims Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG

This change comes amidst various institutional investor adjustments, with Alphabet maintaining strong analyst ratings and positive sentiment driven by its AI initiatives like Gemini. Despite some insider selling and minor setbacks in specific projects, the company's financial performance remains strong, supported by robust revenue growth and a recently announced quarterly dividend.

title: Gerber LLC Lowers Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Gerber LLC significantly reduced its stock holdings in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 63.6% in the third quarter, now owning 2,165 shares valued at $527,000. title: It's time to give up on Motorola smartwatches
summary: The author argues that it's time to stop hoping for a good Motorola smartwatch, citing their inconsistent designs and lack of direction. While the latest Moto Watch has clean hardware, it's unremarkable compared to competitors and suffers from a proprietary software experience that lacks Wear OS features and app support. Despite some fitness benefits from Polar, the overall ecosystem and lack of continuity make Motorola smartwatches a poor choice.

title: Jim Cramer Says High Price to Earnings Multiples Are Hurting Spotify Stock
summary: Jim Cramer commented on Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE: SPOT), noting that its high price-to-earnings multiple is causing the stock to shed points, despite its strong market position and potential for growth. He suggested that investors may need to hold for the long term or sell and re-enter later, as the market is currently shying away from high P/E stocks. A fund also highlighted Spotify's strong market share and revenue levers but preferred AI stocks for greater upside.

title: Eagle Global Advisors LLC Cuts Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Eagle Global Advisors LLC reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. by 20.5% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 44,085 shares, yet Alphabet remains its 17th largest holding. However, insider selling and broader market volatility could temper near-term sentiment for the tech giant.

title: Blalock Williams LLC Invests $1.34 Million in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Blalock Williams LLC has significantly invested in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG), acquiring 5,507 shares valued at approximately $1.34 million, making it a key holding in their portfolio. summary: In 2026, NVIDIA has become the world's most valuable tech company, surpassing giants like Apple and Microsoft, according to CompaniesMarketCap. The rankings, based on market capitalization, indicate the rapid evolution of the tech industry where foundational technology providers are now leading the market.

title: 4,233 Shares in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG Bought by Avantra Family Wealth Inc.
summary: Avantra Family Wealth Inc. recently acquired 4,233 shares of Alphabet Inc. (GOOG), valued at approximately $1.03 million, as per its latest 13F filing. title: Fortune and Korn Ferry Reveal the Fortune World's Most Admired Companies™ 2026 List | Corporate
summary: Fortune and Korn Ferry have released their 28th annual Fortune World's Most Admired Companies (WMAC) 2026 List, with Apple ranking No. 1 for the 19th consecutive year. The list highlights companies recognized for financial stability, innovation, and leadership, with 10% of the companies led by female CEOs.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF’s 2025 Performance
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) achieved a 21.28% total return in 2025, driven by strong technology sector performance, particularly NVIDIA, and a weakening US Dollar. The ETF maintains significant exposure to mega-cap technology firms and US equities, with a notably broader diversification than its category average. While its expense ratio is below the category average, it is higher than some competitors, and its 2026 outlook depends heavily on the continued strength of the technology sector and global economic trends.

title: The Truth About Garmin: Is This ‘Boring’ Brand Secretly a Total Flex in 2026?
summary: This article explores how Garmin, a company traditionally seen as "boring," has become a highly respected brand among serious fitness enthusiasts and outdoor adventurers in 2026. It highlights Garmin's focus on hardcore fitness features, exceptional battery life, and a comprehensive ecosystem, distinguishing it from lifestyle-oriented smartwatches by Apple and Samsung. The piece concludes that Garmin offers significant value for those committed to training and outdoor activities, despite its premium price point.

title: Jim Cramer Says He "Would Be a Buyer of STMicro"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed a positive outlook on STMicroelectronics N.V. (NYSE: STM), considering it a "cheap" and "good" stock despite its higher price-to-earnings ratio compared to peers. Hardman Johnston Global Equity Strategy also initiated a position in STM, citing its leadership in analog semiconductors and anticipating a recovery in the semiconductor cycle in 2025. The company is expected to benefit from restocking, improved margins, and growth opportunities in areas like incremental iPhone content, LEO satellites, and AI data centers.

title: Cypress Funds LLC Cuts Apple Inc Stake by 29,550 Shares
summary: Cypress Funds LLC, managed by Steven Baum, has reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 29,550 shares. Despite a recent 5% dip in shares, Apple remains up 11.5% over the last year, with Wall Street maintaining a "Moderate Buy" consensus and an average 12-month price target of $299.49. Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan reiterated a Buy rating with a $325 objective, anticipating strong Q1 2026 earnings driven by iPhone 17 demand and Services growth.

title: Jim Cramer on Ares Capital: “I Want to Be Very Careful There”
summary: Jim Cramer expressed caution regarding Ares Capital (ARCC), advising a caller to sell their shares due to uncertainty about its holdings and a 9% yield that makes him "very, very nervous." He suggested replacing ARCC with Johnson & Johnson, while approving of other holdings like Apple, Hershey, Kimberly-Clark, and Nvidia. The article also highlights Ares Capital’s business of providing financing solutions to middle-market companies and promotes AI stocks as potentially offering higher returns.

title: Gene Munster Mostly Agrees With Leading Apple Analyst About Road Ahead For Apple In Next 8 Months: 'You Can Take This To The Bank'
summary: Gene Munster of Deepwater Asset Management largely agrees with Bloomberg's Mark Gurman regarding Apple's potential stock boost in the next eight months, citing two upcoming Siri updates as key catalysts. The first update, expected with iOS 26.4, will enhance web search and on-screen content analysis, while a more significant update in iOS 27 and macOS 27 will transform Siri into a full chatbot, positioning Apple more competitively in the AI market. This development comes as Apple has lagged behind rivals like Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft in AI investment and recently partnered with Google for its AI features.

title: Intel Stock Surges to 4-Year High Ahead of Earnings. Why Optimism Is Growing.
summary: Intel's stock has surged to a four-year high, having more than doubled in the past year, as the company approaches its latest earnings report. Analysts are showing increasing optimism about Intel's future prospects. This positive sentiment is contributing to the stock's continued strong performance.

title: Medicare insurer Alignment Healthcare joins Fortune list with Amazon and Apple
summary: Alignment Healthcare (NASDAQ: ALHC), a Medicare Advantage company, has been named to the 2026 Fortune World’s Most Admired Companies list in its first year of eligibility. This recognition, which places Alignment among major corporations like Amazon and Apple, reflects peer ratings for the company's leadership, innovation, and operating ability in the Health Care: Insurance and Managed Care category. The company highlighted its AVA® technology platform and multiple 2025 quality recognitions, including having 100% of its health plan members enrolled in 4+ star plans and achieving 5-star HMO contracts in Nevada and North Carolina.

title: The Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS) Director Sells $43,439,850.00 in Stock

title: Merck added to BofA's best ideas list—see all the names
summary: Bank of America has updated its "US 1" list of best investment ideas, adding Merck (MRK) as a new pick. Apple (AAPL) was renewed on the list after its mandatory 52-week review. The selections are based on Buy-rated U.S.-listed stocks covered by BofA analysts, with considerations for sector grouping, risk rating, and income security.

title: Lee Kang Jyh, director at Photronics, sells $345,100 in shares
summary: Lee Kang Jyh, a director at Photronics Inc. (NASDAQ:PLAB), sold 10,000 shares of common stock for a total of $345,100 on January 16, 2026. Despite the director's sale, InvestingPro data indicates management has been actively buying back shares.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH): Strategy and Standing
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) offers investors exposure to large and mid-cap companies in developed global equity markets, with a significant concentration in U.S. equities, particularly in the technology sector. Despite recent market volatility, URTH has shown solid performance, delivering 21.28% year-to-date as of December 31, 2025. The article also compares URTH to its competitors, VT and SCHF, highlighting differences in expense ratios, assets under management, and market coverage.

title: Top 5 Stocks To Own In 2026: Dan Niles Bets On Apple, Cisco, Boeing And More
summary: Tech investor Dan Niles predicts a "choppy" market in late 2026 but identifies significant upside in specific companies. He is bullish on Apple due to an anticipated AI-enabled Siri and foldable iPhone, Cisco as a value play in AI infrastructure, and Impinj for its RFID technology expansion. Additionally, Niles sees Boeing as a turnaround story with increased shipments and Nike benefiting from a "back to basics" strategy and undervalued stock.

title: QQQX Vs. QQQI: The CEF Is Relatively More Attractive For Those OK With Some Complexity
summary: The article compares Nuveen Nasdaq 100 Dynamic Overwrite Fund (QQQX) and a similar ETF, QQQI, both offering exposure to the Nasdaq 100 Index with call overwrite strategies. QQQX, a CEF, currently trades at an -8.22% NAV discount, providing potential upside for investors comfortable with its added complexity. QQQI offers a simpler ETF approach with a generally higher yield.

title: Adobe Acrobat can now generate podcasts from your PDFs, as Express adds more AI features
summary: Adobe is rolling out several new AI-powered features for Acrobat and Express, including the ability to generate presentations from documents, make prompt-based PDF edits, and create podcast-style summaries from PDFs. The "Generate podcast" feature allows users to convert documents into audio for on-the-go listening, which is particularly useful for dense or lengthy material. Additionally, PDF Spaces will now support collaboration, enabling multiple users to work on shared projects.

title: The Next Big Theme: January 2026
summary: This article identifies several key themes for January 2026, highlighting significant advancements and trends across various sectors. It covers the booming data center market driven by AI, the U.S. Army's push for next-gen autonomous drone technology, and accelerated competition for AI capital with potential major investments. Additionally, it discusses Coinbase's expansion into an "everything exchange," TSMC's 2nm chip breakthrough, and the role of corporate procurement in catalyzing clean energy initiatives.

title: Apple's weakness is a 'buying opportunity' into earnings: Goldman (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Ng views Apple's recent seven-week stock decline as a "buying opportunity" ahead of its upcoming quarterly earnings report. The analyst anticipates Apple will report earnings of $2.66 per share. This perspective suggests confidence in Apple's performance despite recent market weakness.

title: Apple to Revamp Siri as a Built-In iPhone, Mac Chatbot to Fend Off OpenAI
summary: Apple Inc. plans to transform Siri into its first artificial intelligence chatbot later this year, entering the generative AI race currently led by OpenAI and Google. This new chatbot, code-named Campos, will be deeply integrated into Apple's iPhone, iPad, and Mac operating systems, replacing the existing Siri interface and allowing users to activate it through familiar commands. This move is Apple's strategic effort to compete in the evolving AI landscape.

title: 2 Dividend ETFs to Buy With $2,000 and Hold Forever
summary: This article recommends two dividend ETFs, the Charles Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD) and the Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG), for investors looking to build a long-term portfolio with $2,000. SCHD focuses on companies with stable cash flow and dividends, boasting a 3.6% yield, while VIG targets companies with a history of consistently increasing dividend payouts for at least 10 years. Both ETFs offer diversification with minimal overlap, providing a blend of immediate income and dividend growth potential.

title: Corning Upgrade Highlights Apple Foldable Potential And AI Valuation Questions
summary: Bank of America recently upgraded Corning (NYSE:GLW) due to expectations surrounding Apple's foldable device launch, which could drive demand for Corning's display and cover materials. The upgrade also highlights growing interest in Corning's AI-related products across its Optical, Solar, and Specialty segments. Despite positive short-term momentum and strong financial results, Simply Wall St identifies the stock as overvalued, with a P/E ratio significantly higher than the industry average, suggesting that future growth expectations related to foldables and AI may already be priced in.

title: Amazon Stock: AWS & AI Fuel 2026 Rebound After 2025 Lag - News and Statistics
summary: Investors are optimistic about Amazon's (AMZN) stock rebound in early 2026, driven by anticipated demand for its AWS cloud business benefiting from AI growth, and improved efficiency in e-commerce through AI. After underperforming its Big Tech rivals in 2025 with only a 5% gain, Amazon's shares are now trading at a relatively inexpensive 24 times projected earnings, making it an attractive investment according to Wall Street analysts. This rebound mirrors Alphabet's earlier success with its Gemini AI model, suggesting a similar trajectory for Amazon as it leverages AI across its operations.

title: Tenaris SA ADR stock hits 52-week high at 43.46 USD
summary: Tenaris SA ADR stock reached a 52-week high of $43.46, reflecting strong financial health and investor confidence. The company boasts a P/E ratio of 11.68, a "GREAT" Financial Health score, and a 2.74% dividend yield with 23 years of consistent payments. Analyst Guillaume Delaby reiterated an "Outperform" rating, citing Tenaris's strong cash position and improving prospects in the oil services industry, particularly with anticipated increases in offshore backlogs and Saudi Arabian upstream spending.

title: Pricesmart stock hits all-time high of 143.56 USD By Investing.com
summary: PriceSmart Inc. (PSMT) shares reached an all-time high of $143.56, reflecting a 56.16% increase over the past year. Despite this rally, InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock may be overvalued, with P/E and PEG ratios of 28.58 and 3.57, respectively. The company recently reported mixed Q1 2026 results, missing EPS forecasts but exceeding revenue expectations.

title: Clarivate Reveals Top 100 Global Innovators 2026
summary: Clarivate Plc announced its 15th edition of the Top 100 Global Innovators, highlighting organizations that consistently deliver high-impact inventions, with artificial intelligence (AI) accelerating this transformation. Japan leads with 32 organizations, followed by the United States, Taiwan, and Germany/South Korea, with Samsung Electronics retaining the #1 position.

title: Goldman Sachs Group (GS): Company Profile, Stock Price, News, Rankings

The article also mentions various financial and ranking information available for Goldman Sachs.

title: Albemarle stock hits 52-week high at $179.44

Despite trading above its Fair Value and not being expected to be profitable this year, analysts maintain an optimistic outlook, with several firms upgrading their ratings and price targets for ALB.

title: Apple stock spikes after report of Siri revamp into chatbot
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stock saw a significant spike following reports that the company plans to integrate a new chatbot, codenamed "Campos," deeply into its operating systems, effectively revamping Siri to compete with generative AI leaders like OpenAI and Google. This new AI is expected to offer enhanced conversational capabilities and will be unveiled at Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference in June, with a release slated for September. The integration marks Apple's major entry into the generative AI space.

title: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC Has $32.99 Million Position in VeriSign, Inc. $VRSN
summary: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC significantly increased its stake in VeriSign (NASDAQ: VRSN) by 72.5% in Q3, now holding 122,062 shares valued at $32.99 million. This move comes as institutional ownership in VeriSign remains high at 92.90%, with major firms like Vanguard and State Street also upping their positions, while company insiders, including the CEO, have recently been net sellers of the stock. Analysts currently rate VeriSign as a "Hold" with an average target price of $282.00.

title: Apple | AAPL Stock Price, Company Overview & News
summary: This page provides a comprehensive overview of Apple Inc. (AAPL), including its stock price, company profile, financial summaries for various years, and key statistical data. It details Apple's products, services, geographical segments, and lists its numerous recognitions on Forbes' best employer and global company lists. The page also features recent news articles, some of which are unrelated to Apple.

title: VIDEO: ETF of the Week: TSPA
summary: Todd Rosenbluth, VettaFi’s Head of Research, discussed the T. Rowe Price US Equity Research ETF (TSPA) with Chuck Jaffe on the "ETF of the Week" podcast. TSPA is highlighted as a successful actively managed ETF that gathered significant assets in 2025 due to its strong track record and distinct approach to U.S. equity investing, leveraging T. Rowe Price's research team's best ideas. The discussion also covers its competitive expense ratio and suitability as a long-term core holding, despite its strong weighting in "Mag Seven" stocks.

title: Is Another Great Moderation at Hand? - Northern Trust - Commentaries
summary: Carl Tannenbaum of Northern Trust discusses whether the global economy is headed for another "Great Moderation," similar to the period of sustained growth and low inflation from the 1980s to the early 2000s. While acknowledging recent impressive productivity gains and a tech-led investment boom, he argues against the likelihood of a new Great Moderation, citing ongoing geopolitical headwinds, stagnating global trade, and demographic shifts. Tannenbaum also warns against prematurely lowering interest rates, drawing parallels to the imbalances that ended the previous Moderation.

title: Kera Capital Partners Inc. Acquires 3,849 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Kera Capital Partners Inc. increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 12% in the third quarter, purchasing 3,849 shares to own a total of 36,058 shares valued at $8.782 million. This acquisition makes Alphabet the 16th largest position in Kera Capital Partners' portfolio. The article also notes significant institutional interest, with Vanguard Group Inc. and Norges Bank increasing their holdings, while analyst sentiment remains positive with a "Buy" consensus and an average price target of $321.97, despite recent insider selling activity.

title: Alignment Healthcare Named to the 2026 Fortune World’s Most Admired Companies™ List for First Time
summary: Alignment Healthcare, an award-winning Medicare Advantage company, has been named to the 2026 Fortune World’s Most Admired Companies™ list, marking its debut in its first year of eligibility. This recognition affirms the company’s reputation, leadership, innovation, and operating ability, particularly in its commitment to senior care. The honor follows numerous other quality rankings and distinctions earned by Alignment Healthcare in 2025, highlighting its continued success and growth in the healthcare industry.

title: Glacier Bancorp (GBCI) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Glacier Bancorp (GBCI) is set to report its Q4 earnings after the bell. Analysts expect revenue to grow 35.7% year over year to $308 million and adjusted earnings of $0.62 per share. The company has a mixed earnings history, missing revenue estimates three times in the last two years, but its stock price is up 2.8% recently, with an average analyst target of $53.33.

title: Avalon GloboCare Announces FDA Registration Renewal for KetoAir™ and Planned B2B and B2C Launch Through Catch-Up™, Its Automated Generative AI-Powered Short-Form Video SaaS Platform
summary: Avalon GloboCare has renewed the FDA registration for its KetoAir™ device, a handheld breathalyzer for ketogenic health management. The company plans to launch the device in B2B and B2C markets in Q2 2026 through Catch-Up™, an AI-powered SaaS platform for short-form video content, aiming to enhance marketing and digital engagement. This strategic move leverages Avalon's diversified focus on diagnostic consumer products and generative AI software.

title: Apple tops 'Most Admired' list again as AI giants surge in 2026
summary: Apple has once again secured the top spot on Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies list for the 19th consecutive year, with Microsoft, Amazon, NVIDIA, and JPMorgan Chase completing the top five. The 2026 list highlights the growing influence of AI, with newcomers AMD and Workday entering the Top 50. The comprehensive report covers 324 companies globally, with 35 (10%) led by female CEOs, emphasizing innovation, resilient leadership, and global impact as key factors for admiration.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Stock Position Lowered by JARISLOWSKY FRASER Ltd
summary: JARISLOWSKY FRASER Ltd reduced its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 14.6% in the third quarter, while several other institutional investors increased their holdings. Despite the reduction by one fund, Apple exceeded Q3 earnings estimates and received multiple analyst price target increases, leading to a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating. The article also discusses recent positive and negative news impacting Apple's stock, including AI integration, new product speculation, and macro risks.

title: UBS reiterates Buy rating on 3M stock with $190 price target
summary: UBS has maintained its Buy rating and $190.00 price target for 3M (NYSE:MMM) despite the stock's 8% drop after fourth-quarter results narrowly missed expectations. The firm attributes the stock's decline to multiple contraction rather than revised 2026 expectations, viewing the current sell-off as a "compelling buying opportunity." 3M's strong dividend history and anticipated volume and productivity benefits in 2026 support UBS's positive outlook.

title: Morgan Stanley Keeps Their Hold Rating on Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Erik Woodring maintained a Hold rating on Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) with a price target of $25.00. This comes despite Goldman Sachs upgrading HPE to a Buy on January 13. The article also notes negative corporate insider sentiment with increased selling activity, including HPE's President & CEO selling over 26,000 shares.

title: Davis Capital Management Buys New Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Davis Capital Management initiated a new position in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) during the third quarter, acquiring 15,556 shares valued at approximately $3.96 million. This makes Apple the fund's sixth-largest holding, comprising about 2.7% of its portfolio. Several other institutional investors also increased their stakes in Apple, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $283.62, citing near-term catalysts like Siri's integration with Google's Gemini and upcoming earnings.

title: Fulton Bank N.A. Sells 3,126 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Fulton Bank N.A. reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 1.1%, selling 3,126 shares but still holding 272,148 shares valued at $69.3 million, making Apple its 9th largest holding. While some institutions increased their positions, hedge funds and institutional investors collectively own 67.73% of Apple. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of $283.62, anticipating positive impacts from Gemini-powered Siri and future iPhone cycles, alongside short-term concerns regarding regulatory risks in India and market sentiment.

title: Global PC shipments rise 9.3% in Q4 and 9.1% in 2025 on higher demand, Windows 11 upgrade: Gartner
summary: Global PC shipments saw significant growth in Q4 2025 and for the full year 2025, with a 9.3% increase in the last quarter and 9.1% for the entire year, according to Gartner. This surge is attributed to robust consumer demand and business upgrades driven by Windows 11, along with factors like tariff hikes and anticipated memory price increases. Lenovo led the market in both Q4 and the full year 2025 regarding shipment volume and market share.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL is American National Bank & Trust's 3rd Largest Position
summary: American National Bank & Trust increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 1.6%, making it their third-largest holding valued at $50.59 million. The article details recent institutional investor activities, positive and negative sentiments impacting Apple, including AI integration with Google's Gemini and upcoming earnings, balanced against regulatory risks and recent selloffs. It also provides Apple's stock performance metrics, dividend information, insider trading activity, and analyst ratings.

title: Apple Slides 3.45% as Trump’s Greenland Tariff Warning
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) shares fell 3.45% to $246.70 after renewed geopolitical concerns, including Trump's tariff warnings regarding Greenland, and ongoing questions about Apple's product and AI roadmap. The decline occurred amidst a broader market downturn driven by "risk-off" sentiment and overshadowing positive indicators like the anticipated iPhone 17 cycle and strong December quarter demand. Investors are closely watching the $244.50–$246.70 range for clues on market conviction, particularly ahead of Apple's January 29 earnings report and the iPhone Fold launch.

title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) UBS Securities Maintains “Hold” Rating
summary: UBS Securities has maintained a "Hold" rating on Apple Inc. (AAPL) with a $280.00 price target. Analyst David Vogt believes that while Apple's strong ecosystem and recurring services revenue are long-term strengths, much of this upside is already factored into the stock's current valuation. Near-term uncertainties include iPhone upgrade cycles and softer consumer spending, limiting significant upside without new catalysts for earnings growth.

title: MP Materials Stock Gains Momentum from Strategic Government Support
summary: MP Materials (US5533681012) stock has seen significant growth, surging over 36% year-to-date, driven by substantial government support, strategic partnerships, and its vital role in U.S. national security for critical minerals. Key factors include a ten-year Department of Defense offtake agreement for NdPr products, a $400 million government investment, a magnet manufacturing facility in Texas, and a partnership with Apple. Despite strong backing and analyst optimism, the company faces risks related to unproven heavy rare-earth production, China's market dominance, and an unclear timeline to sustained profitability.

title: Spotify Premium Price Hikes Test User Loyalty And Profit Potential
summary: Spotify Technology is raising Premium subscription prices in the U.S. and some international markets, marking its third price adjustment recently. This move challenges user loyalty and could impact subscriber churn, revenue mix, and competition with rivals like Apple Music and Amazon Music. For investors, the focus is on subscriber reaction and how increased pricing power might influence margins, while users evaluate whether the broader audio bundle justifies the higher cost.

title: 3 Things Investors Need to Know About Goldman Sachs Stock in 2026
summary: Goldman Sachs delivered strong fourth-quarter earnings, driven by robust investment banking activity that CEO David Solomon expects to accelerate in 2026. The bank is also transitioning out of its Apple Card program and is embracing AI to improve efficiency and redirect resources towards asset and wealth management. With its current valuation and future tailwinds, the article suggests Goldman Sachs stock has potential for further upside.

title: Gary Black Says Tesla Won't Be 'Winner-Take-All' As Far As Autonomy Is Concerned, But A 'Blackberry Moment' Is Coming For OEMs Not In The Race
summary: Investor Gary Black predicts that automakers failing to invest in autonomous driving technology will experience a "BlackBerry moment," similar to how BlackBerry was left behind by smartphone innovations. While he doesn't believe Tesla will be the sole victor in autonomy, he emphasizes the critical competitive advantage offered by unsupervised autonomous driving. Black questions the low adoption rate of Tesla's Full Self-Driving and notes that FSD will soon be subscription-only.

title: Arthur J. Gallagher (AJG): 3 Reasons We Love This Stock
summary: Arthur J. Gallagher's (AJG) shares have underperformed the S&P 500 recently, but the company demonstrates strong fundamentals. The integration and evolution of these open standards are also enabling broader applications beyond traditional media, such as architectural visualization and web-based 3D models.

However, the company faces headwinds from regulatory and legal risks, coupled with significant insider selling.

title: Spirepoint Private Client LLC Purchases 2,578 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Spirepoint Private Client LLC increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) by 3.0%, purchasing an additional 2,578 shares, bringing its total holdings to 89,872 shares valued at $21.8 million. title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL Shares Sold by Greenleaf Trust

title: BCS Wealth Management Trims Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL

summary: Over the past year, Apple insiders have sold US$23 million worth of shares, with no insider purchases recorded. The largest sale was by Arthur Levinson for US$21 million at US$232 per share, and Chris Kondo recently sold US$1 million. Despite this, Apple is profitable, growing, and has high insider ownership, yet the sales suggest some hesitancy among insiders.

title: MACOM Technology stock price target raised to $215 by Stifel on growth outlook
summary: Stifel has raised its price target on MACOM Technology Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSI) to $215 from $185, maintaining a Buy rating, citing confidence in MACOM's future performance and long-term growth prospects. The semiconductor company's stock is currently trading above this new target. The revision is based on anticipated gross margins exceeding 58% and operating margins above 25% due to its Wolfspeed RF acquisition and growth across key end markets.

title: The Truth About Knowles Corp: Is This Quiet Audio Giant About To Go Viral?
summary: Knowles Corp, a behind-the-scenes maker of micro-acoustic components for various devices, is exploring how to gain more visibility. While not a mainstream brand, its technology is crucial for high-quality audio in hearables, wearables, and smartphones. The article explores whether Knowles, despite its currently subdued stock performance, has the potential to become a significant player in the evolving audio technology landscape.

title: Howard Capital Management Exits Graphic Packaging Holding Company with $20.92 Million Sale
summary: Howard Capital Management has sold its entire stake in Graphic Packaging Holding Company (GPK) for $20.92 million, signaling a pessimistic view on the company's future. This move shifts its portfolio focus towards tech giants, away from the cyclical industrial sector, following poor Q3 performance and increased debt for Graphic Packaging. Wall Street analysts currently forecast a modest rise for GPK's stock but have recently downgraded ratings and price targets due to deteriorating fundamentals and management changes.

title: The Truth About Qualcomm Inc: Is QCOM The Sneaky Tech Stock Everyone’s Sleeping On?
summary: This article analyzes Qualcomm (QCOM) as a potentially undervalued tech stock, highlighting its central role in powering many devices despite not being a flashy consumer brand. It delves into Qualcomm's strategy of focusing on on-device AI, its strong presence in smartphones, and its expansion into automotive, PC, and XR markets. The piece contrasts Qualcomm's positioning against competitors like Apple and Nvidia, suggesting it's a solid long-term investment for those who believe in "AI everywhere" rather than a quick speculative play.

title: Is Netflix Stock (NFLX) a Buy Ahead of Q4 Earnings?
summary: Ahead of its Q4 earnings report, analysts are divided on Netflix (NFLX) stock. While some maintain a "Buy" rating, citing potential growth in global ads and revenue, others hold a "Hold" rating due to concerns over high valuation, intense competition, economic headwinds, and the pending Warner Bros. Discovery deal. Investors will be looking for insights on subscriber growth, advertising revenue, profitability, and 2026 guidance.

title: Apple stock slips after India antitrust warning; AAPL traders brace for key dates
summary: Apple Inc. shares slipped after an antitrust warning from India's competition watchdog regarding its App Store policies, potentially leading to significant fines. The Delhi High Court will revisit Apple's challenge on January 27, while investors also await Apple's quarterly earnings release on January 29. Additionally, Apple and Google are being pressured by advocacy groups to remove X and Grok from their app stores due to concerns over sexually explicit AI-generated images.

title: Liberty All-Star® Growth Fund, Inc. December 2025 Monthly Update
summary: The Liberty All-Star® Growth Fund, Inc. (NYSE: ASG) released its December 2025 monthly update, detailing its investment approach, top 20 holdings, monthly performance, sector breakdown, new holdings, and liquidated holdings. The fund, managed by Weatherbie Capital, Congress Asset Management, and Westfield Capital Management, focuses on all-cap growth. As of month-end December 2025, the fund had net assets of $368.3 million and reported a monthly performance of -2.17% for NAV.

title: Bank of America Securities Maintains Hold Rating on HP Inc. (HPQ) Stock
summary: Bank of America Securities analyst Wamsi Mohan has maintained a "Hold" rating on HP Inc. (HPQ) stock with a $26.00 price objective. The rating is based on factors that balance the company's opportunities and risks, such as diversifying suppliers and focusing on higher-margin peripherals to cushion elevated memory costs. HP Inc. also debuted new AI PC technology at CES 2026, though the analyst notes these actions primarily stabilize earnings rather than fuel significant upside.

title: Flutter Entertainment stock hits 52-week low at 189.31 USD
summary: Flutter Entertainment PLC's stock has hit a 52-week low at $189.31, reflecting a 21.93% decrease over the past year and a 32.13% drop in the last six months. Despite its current trading below Fair Value and not being profitable last year, analysts maintain a strong buy consensus with price targets ranging from $222 to $380, citing expected net income and sales growth. The company also recently reported a significant decline in online sports betting revenue during the NFL’s Wild Card weekend and has seen several price target adjustments from research firms.

title: Vanguard’s $10.8B ETF Made 19% Betting on AI Infrastructure
summary: The Vanguard Mega Cap Index Fund ETF (MGC) returned 19% over the past year by concentrating nearly a quarter of its $10.8 billion assets in Apple, NVIDIA, and Microsoft, leveraging the boom in AI infrastructure spending. While this concentrated approach has driven strong performance, it also introduces significant concentration risk from potential volatility in these key holdings. For investors seeking broader exposure, the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) offers diversification across over 160 growth companies with similar mega-cap tech exposure.

title: Penn Davis McFarland Dumps 498,000 SiriusXM Shares
summary: Penn Davis McFarland sold 498,032 shares of Sirius XM Holdings (SIRI) during the fourth quarter of 2025, an estimated $10.71 million trade. This transaction significantly reduced the fund's position in SiriusXM, now accounting for only 0.26% of its AUM, largely due to the stock's massive 59.87% decline over the past year. The divestment suggests the fund likely responded to the stock's poor performance and the company's challenges with subscriber retention and competition from streaming services.

title: Global Equity ETF Approaches Peak Amid Institutional Demand
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF is nearing its 52-week high, driven by strong institutional interest and the robust performance of the technology sector, particularly after impressive results from TSMC. The fund has seen significant inflows, attracting $550.6 million last week, despite some recommendations to underweight U.S. equities. Its concentration in major U.S. tech firms like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, along with a notable surge in its silver miners component, highlights its current trajectory and potential for further momentum.

title: Progress Software to Post Q4 Earnings: What's in Store for the Stock?
summary: Progress Software (PRGS) is scheduled to release its fourth-quarter 2025 results on January 20, 2026, with an expected non-GAAP revenue range of $250-$256 million and earnings between $1.29-$1.35 per share. Analysts anticipate a slight year-over-year earnings decline but significant revenue growth, driven by a diversified product portfolio, high customer retention, AI integration, and the ShareFile acquisition. Despite strong operational factors, the company holds a Zacks Rank #3 and an Earnings ESP of 0.00%, suggesting it might not beat earnings expectations according to Zacks' model.

title: Benchmark reiterates Buy rating on Porch Group stock, sees housing recovery
summary: Benchmark has reiterated its Buy rating and $21.00 price target for Porch Group Inc. (NASDAQ:PRCH), making it a top investment pick for 2026 due to an anticipated housing recovery. The firm believes Porch Group can achieve its $600 million reciprocal written premium target for 2026 without additional M&A and expects the company to beat and raise guidance again. Despite a recent stock dip, analysts maintain a strong buy consensus with significant upside potential.

title: Watts Water Technologies stock hits all-time high at 297.81 USD
summary: Watts Water Technologies Inc. reached an all-time high of $297.81, reflecting a 43.39% appreciation over the past year. The company boasts a strong financial health rating, maintains dividend payments for 40 consecutive years, and recently completed two strategic acquisitions, Saudi Cast and Superior Boiler. Analyst firms have issued price targets and ratings, indicating a positive outlook for the company's growth potential.

title: SCHD vs VIG: Which One Will Outperform in 2026?
summary: This article analyzes two popular dividend ETFs, SCHD and VIG, to determine which might outperform in 2026. While VIG has shown better total returns over the last five years due to its higher tech exposure, the author argues that SCHD is a better choice for true dividend investing given its higher yield and because a potential market rotation out of tech stocks could hurt VIG. The piece delves into the characteristics, historical performance, and sector allocations of both ETFs to provide a recommendation.

title: Micron Celebrates Official Groundbreaking at New York Megafab Site
summary: Micron Technology has officially broken ground on its $100 billion leading-edge memory manufacturing complex in Onondaga County, New York. This facility will be the largest semiconductor facility in the United States, creating 50,000 jobs and positioning New York as a global leader in advanced manufacturing. The project is a cornerstone of Micron's broader U.S. expansion vision, supported by significant community investment and partnerships with government, academic, and industry leaders.

title: Amazon Will Be America’s First $1T Revenue Company
summary: Amazon is projected to become the first U.S. company to achieve $1 trillion in annual revenue by 2028, surpassing current leaders like Walmart and Apple. This growth is anticipated due to its current revenue trajectory, with significant acceleration expected from its AWS cloud computing division, particularly through leveraging artificial intelligence partnerships and substantial data center expansions. While other companies like Nvidia are growing rapidly, Amazon's combination of existing scale and AI-driven potential positions it to reach this milestone first.

title: Why the stock market could broaden sustainably beyond U.S. large-cap growth
summary: This article suggests that the stock market is likely to broaden sustainably beyond U.S. large-cap growth stocks, driven by factors such as the increasing capital intensity of AI for mega-caps, converging earnings growth across different market segments, and favorable relative valuations. The authors outline a four-part framework, arguing that the AI arms race, while costly for large-cap growth companies, could benefit other market segments as the focus shifts to AI adopters and interest rates potentially decrease. Diversified exposure is recommended, acknowledging the potential durability of U.S. large-cap growth leadership.
authors: Tedd Alexander, David Corris, CFA, Brian Dausch, CFA

title: Spotify: Buy The Dip As $12.99 Price Takes Hold (NYSE:SPOT)
summary: Spotify (NYSE:SPOT) is seen as a compelling buy despite a recent 35% decline, with its fundamentals remaining strong due to subscriber loyalty and the impending full-year benefit of price increases in the U.S. and Europe. The new $12.99 pricing plan is expected to drive significant revenue growth in FY26, differentiating it from competitors like Apple Music through premium features. The article suggests that current analyst revenue growth estimates for FY26 are conservative given the company's momentum.

title: Alphabet Tops $4 Trillion Valuation as AI Momentum Runs Hot
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) has reached a $4 trillion valuation for the first time, becoming the world's second most valuable company, primarily driven by its AI momentum. A key catalyst was the partnership with Apple, integrating Google’s Gemini AI into the next generation of Siri, enhancing Gemini's distribution. Additionally, Alphabet's diversification, particularly through the expansion of its Wing drone delivery service with Walmart, contributes to its long-term growth prospects.

title: U.S. economic indicators suggest momentum in consumer spending - Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts have revised their 2026 U.S. economic outlook for stronger growth and a lower unemployment rate, citing recent data showing momentum in consumer spending, less downside risk to labor markets, and limited inflation pressures. This positive forecast is made while expecting Federal Reserve interest rate cuts in the second half of 2026 due to some disinflation. Key indicators supporting this view include better-than-expected retail sales, a dip in initial jobless claims, and stable core inflation.

title: Sunrun, Nation's Largest Residential Solar Provider, Joins Business Moratorium Against Deep Sea Mining
summary: Sunrun Inc., the largest residential solar and storage company in the U.S., has joined a business moratorium against deep seabed mining, becoming the first solar company to do so. This commitment follows engagement with shareholder representative As You Sow, emphasizing that clean energy development should not compromise ocean ecosystems. Sunrun joins over 70 companies in calling for a halt to deep sea mining until comprehensive scientific assessments prove it can avoid biodiversity loss, with many countries also advocating for a precautionary pause.

title: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. Launches Ragnarok: The New World, Achieving Top Rankings in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau on Launch Day
summary: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. announced the successful launch of its new open-world MMORPG, Ragnarok: The New World, in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau. The game quickly rose to the top rank in both free downloads and gross revenue on the Apple App Store across all three regions. Developed by Gravity Game Vision, the title features innovative mechanics like flying vehicles and enhanced convenience systems, contributing to significant pre-launch interest and strong initial market performance.

title: Ragnarok: The New World Ranked No.1 of Apple App Store in Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau
summary: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. announced that its new open-world MMORPG, Ragnarok: The New World, launched on January 15, 2026, has achieved top rankings in the Apple App Store across Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau. The game secured the number one spot for both free downloads and top grossing categories in all three regions, demonstrating strong interest before and after its official launch. Gravity attributes this success to the game's enhanced features, improved monetization system, and the enduring popularity of the Ragnarok IP.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG Stake Reduced by State of Alaska Department of Revenue
summary: The State of Alaska Department of Revenue reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. ($GOOG) by 3.2% in Q3 2025, selling 23,571 shares and now holding 707,187 shares valued at $172.24 million. title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Sold by JB Capital LLC
summary: JB Capital LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 7.0% in Q3, selling 10,897 shares and retaining 143,697 shares valued at $36.59 million. title: PayPal (PYPL) 2026 Deep Dive: Navigating the AI Pivot and the BNPL Regulatory Rollercoaster
summary: This article provides a deep dive into PayPal's strategic direction in 2026, focusing on its pivot to an AI-driven, omnichannel ecosystem under CEO Alex Chriss. It also examines the company's financial performance, competitive landscape, and the significant impact of the fluctuating regulatory environment surrounding the Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) sector. The piece concludes by assessing PayPal's risks, opportunities, and overall investor sentiment, highlighting its transition from a high-growth company to a more mature value play.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG is Cortland Associates Inc. MO's 9th Largest Position

However, insider selling, legal challenges regarding AI training data, and operational constraints like data center hookups present potential future headwinds for the company.

title: Ragnarok: The New World hits No.1 Apple charts in Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau
summary: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. announced that its new game, Ragnarok: The New World, launched on January 15, 2026, has achieved significant success in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau. It also topped the grossing charts in Taiwan and Macau and reached #3 in Hong Kong, demonstrating strong user interest and market performance.

title: How InterDigital Turns Its Intellectual Property Into Cold, Hard Cash
summary: InterDigital (NASDAQ: IDCC) employs a unique business model, licensing its extensive intellectual property rather than producing its own products, which has led to significant financial growth. The company's revenue and profits have surged, particularly driven by new licensing deals with major tech companies like Apple, Amazon, and Samsung, and renewed contracts with existing licensees. This strategy has resulted in substantial returns for shareholders through increased earnings, dividends, and stock repurchases, despite the cyclical nature of its revenue tied to technological adoption.

title: The iShares MSCI World ETF: A Portfolio Dominated by Technology Titans

Despite strong performance, investors should consider its valuation, liquidity, and sensitivity to tech earnings and rebalancing impacts.

title: LPL Financial LLC Reduces Stake in High Income Securities Fund
summary: LPL Financial LLC has reduced its stake in the High Income Securities Fund (PCF) by 8.58%, decreasing its holdings by 125,958 shares. title: SK Telecom Expands National AI Model Into Multimodal Platform
summary: SK Telecom has advanced to the second phase of a government-led "Independent AI Foundation Model" project, aiming to establish a national-level AI system. The company plans to expand its proprietary A.X K1 model into a multimodal platform capable of understanding text, images, voice, and video, and will extend its training to five languages. This initiative positions SK Telecom to collaborate with over 20 partners and compete with global big tech AI models.

title: John Hennessy Sells 600 Shares of Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) Stock
summary: John Hennessy, a director at Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG), sold 600 shares of the company's stock on January 13th for a total of $202,512, reducing his holding by 2.75%. The article also highlights recent positive catalysts like Apple's adoption of Google's Gemini, alongside ongoing legal and operational challenges for the tech giant.

title: Insider Selling: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Director Sells 600 Shares of Stock
summary: Alphabet Director John Hennessy sold 600 shares of GOOGL stock for $202,512 on January 13th, reducing his stake by 2.75%. Despite the insider selling, Alphabet's stock traded down 0.9% to $332.78, with a market capitalization of $4.02 trillion, and the company recently surpassed quarterly EPS and revenue expectations. title: CORRECTION -- Adams Diversified Equity Fund Announces 2025 Performance
summary: Adams Diversified Equity Fund (ADX) announced a correction to its 2025 performance report, changing a typographical error from 2.4% to 2.7%. The Fund's CEO, Jim Haynie, expressed satisfaction with their 18.9% return, crediting it to strong performance relative to their benchmark and peer group.

title: AppFolio appoints Saori Casey to streamlined board
summary: AppFolio (APPF) has reduced its Board of Directors from nine to seven members and appointed Saori Casey, CFO of Sonos, as an independent Class II director, effective February 12, 2026. Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, rates APPF as "Outperform" due to strong financial performance and positive corporate events, despite high valuation concerns.

title: Apple's (AAPL) AI-Powered Siri and Foldable iPhone Are Key Catalysts, Analyst Says
summary: BofA Securities analyst Wamsi Mohan reiterated a Buy rating on Apple (AAPL) with a $325.00 price target, foreseeing upside surprises driven by a foldable iPhone and AI-enhanced Siri. The analyst expects robust iPhone demand and continued double-digit services revenue growth, despite Apple shares lagging early in 2026. Mohan projects strong Q1 2026 revenue and EPS, ahead of Street estimates, and anticipates higher margins in Q2.

title: Costco stock edges higher after-hours after board declares $1.30 dividend
summary: Costco (COST) stock rose 0.6% after hours following the announcement of a $1.30 quarterly dividend, payable February 13th. This news comes amid recent positive sales figures, with December net sales climbing 8.5% and comparable sales up 6.2%. Investors are also monitoring an upcoming shareholder meeting and the release of January sales numbers.

title: D James Bidzos Sells 5,000 Shares of VeriSign (NASDAQ:VRSN) Stock
summary: D. James Bidzos, CEO of VeriSign (NASDAQ:VRSN), sold 5,000 shares of the company's stock on January 13th for $1.241 million, reducing his ownership by 1.19%. VeriSign's stock is currently trading near $249, has a market cap of $23.1 billion, and carries a consensus Hold rating from analysts with an average target price of $282.00.

title: Millennium Management LLC Reduces Stake in Vanda Pharmaceuticals Inc
summary: Millennium Management LLC significantly reduced its stake in Vanda Pharmaceuticals Inc. by 48.35% on December 31, 2025, selling 1,571,823 shares at $8.82 each. The firm's decision may stem from Vanda Pharmaceuticals being overvalued with negative growth indicators, a GF Value of $5.21 against its current trading price of $7.45. This move minimally impacted Millennium Management's portfolio, reflecting a strategic adjustment to perceived risks in the biotechnology company.

title: FMR LLC Reduces Stake in Treehouse Foods Inc: Analyzing the Impl
summary: FMR LLC significantly reduced its stake in Treehouse Foods Inc by 76.78% on December 31, 2025, although it still retains a 1.60% position. This reduction may stem from Treehouse Foods' challenging financial metrics, including a low GF Score of 57/100, poor balance sheet, and financial distress indicators. Investors are advised to carefully consider the risks given the company's valuation as a potential value trap and its modest growth and momentum ranks.

title: Fund delivering 25.7% return and 8.1% payout tops S&P 500 in 2025
summary: Adams Diversified Equity Fund (NYSE: ADX) announced its 2025 performance, reporting a market-price total return of 25.7% and a NAV total return of 18.9%, outperforming the S&P 500's 17.9%. The fund also distributed $1.85 per share, equating to an 8.1% annual distribution rate on NAV, and saw its net assets increase to over $3 billion. Information Technology remains its largest sector holding, with top positions in companies like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft.

title: Gene Munster Says Apple's Move From OpenAI's ChatGPT To Google Gemini Significantly Raises Chances Of New Siri Succeeding: 'Nice Job'
summary: Gene Munster, managing partner at Deepwater Asset Management, believes Apple's decision to switch from OpenAI's ChatGPT to Google Gemini for its new Siri significantly increases the chances of Siri's success. He praised Apple CEO Tim Cook for addressing Siri's long-standing weaknesses and leveraging the partnership for future growth in devices and services. This move signals a more serious approach from Apple towards enhancing Apple Intelligence, according to Munster.

title: Gonzales, Ares commercial real estate CFO, sells $30,639 in stock
summary: Jeffrey Michael Gonzales, CFO and Treasurer of Ares Commercial Real Estate Corp (ACRE), sold 6,218 shares of common stock for $30,639 to cover tax obligations. Despite the sale, Gonzales directly owns 88,533 shares, including restricted stock units. Recent company news highlights strong Q3 2025 financial results with significant EPS and revenue surprises, and an increased credit facility with Wells Fargo.

title: Lantz Financial Doubles Down on Harbor Long-Term Growers ETF Position, Adding $4 Million
summary: Lantz Financial LLC significantly increased its investment in the Harbor Long-Term Growers ETF (NYSE:WINN) by purchasing an additional 125,500 shares, bringing its total investment to $3.93 million. This transaction elevates WINN to Lantz Financial's 14th-largest holding, representing 1.57% of its reportable U.S. equity AUM. Despite WINN's strong past performance, the article highlights its concentrated exposure to the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, higher expense ratio, and elevated price-to-earnings ratio compared to a broad S&P 500 ETF, suggesting individual investors might consider a more selective approach.

title: Caterpillar stock rises as new Construction Industries chief named, AI power demand stays in focus
summary: Caterpillar shares rose by nearly 2% on Thursday, reaching near-peak levels, following the announcement of Rod Shurman as the new head of Construction Industries, effective February 1st. Investors are increasingly optimistic about Caterpillar's energy and transportation segments, driven by strong demand for data centers and power infrastructure, leading analysts like Citigroup's Kyle Menges to raise price targets. Despite this, the stock remains susceptible to volatility from fluctuating construction and mining demands, and potential slowdowns in data-center spending.

title: Adams Diversified Equity Fund Announces 2025 Performance
summary: Adams Diversified Equity Fund (ADX) announced an 18.9% total return on its net asset value for 2025, outperforming the S&P 500 Index and Morningstar U.S. Large Blend Category. The Fund distributed $1.85 per share in dividends and capital gains, representing an 8.1% annual distribution rate. Key holdings include NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, and the fund maintains a significant allocation to Information Technology.

title: ASML value soars above US$500bn on TSMC’s outlook
summary: ASML Holding NV's market capitalization surpassed US$500 billion, making it only the third European company to reach this milestone, following an optimistic outlook from key client Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC). TSMC's strong forecast for capital spending, driven by the AI boom, significantly boosted ASML's shares and highlighted its critical role as the sole producer of advanced lithography machines needed for chip manufacturing. This surge provides positive sentiment for the market and offers European investors a gateway into the mainstream AI trade.

title: A Comprehensive Look at the iShares Russell 3000 ETF
summary: The iShares Russell 3000 ETF offers investors a single solution for exposure to the broad U.S. equity market, tracking 98% of investable U.S. stocks. The fund, which employs a full replication strategy and market-capitalization weighting, began 2026 with an AI-driven "January rally" tempered by valuation concerns. A significant structural change for the fund will be the transition to semi-annual index reconstitution for the Russell US Index family, starting in June 2026, which aims to enhance responsiveness and market reflection.

title: BlackRock Earnings: Market Gains and Record Inflows Drive AUM and Revenue to New Highs
summary: BlackRock reported record assets under management (AUM) of $14.042 trillion at the end of December 2025, driven by strong market gains and record inflows, especially into its iShares ETF platform. Morningstar analysts expect to increase their fair value estimate for BlackRock stock from $1,170 to $1,200 per share, viewing the shares as slightly undervalued despite anticipating potential headwinds from governmental policies. The firm's organic AUM growth rate of 8.6% for the fourth quarter significantly outperformed expectations and its peers.

title: Apple makes high-stakes Siri change as Services growth takes center stage
summary: Apple is partnering with Google to integrate Google's Gemini models into Siri, aiming to significantly improve the virtual assistant and drive growth in its Services sector. This move helps Apple "buy time" to enhance its own AI capabilities while potentially boosting iPhone sales and the higher-margin Services revenue. While leveraging a competitor's AI, Apple intends to maintain its privacy standards through on-device and Private Cloud Compute processing, ultimately seeking to attract more users to its ecosystem.

title: Is Verizon down? Outage resolved after more than 1.5 million reports

title: With Its Google Gemini Deal, Apple Just Made Its Most Intelligent Move Yet
summary: Apple has announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Google to integrate Google's Gemini AI models into Apple Intelligence features, including an overhaul of the Siri voice assistant. This collaboration marks a significant shift for Apple, which has historically preferred to develop its own core technologies. The deal allows Apple to leverage Google's advanced AI capabilities, addressing its perceived lag in the AI space and focusing its efforts strategically without having to build the entire AI infrastructure itself.

Ives's prediction comes despite Tesla's Robotaxi service missing previous self-imposed deadlines and the strong performance of competitors like Waymo.

title: HB Wealth Management LLC Acquires 18,495 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOG

title: Lewis Asset Management LLC Raises Holdings in Apple Inc. $AAPL

This move comes as Apple establishes a multi-year AI partnership with Google and launches Apple Creator Studio, initiatives expected to boost its Services growth. title: Is This Stock Quietly Setting Up Long-Term Investors for Massive Gains?
summary: Comfort Systems USA (NYSE: FIX) is positioned for long-term gains due to its role in the AI data center boom, providing critical HVAC services to keep AI chips cool. The company's strategic acquisitions have expanded its national presence to 184 locations in 139 cities, and it recently increased its dividend by 20%, reflecting strong financial health and growth prospects. title: Is iShares Core S&P U.S. Growth ETF (IUSG) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares Core S&P U.S. Growth ETF (IUSG), launched on July 24, 2000, is a smart beta ETF designed to track the S&P 900 Growth Index, offering exposure to the large and mid-capitalization growth sector of the U.S. equity market. title: Baron Wealth Management LLC Has $9.11 Million Holdings in Apple Inc. $AAPL

title: Direxion Daily AAPL Bear 1X Shares (NASDAQ:AAPD) Trading Down 0.2% – Should You Sell?

title: Ranking of most iconic U.S. companies includes 3 in Ohio

The ranking includes historical giants like Colgate-Palmolive and modern innovators such as OpenAI, with three Ohio-based companies—Wendy's, Kroger, and Procter & Gamble—making the esteemed list. The methodology for identifying these iconic companies considered factors like recognition, cultural significance, emotional connection, and resilience.

title: Google Shares Jump After Hours on Apple Deal to Integrate Gemini With Siri
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc. (GOOG), saw its shares jump after Apple announced a deal to integrate Google's Gemini AI into Siri as part of its Apple Intelligence platform. This partnership positions Gemini as a core engine for Siri, potentially boosting Alphabet's valuation and AI revenue growth, despite competitive pressures from OpenAI. The market reacted positively, while some, like Elon Musk, raised concerns about power concentration.

title: Technology Sector Powers Strong Returns for iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown strong performance, reaching new 52-week highs primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The fund, with $6.97 billion in assets and significant investor inflows, tracks the MSCI World Index and achieved a 21.28% return in 2025. It maintains a strong concentration in U.S. equities and the technology sector, with major holdings like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft.

title: KeyBanc maintains Sector Weight rating on Apple stock amid mixed spending data

While KeyBanc's spending index for Apple showed a 22% month-over-month increase, it lagged the three-year average, and December spending fell below its average for the first time since July. The firm anticipates Apple's fiscal first-quarter results to meet or exceed guidance, but maintains a neutral stance due to factors like varying iPhone activity and challenging comparisons.

title: RedTape founders look to sell majority stake, approach Blackstone, KKR
summary: The founders of Indian footwear company RedTape are seeking to sell a majority or even their entire stake, valued at nearly $510 million, and have approached private equity firms Blackstone and KKR through financial adviser Ernst and Young. The Mirza family's 71.8% holding could be fully divested if the valuation is favorable, with a 50% stake alone estimated at $355.58 million. RedTape, which competes with global brands, saw revenue increase by 9.7% to $223.91 million in FY 2024-25, though net profit declined.

title: Riding the AI Wave: iShares MSCI World ETF Maintains Momentum
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown significant momentum, trading near its 52-week high in early 2026, largely driven by its substantial allocation to US technology giants and beneficiaries of the AI wave. The ETF slightly outperformed its benchmark in 2025, despite its focused exposure to developed markets and higher expense ratio compared to more diversified global peers. Its performance, however, comes with notable concentration risks due to its heavy weighting in tech and AI-related stocks.

title: Synaptics Incorporated (NASDAQ:SYNA) Given Consensus Rating of "Moderate Buy" by Brokerages
summary: Synaptics Incorporated (NASDAQ:SYNA) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from fourteen brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $92.56. summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) Class C shares rose 1.1% in after-hours trading following news of Apple's plan to integrate Google's Gemini AI models into Siri and other AI features. Investors are closely watching how AI advancements will impact revenue and costs, and whether this high-profile deal will boost Gemini usage and Google Cloud demand.

title: Intel stock rises on analyst upgrade citing data center AI demand, 'significant progress' in manufacturing
