Analyst John Vinh indicated that Intel's data center server CPUs are nearly sold out for the year and suggested a potential deal with Apple to use Intel's 18A-P process for Mac and iPad chips, along with future iPhone chips. This upgrade highlights renewed confidence in Intel's manufacturing turnaround and its potential to become a leading foundry supplier.

According to one strategist, this indicates that the index could be ready to move higher.

title: Shutterstock celebrates 15th birthday by sharing posters of important events - iPhone, Facebook, Pokémon Go, and more

These events include major technological milestones like the launch of Facebook and the first iPhone, as well as global happenings such as Angela Merkel becoming Chancellor and the #MeToo movement. The company's founder and CEO, Jon Oringer, highlighted Shutterstock's growth and its future focus on enhancing its creative platform with AI technology.

title: GPIX ETF 8% Monthly Yield and S&P 500 Upside at $53
summary: The article analyzes the Goldman Sachs S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX), highlighting its 8% monthly yield and structure designed to capture S&P 500 upside with a dynamic covered-call strategy. GPIX uniquely blends exposure to "Magnificent 7" tech stocks with a flexible overwrite mechanism (25%-75%) to generate income while aiming to avoid the common NAV bleed seen in static covered-call funds. The article concludes that GPIX is a buy for investors seeking high, tax-efficient income and exposure to AI-driven tech, while accepting equity-like drawdowns.

title: Qualcomm (QCOM) Downgraded as Handset Drag Limits Upside, Analyst Says

Mizuho also revised down its revenue and earnings forecasts for FY26 and FY27 to below consensus expectations.

title: Apple just straight up robbed Google
summary: Apple is integrating Google's Gemini AI into its Siri assistant, a move the author describes as Apple "robbing" Google by leveraging its advanced AI technology rather than developing its own. This partnership aims to significantly upgrade Siri, which has been criticized as a disappointing product, by directly embedding Gemini's foundational architecture. The integration is expected to offer users a more personalized and capable AI experience later this year, eliminating the need for intermediary AI solutions.

title: Jefferies raises STMicroelectronics stock price target to EUR29 on cycle outlook
summary: Jefferies increased its price target for STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) to EUR29 from EUR26, maintaining a Buy rating. title: Apple Hits Adobe Where It Hurts With an Affordable Creative App Suite

While not a direct feature-for-feature replacement for Adobe's comprehensive suite, Apple's offering presents a much more cost-effective option for many creatives.

title: Will Apple (AAPL) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
summary: Apple (AAPL) is expected to beat its next earnings estimates, continuing a trend of outperforming expectations. title: Why Goldman Sachs stock is down today: Apple Card handoff and CPI sharpen focus on Jan. 15 earnings
summary: Goldman Sachs shares fell by 0.8% ahead of its Jan. 15 earnings report, influenced by the Apple Card partnership handoff to JPMorgan and a cooler core inflation print. title: Here’s What to Expect From Intercontinental Exchange's Next Earnings Report

Despite a slight revenue miss in Q3 2025, analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for ICE, anticipating a 15.2% upside potential from its current stock price.

title: What Happens When Apple Turns to Google for AI Technology? We’re About to Find Out
summary: Apple has announced a partnership with Google to power the next generation of its AI models, specifically for the Apple Intelligence suite and a revamped Siri. The new AI models, based on Google's Gemini, will run on Apple devices and servers and are expected to significantly upgrade Siri's conversational abilities and functions, including answering factual questions, providing emotional support, and generating documents. This collaboration follows Apple's extensive search for an AI partner after its own AI capabilities were deemed a disappointment.

title: Qualcomm Inc (NASDAQ:QCOM) Downgraded To Neutral
summary: Mizuho downgraded Qualcomm Inc (NASDAQ:QCOM) to Neutral from Outperform, lowering its price target to $175 from $200 due to increasing risks related to Apple. The downgrade is attributed to anticipated headwinds in Qualcomm's handset shipments and iPhone content in 2026, as well as softer global handset demand and Apple's push for in-house component design. Despite this, Qualcomm is expanding into robotics, introducing a full-stack architecture for service robots and humanoids, and developing the Dragonwing industrial processor roadmap.

title: Is the Market Overlooking General Mills Stock’s Next Move?
summary: General Mills (GIS) stock is highlighted as a potential value buy due to its current valuation being lower than average, strong margins, and modest P/E ratio. Despite a -5.2% decline year-to-date, the company is implementing cost efficiencies and new product innovations to drive future growth. While its revenue growth has been modest, its strong operating margin and discounted valuation make it an appealing option for investors seeking mean reversion and valuation re-rating potential, though historical drawdowns in crises are noted.

title: Apple Partners With Google's Gemini to Power AI Version of Siri
summary: Apple Inc. is reportedly partnering with Google, integrating Google's Gemini AI models to power a new AI-driven version of Siri. This multiyear deal is a significant move for Apple into the competitive AI space, with reports suggesting Apple could pay Google around $1 billion annually for the technology. The updated Siri, leveraging both Gemini and Apple's own Foundation Models, is expected to launch later this year.

title: Should You Buy, Hold or Sell Goldman Stock Ahead of Its Q4 Earnings?
summary: Goldman Sachs (GS) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings, with Zacks analysts expecting a revenue increase but a slight decline in EPS. Key factors influencing performance include solid market-making revenues, strong investment banking fees driven by M&A and IPO activity, and robust net interest income, despite anticipated rises in general expenses and one-time charges from the Apple Card partnership termination. While the company's long-term prospects are strong due to strategic pivots and AI integration, a somewhat expensive valuation and rising costs suggest investors might consider waiting until after earnings for a more appealing entry point.

title: Apple Revives Validity Challenge to Wireless-Transmission Patent
summary: The Federal Circuit has revived Apple Inc.'s challenge against a wireless data-transmission patent held by Smart Mobile Technologies LLC. The appeals court ruled that the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) was wrong to reject an argument raised by Apple concerning the interpretation of claim limitations involving antennae. This decision is part of ongoing litigation where Smart Mobile Technologies has asserted infringement of over a dozen patents against Apple.

title: Jim Cramer Predicted Apple (AAPL)’s Gemini Deal
summary: Jim Cramer predicted that Apple (AAPL) would integrate Google's Gemini AI into its platform, serving as the sole AI source for the company in 2026. This prediction comes amidst Bernstein reiterating a Buy rating on Apple with a $325 target, despite other analysts raising concerns about Apple's future gains. Cramer continues to advocate for holding Apple stock, dismissing detractors' concerns about weak iPhone performance and lack of AI initiatives.

title: Earnings call transcript: JPMorgan beats Q4 2025 earnings expectations
summary: JPMorgan Chase reported strong fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 financial results, with EPS of $5.23 and revenue of $46.77 billion, exceeding analyst expectations. Despite the beat, the stock showed a modest pre-market increase, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid broader market conditions and potential regulatory shifts. The earnings call discussed the acquisition of the Apple Card portfolio, the outlook for 2026 including NII projections and expense growth driven by strategic investments, and addressed concerns about potential credit card APR caps and capital requirements.

title: Apple Releases Its Answer to Adobe Creative Cloud With New Creator Studio Subscription Bundle
summary: Apple has introduced Creator Studio, a new subscription bundle designed to compete with Adobe Creative Cloud. This service integrates creative apps like Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Pixelmator Pro, offering advanced intelligent features and premium content for video editing, music creation, and visual productivity across Mac, iPad, and iPhone. Available monthly or yearly, with special pricing for students and educators, it provides a comprehensive suite for various creators.

title: Apple Jumps on the Subscription Software Bandwagon. Why Adobe Stock Is Dropping.
summary: Apple announced a new subscription plan for its creative software applications, which is seen as a competitive move against Adobe. The new Creator Studio subscription will cost $12.99 per month or $129 annually. This development adds pressure on Adobe's stock.

title: Apple launches Creator Studio in new subscription package for digital creators
summary: Apple is introducing "Creator Studio," a new subscription package aimed at digital creators, musicians, writers, students, educators, and social media influencers. This suite will bundle several of Apple's professional and productivity applications, including Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, Pixelmator Pro, Keynote, Pages, and Numbers, under a single subscription. The initiative is designed to attract a wider audience of creative professionals and content creators to Apple's ecosystem.

title: Should Retirees Look At John Hancock’s Large Cap ETF, Or Move Along? | JHML
summary: The article evaluates John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) for retirees, concluding that its high technology allocation, modest dividend yield, and recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500 make it unsuitable for income-focused retirement strategies. While JHML has tax efficiency with low turnover, retirees needing cash flow might still face capital gains by selling shares to generate income. The article suggests alternatives like the WisdomTree U.S. Quality Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW) for those seeking both factor exposure and meaningful, growing income.

title: Apple Is Jumping on the Subscription Software Bandwagon. Look Out Adobe.
summary: Apple announced a new subscription plan for its creative software apps, called Creator Studio, priced at $12.99 a month or $129 a year. This move is seen as bringing increased competitive pressure to Adobe. The article suggests this launch is impacting Adobe's stock.

title: Google Now Tops in AI as Alphabet Stock Keeps Rising Past $4 Trillion Milestone
summary: Alphabet's stock continues its record-breaking ascent, officially joining the $4 trillion club and solidifying Google's position as a leading company in artificial intelligence. The new AI darling status for Google's parent company is further bolstered by the announcement that its Gemini AI will power Apple's AI features.

title: Microsoft launches data center initiative to limit power costs, water use
summary: Microsoft has launched a new initiative to address concerns about its data centers' power consumption and water usage in the U.S. The company has pledged to pay utility rates that cover power costs, work with local utilities to expand supply, replenish more water than consumed, and publish water-use information for each data center region. This move comes as political leaders push for AI data center expansion, while local communities express worries about increased utility bills and resource depletion.

title: Apple stock today: Creator Studio debut and Gemini Siri deal keep AAPL in play ahead of earnings
summary: Apple shares saw minimal movement following the launch of its new Creator Studio subscription bundle, as investors weigh the company's shift towards services and a significant AI deal with Google. The market is now focused on Apple's upcoming January 29 earnings report for insights into iPhone sales and the rollout progress of its AI initiatives. This service-focused strategy, including the Creator Studio and an enhanced Siri powered by Google's Gemini, aims to sustain revenue growth amidst varying hardware demand and increasing regulatory scrutiny.

title: Google passes historic $4 trillion threshold
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, has achieved a $4 trillion stock market valuation, becoming only the fourth company to reach this milestone, following Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. This achievement closely followed Apple's announcement that Google Gemini would power the AI version of Siri. While Alphabet's shares rose by about 1 percent after the news, analysts suggest this was more of a cumulative effect given Google's continued dominance in search and growth in AI and hardware.

title: Apple Confirms Partnership With Google Gemini for Siri
summary: Apple has officially confirmed a multi-year partnership with Google, where Google's Gemini models will power the next generation of Siri and Apple Intelligence. This decision comes after Apple's internal evaluations, indicating Gemini offered the most capable foundation for large-scale AI features. Despite past privacy concerns with Google, Apple asserts it will maintain control over user experience, privacy, and system integration, with Gemini running on Apple's infrastructure.

title: JPMorgan Chase Reports 9% Rise in Adjusted Fourth-Quarter Profits
summary: JPMorgan Chase reported a 9% rise in adjusted fourth-quarter profits, with net income reaching $13.0 billion or $4.63 per share. Excluding a $2.2 billion charge for Apple Card loan-loss reserves, adjusted net income was $14.7 billion, or $5.23 per share, exceeding analyst expectations. CEO Jamie Dimon cited strong consumer spending and healthy businesses as key factors contributing to the positive results.

title: Apple Bundles Creative Apps Into New $13-a-Month Subscription
summary: Apple Inc. has launched a new subscription service called Creator Studio, bundling its creative applications like Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Pixelmator Pro for $12.99 per month or $129 annually. This initiative aims to rejuvenate its photo and video editing software offerings amid increasing competition. Students and educators can access the bundle at a discounted rate.

title: Why Apple Chose Google to Power the Future of AI
summary: Apple and Alphabet have formed a strategic partnership to integrate Google's Gemini AI models into Apple's ecosystem, marking a significant shift in the tech landscape. This deal allows Apple to leverage Google's advanced AI capabilities while maintaining its privacy protocols through a hybrid model. The agreement is a win-win, providing Apple with capital efficiency and a sales catalyst for future iPhones, and solidifying Google's position as the industry-standard AI infrastructure provider with access to billions of Apple devices.

title: The Biggest Loser: Tim Cook of Apple
summary: The article argues that Apple CEO Tim Cook has fallen behind in the artificial intelligence race, failing to launch a proprietary state-of-the-art AI product. Instead, Apple has partnered with Alphabet to use Gemini AI software, despite Cook's prior assurances of Apple's leadership in AI. This move places Apple at a disadvantage compared to other tech giants who have developed their own advanced AI technologies.

title: Pro video and music tools in one $13 Apple Creator Studio bundle
summary: Apple has launched its new Apple Creator Studio, a subscription bundle offering professional-grade creative applications like Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Pixelmator Pro, enhanced with AI features. Available for $12.99 per month or $129 per year, the suite aims to empower creators across various disciplines, from video editing and music production to graphic design and visual productivity, on Mac, iPad, and iPhone. The bundle also includes new intelligent tools for Keynote, Pages, and Numbers, along with premium content and a one-month free trial.

title: APPLE INC : JP Morgan gives a Buy rating
summary: JP Morgan analyst Samik Chatterjee has reiterated a Buy rating on Apple Inc. with an unchanged target price of USD 305. The recommendation was published on January 13, 2026, at 08:56 am EST. Apple's stock (AAPL) was trading at 260.25 USD, up 0.34%, in pre-market trading around 09:27 am EST on the same day.

title: What Investors In JPMorgan’s Active Growth ETF Need To Pay Attention To Now
summary: The JPMorgan Active Growth ETF (JGRO) underperformed the S&P 500 over the past year, raising concerns given its 0.44% expense ratio for active management. The ETF's concentrated portfolio, with its top three positions controlling over a quarter of assets and Nvidia alone making up 12%, makes it highly susceptible to movements in mega-cap technology stocks and Federal Reserve policy. Investors should closely monitor the Fed's interest rate decisions and Nvidia's performance to gauge the fund's future direction.

title: Registros de patentes da Apple caíram nos EUA em 2025
summary: A Apple registrou uma queda significativa nos registros de patentes nos EUA em 2025, caindo da quarta para a sexta posição e registrando 2.722 patentes, frente a 3.082 em 2024. Essa redução de 11,68% a coloca ao lado da LG como as únicas empresas do Top 10 com menos patentes concedidas. A queda da Apple alinha-se a uma tendência geral de empresas americanas, que viram uma redução de 9% nas patentes concedidas em 2025, potencialmente impulsionada pela preferência de manter segredos comerciais no cenário da inteligência artificial.

title: Remote Code Execution With Modern AI/ML Formats and Libraries
summary: Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 identified remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities in three open-source AI/ML Python libraries: NVIDIA's NeMo, Salesforce's Uni2TS, and Apple/EPFL's FlexTok. These vulnerabilities arise from the libraries' use of metadata to configure complex models, which, when loaded, execute embedded malicious code. Although no in-the-wild exploits have been found, the affected vendors have released fixes, and Palo Alto Networks products offer protection.

title: Nvidia resets the economics of AI factories, again
summary: Nvidia's recent announcements at CES 2026, particularly the new Vera Rubin platform, have significantly reset the economics of AI factories by introducing extreme co-design across its entire system architecture. This comprehensive redesign solidifies Nvidia's dominant position, widening the gap with competitors and forcing ecosystem players to align with this new paradigm where historical benchmarks like Moore's Law are accelerated tenfold.

title: Apple CEO Steve Jobs Unveils the First iPhone – This Day in History

The iPhone's debut is considered a pivotal moment in tech history, reshaping digital communication and fostering an entire app economy.

title: Breaking the decoding bottleneck: Fast and accurate software decoding for Quantum LDPC codes
summary: IonQ has developed a new Beam Search Decoder for Quantum LDPC codes that significantly improves accuracy and speed for quantum error correction. This software-based decoder, which runs on standard CPUs, challenges the industry assumption that supercomputers are needed for large-scale fault-tolerant quantum computing, particularly for trapped-ion architectures. This innovation allows IonQ to achieve fault-tolerant correction with greater efficiency and lower cost compared to other approaches.

title: Apple, Google Smartwatches Targeted in Trade Agency IP Probe

Alphabet's market capitalization reached $3.94 trillion, ahead of Apple's $3.81 trillion, driven by its focus on artificial intelligence, exemplified by its Gemini 3 model and custom AI chips. This shift is attributed to Alphabet's strong stock performance in 2025, buoyed by AI advancements and cloud business growth, contrasting with Apple's more modest gains and concerns over AI delays.

This event represents a fundamental shift in market sentiment, prioritizing "AI Utility" and "Compute Efficiency" and marking the transition from the mobile age to the agentic AI age.

title: Apple Faces $38 Billion Risk as India Defends Global Turnover Antitrust Law

summary: Globalstar stock crashed 9.6% after a recent surge, despite a positive analyst report the previous day. The decline appears to be linked to a Scotiabank report downgrading rival AST SpaceMobile, which highlighted the superior capabilities and rapid deployment of SpaceX's Starlink, posing a significant competitive threat to both AST and Globalstar. The article suggests Globalstar, which has struggled with profitability, may face an uphill battle against SpaceX's "unstoppable" expansion.

title: Goldman Sachs : Announces Agreement to Transition Apple Card Program to Chase
summary: Goldman Sachs announced an agreement to transition its Apple Card program and associated accounts to Chase, completing the narrowing of its consumer business focus. The transaction is expected to increase Goldman Sachs' fourth-quarter 2025 earnings per share by $0.46, reflecting a significant release of loan loss reserves partially offset by revenue reductions and expenses. The transition is anticipated to take approximately 24 months, during which Goldman Sachs will continue to operate the program.

title: CDW Corp. Stock Underperforms Wednesday When Compared To Competitors
summary: CDW Corp. (CDW) stock underperformed on Wednesday compared to its competitors, closing at $226.79. The stock recorded a daily loss of 2.14%, while its competitors generally saw gains or smaller losses.

title: Apple Credit Card To Be Taken Over By JPMorgan Chase: Report
summary: JPMorgan Chase is reportedly set to take over as the issuer of Apple Inc.'s credit card program from Goldman Sachs Group Inc., a deal that has been under negotiation for over a year. Goldman Sachs will offload approximately $20 million in outstanding credit card balances at a discount of more than $1 billion. This shift will involve new JPMorgan-issued cards for both existing and new Apple customers and the launch of a new Apple savings account.

title: Apple 2026: Major Change Expected (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Apple is expected to undergo significant changes in 2026, including the potential launch of its first foldable iPhone and a shift to a staggered product release schedule for iPhones. While this new release strategy aims to stabilize revenue and supply chains, it might shift some income into 2027. Despite some challenges, the company's valuation remains high, trading at over 31x its 2026 EPS, exceeding its big tech peers by a mid-teens premium.

title: Apple loses Safari designer Marco Triverio to The Browser Company
summary: Apple's lead Safari designer, Marco Triverio, has moved to The Browser Company, creators of the AI-centric browser Dia. This follows a trend of tech industry talent shifts driven by increased competition for AI expertise. The Browser Company now boasts lead designers from "every Safari era," indicating a strong push into the AI browser space.

title: S&P 500 hits new record highs, Alphabet dethrones Apple: What's moving markets Wednesday?
summary: The S&P 500 reached new record highs, driven by strong tech performance, particularly Alphabet which briefly surpassed Apple in market capitalization. This market movement occurred as traders reacted to the latest economic data and anticipated upcoming earning reports.

title: Skyworks Solutions stock tumbles nearly 12% in regular session as SWKS slides on CES week
summary: Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) shares fell nearly 12% during a regular session amid CES 2026, with no immediate catalyst apparent. The selloff comes as the chipmaker aims to diversify beyond smartphones and progresses with its planned acquisition of Qorvo, which is still awaiting regulatory approvals. Investors are also looking ahead to Skyworks' next guidance update, especially given past warnings about the mobile segment impacting results.

title: Alphabet Trades Near Highs as Earnings Power and AI Spend Justify a Premium
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is trading near its 52-week highs, driven by strong earnings growth and significant strategic investments in AI infrastructure, including custom Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) and large-scale energy acquisition for data centers. The company's core advertising business remains robust, complemented by rapid expansion in Google Cloud and other segments, justifying its premium valuation despite market concerns about AI competition and regulatory pressures. The article argues that Alphabet's comprehensive AI strategy, from chip design to power generation, positions it as a foundational layer for future AI and cloud growth, making it a compelling "Buy" despite current high multiples.

title: Intel Launches AI Chip Platform; Stock Surge Expected
summary: Intel's stock has risen by 7.67% following the introduction of its new AI-centric Core Ultra Series 3 processors at CES 2026, which are manufactured in the U.S. Analysts have upgraded Intel to a "Buy" rating, anticipating further stock increases due to potential partnerships with Nvidia and Apple. The company's strategic focus on AI and prudent financial management are positioning it for significant growth and a return to technological leadership.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Corning Outperforms Tech Sector in 6 Months: Should You Invest?
summary: Corning (GLW) has outperformed the broader tech sector and S&P 500 over the past six months, driven by its Springboard plan and growth in AI data centers, solar, and consumer electronics markets. While the company faces challenges like potential supply shortages and reliance on its Display and Optical segments, its innovation and financial discipline are positive factors. Investors should proceed with caution due to these challenges, although analyst estimates have increased, and the stock trades at a discount compared to its industry.

title: The Memory Storm: Apple Faces Margin Compression as Component Costs Surge Ahead of Earnings
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is experiencing margin compression due to surging memory component costs, specifically DRAM and NAND flash, ahead of its Q1 2026 earnings report. This has led to a stock slide and a temporary market capitalization shift to Alphabet Inc., as Apple chooses to absorb these increased costs to maintain stable product pricing. Investors are keenly watching the upcoming earnings call for guidance on gross margins and the growth of its Services segment to assess the company's ability to navigate this "AI tax" on hardware.

title: AAPL: Evercore Calls Apple Top Tech Pick Ahead of Key iPhone Cycle
summary: Evercore ISI has named Apple (AAPL) a top pick in technology hardware, citing strong momentum in its iPhone business and the potential for AI-powered Siri upgrades. The firm believes these factors will drive revenue growth and investor confidence. Evercore also holds positive views on Dell (DELL) and HP Enterprise (HPE), highlighting their supply chain management and strategic shifts, respectively.

title: Apple in focus as Evercore reiterates it as top pick on iPhone strength (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Evercore ISI has reiterated Apple (AAPL) as its top pick in technology hardware, citing the company's strength in iPhone sales. This endorsement highlights Apple's continued market leadership in the sector. Shares of Apple were relatively unchanged in premarket trading following the news.

title: “iPhone 21” terá câmera de 200MP feita pela Samsung, diz Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts suggest that the "iPhone 21," expected in 2028, will feature a 200MP camera supplied by Samsung. This move signifies Apple's effort to diversify its supply chain, moving away from Sony's exclusive sensor provision. The report also anticipates an iPhone with an under-display Face ID in 2027.

title: Qorvo (QRVO) stock drops 8% as Apple-linked chip names slide ahead of U.S. jobs report
summary: Qorvo (QRVO) stock dropped 8% alongside other Apple-linked chipmakers like Skyworks Solutions and Qualcomm, ahead of the U.S. jobs report. The decline was attributed to profit-taking fueled by economic news and concerns related to phone demand, with investors also considering Qorvo's upcoming earnings report and an ongoing merger deal. The stock's fall brought it to a discount relative to the implied value of its merger with Skyworks.

title: How Alphabet surpassed Apple to become the second-most valuable company in the world
summary: Alphabet's market capitalization has soared to $3.89 trillion, surpassing Apple's $3.85 trillion, making it the second-most valuable company globally. This shift is attributed to Google's improved AI positioning and a more than 2% rise in Alphabet's stock on Wednesday. This marks the first time since 2019 that Alphabet has been worth more than Apple, signaling a potential change in market leadership within the technology sector.

title: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2026-2030 (Jan 2026)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive stock price prediction and forecast for Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) from 2026 to 2030. It highlights key drivers such as AI offerings, wearables, and services, projecting significant upside potential based on these factors and historical performance. The forecast, which considers various market conditions and potential geopolitical impacts, suggests Apple's stock could reach $717.90 by 2030, representing over 173% upside.

title: Can Retirees Count on JEPQs 10.4% Dividend and Monthly Payments?
summary: The article examines whether retirees can rely on the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) for its high yield and monthly payouts. JEPQ utilizes a covered call strategy on Nasdaq-100 stocks, leading to fluctuating monthly distributions and potentially capping upside potential in strong bull markets. It also discusses an alternative, the Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD), which offers lower but more predictable dividend growth, suggesting a blended strategy could balance income and growth for retirees.

title: Bolling Harrison Fenner buys LandBridge Co (LB) shares for $39,814 By Investing.com
summary: Bolling Harrison Fenner, Executive Vice President and General Counsel at LandBridge Co LLC, purchased 850 Class A shares of the company for $39,814 on January 5, 2026. This transaction increases his direct holdings to 66,874 Class A shares. The article also mentions recent company developments including an acquisition, a raised price target from Piper Sandler, and a senior notes offering.

title: Mizuho initiates coverage on Palvella Therapeutics stock with Outperform rating
summary: Mizuho has initiated coverage on Palvella Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PVLA) with an Outperform rating and a $205.00 price target, suggesting a 127% upside potential. The firm highlights Palvella's topical formulation platform for orphan skin diseases, specifically noting the upcoming Phase 3 data for QTORIN rapamycin in early 2026 and the strong financial position of the company. Despite recent stock hits and an "overvalued" assessment by InvestingPro, analysts anticipate future revenue generation and continued impressive management.

title: Steve Jobs' childhood belongings, early Apple products up for auction to mark company's 50th anniversary
summary: To commemorate Apple's 50th anniversary, RR Auction is offering over 190 items belonging to Steve Jobs and early Apple products. The collection includes the first Apple Computer, Inc. check signed by Jobs and Wozniak, an Apple-1 prototype motherboard, and personal memorabilia from Jobs' childhood home. Bidding for these historical artifacts is ongoing until January 29.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Acquired by Highland Capital Management LLC
summary: Highland Capital Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. (AAPL) during Q3, now holding 397,834 shares valued at $101.3 million, making it their second-largest position. Despite this institutional accumulation, recent insider selling by Chris Kondo and CFO Kevan Parekh has notably reduced their personal holdings. Apple also reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with an EPS of $1.85 and revenue of $102.47 billion, and maintained its quarterly dividend.

title: Chipmaker Nvidia overtakes Apple as world's highest valued company
summary: Nvidia, the artificial intelligence (AI) chipmaker, has surpassed Apple to become the world's most valuable listed company with over $4.5 trillion in assets, nearly doubling the combined value of Germany's top DAX index companies. The surge is attributed to the "euphoria surrounding new AI applications," with US tech giants dominating the top rankings. European companies, including German automakers, are lagging significantly in this new technology race.

title: Burney Co. Purchases 17,814 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Burney Co. significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) during the third quarter, purchasing an additional 17,814 shares and making Apple its second-largest holding. This move comes as Apple reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst expectations for both EPS and revenue. Despite some insider selling, institutional investors generally boosted their positions in the tech giant.

title: Silicon Sovereignty: Texas Instruments’ SM1 Fab Marks a New Era for American Chipmaking
summary: Texas Instruments has officially begun high-volume production at its $30 billion SM1 fabrication plant in Sherman, Texas, marking a significant milestone for domestic semiconductor manufacturing under the CHIPS and Science Act. This facility focuses on foundational analog and embedded chips critical for various industries, aiming to secure the U.S. supply chain from geopolitical disruptions. The SM1 fab is the first of four planned facilities, highlighting a broader national strategy for "Silicon Resurgence" in America.

title: Should You Invest in the iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF (IGM)?
summary: The iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF (IGM) is a passively managed ETF designed to track the performance of the S&P North American Technology Sector Index, offering broad exposure to the Technology - Broad segment of the equity market. With over $8.89 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.39%, it's considered a medium-risk investment with a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy). Key holdings include Apple, Broadcom, and Nvidia, providing diversified exposure within the technology sector.

title: Sen. Shelley Moore Capito Sells Off Shares of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-West Virginia) recently sold between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock on December 16, 2025. This sale is part of a pattern of recent transactions by the Senator involving other major tech companies like Alphabet and Microsoft. The article also provides a detailed financial overview of Apple, including its recent earnings beat, market capitalization, analyst ratings, and dividend information, alongside broader market sentiment and insider activity.

title: Sen. Shelley Moore Capito Sells Off Shares of Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT)
summary: Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-West Virginia) recently sold between $1,001 and $15,000 of Microsoft (MSFT) stock on December 16, 2025, according to a January 6th filing. This sale is part of a series of tech trades by the Senator, including sales of Apple and Alphabet, and a purchase of Meta Platforms. Microsoft recently exceeded earnings expectations, announced a quarterly dividend, and continues to advance its Azure/AI narrative through strategic initiatives and acquisitions, maintaining a "Moderate Buy" consensus among analysts.

title: Barclays initiates PebbleBrook Hotel Trust stock with Underweight rating By Investing.com
summary: Barclays has initiated coverage on PebbleBrook Hotel Trust (NYSE:PEB) with an Underweight rating and a $10.00 price target, citing concerns over its valuation, predominant West Coast exposure leading to high operating expenses, and balance sheet although InvestingPro data identifies it as undervalued. The firm's outlook is cautious despite ongoing renovations and recovery in the San Francisco market, and the company's consistent dividend payments for 16 years. This news follows a mixed Q3 2025 earnings report and the sale of a property for $44.3 million.

title: The iShares MSCI World ETF: A Concentrated Bet on U.S. Technology
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is increasingly concentrated in U.S. technology stocks, with the U.S. constituting about 70% of its holdings, making its performance closely tied to a few American tech giants. Recent MSCI methodology decisions have temporarily stabilized the fund by postponing the removal of Digital Asset Treasury firms, avoiding significant outflows. However, investors face potential reweighting risks, valuation concerns in the tech sector, and the influence of systematic fund flows.

title: S&P 500 retreats from fresh record highs as Alphabet climb fizzles
summary: The S&P 500 recently pulled back from an intraday all-time high, as a rally in Alphabet lost momentum despite ongoing optimism surrounding AI-driven growth. The market also focused on soft labor market data and geopolitical developments, including a US strike on Venezuela. Investors are also looking forward to upcoming earnings reports from companies like Constellation Brands and monitoring oil price movements tied to international events.

title: HealthStream stock rating reiterated at Market Perform by Citizens
summary: Citizens has reiterated its Market Perform rating on HealthStream (NASDAQ:HSTM). The healthcare workforce development company is currently trading near its 52-week low and is considered slightly undervalued according to InvestingPro Fair Value estimates, despite a premium valuation indicated by higher EV/EBITDA and P/E ratios. Citizens revised HealthStream's Q4 2025 estimates due to CEO stock grants, lowering EBITDA and GAAP EPS projections, while noting the company's strong financial health, cash reserves, and consistent dividend increases.

title: Surrozen exec VP Li Yang sells $22k in shares
summary: Surrozen's Executive Vice President of Research, Li Yang, sold 1,118 shares of common stock for approximately $22,209 on January 5, 2026, to cover withholding taxes on restricted stock units. This transaction occurred despite the company's significant price gain over the past six months, even though it is not profitable and is considered overvalued by InvestingPro.

title: Nio flags potential cost pressures from memory chips
summary: Nio's CEO, William Li, has warned of "significant" cost pressures in 2026 due to surging memory chip prices, which are impacting the entire automotive sector. These chips are crucial for Nio's own Shenji chips, as well as Nvidia and cockpit chips used in its vehicles, with demand from AI players and computing centers driving up costs. Despite the rising expenses, Nio currently has no plans to pass these costs on to vehicle prices, affirming its ability to manage the situation through its gross margin.

title: Did John Deere Build the Future, or a Cage?
summary: This article examines how John Deere transformed into a tech company focused on data and software, leading to advanced machinery like the autonomous 8R tractor. However, this technological leap creates a "closed loop" where farmers like Jake Lieb lose control over their equipment due to proprietary software and repair restrictions, raising legal and ethical questions about ownership in the digital age. The author suggests "interoperability" as a solution, drawing parallels to policies like the EU's common charger rule, to ensure market fairness and consumer choice.

title: Dolby Sets the New Standard for Premium Entertainment at CES 2026
summary: Dolby Laboratories showcased its latest innovations at CES 2026, aiming to redefine entertainment experiences in streaming, home entertainment, and automotive sectors. Key announcements include a partnership with Peacock to integrate Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos, the expansion of Dolby Vision 2 with major TV manufacturers, and increased adoption of Dolby Atmos in over 35 global automotive brands. These advancements highlight Dolby's commitment to delivering more immersive and accessible premium quality entertainment.

title: Apple stock slips on App Store slowdown signal — what Wall Street is watching next
summary: Apple shares fell 1.8% to $262.34 following signals of the slowest App Store revenue growth in 11 quarters, according to BofA. Investors are closely monitoring Apple's services performance, especially as the company's valuation relies heavily on growth beyond hardware sales. Upcoming events include the U.S. December jobs report on January 9 and Apple’s fiscal Q1 results on January 29, which will provide further clarity on the company's financial trajectory.

title: Is Establishment Labs the Next Sleeper Stock Superstar or Just Surgical Hype?
summary: Establishment Labs (ESTA) is gaining buzz for its high-tech breast implants and surgical technology, sparking debate about whether it's a game-changer or just niche hype. While the company offers innovative, premium products in a regulated industry, investors need to weigh its significant growth potential against substantial risks like market volatility and regulatory challenges. It's considered a high-risk, high-conviction play rather than a quick flip, appealing to investors comfortable with significant stock swings and a long-term outlook.

title: Equal Sector Strategy Reduces Tech Concentration Risk
summary: The ALPS Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) strategically reduces technology concentration risk by allocating approximately 9% to each of the 11 S&P 500 sectors, caping tech exposure at 9% compared to its 34.4% weight in the cap-weighted S&P 500. This approach provides more balanced exposure across the economy, increasing allocations to sectors like energy and real estate, and has attracted significant investor interest with competitive returns. The fund, which holds over $589 million in assets, rebalances quarterly and carries a 0.27% expense ratio.

title: The Invesco RAFI US 1000 ETF (PRF) launched in 2005, provides extensive large-cap value market exposure
summary: The Invesco RAFI US 1000 ETF (PRF), launched in 2005, offers exposure to the Large Cap Value market through a smart beta strategy that aims to outperform by focusing on fundamental characteristics. With over $8.72 billion in assets and a 0.34% expense ratio, PRF primarily allocates to Financials, Information Technology, and Healthcare sectors. The ETF has performed well, gaining 19.44% over the last year, and its lower volatility and sensitivity to interest rates make it an interesting option for value-oriented traders.

title: Former Apple iPhone Air designer joins AI startup Hark
summary: Abidur Chowdhury, formerly an Apple Inc. designer who contributed to the iPhone Air, has been appointed head of design at AI startup Hark. This move is part of Hark's aggressive recruitment strategy to attract top Silicon Valley talent, with the company already having hired engineers from tech giants like Google, Meta Platforms, and Amazon. Hark, founded by serial entrepreneur Brett Adcock, is self-funded with $100 million and aims to expand its engineering team significantly while developing its first AI model for release in summer 2026.

title: Apple’s Siri Gets Major AI Overhaul with LLMs in Spring 2026
summary: Apple is set to release a significantly upgraded Siri in spring 2026, integrating advanced AI like Large Language Models (LLMs) for improved contextual understanding, personalized responses, and seamless app integration. This overhaul aims to address Siri's past limitations, emphasize on-device privacy, and position Apple more competitively in the AI landscape. The enhancements are expected to boost device sales and strengthen Apple’s ecosystem synergy.

title: The Truth About HP Inc.: Is This ‘Boring’ Stock the Sneaky Tech Power Play You’re Sleeping On?
summary: This article assesses HP Inc. as both a product brand and an investment opportunity. It highlights HP's strong position in budget and mid-range laptops and its profitable printer business powered by recurring revenue from ink subscriptions. While not a high-growth "AI rocket," HPQ is presented as a stable, cash-generating stock suitable for long-term, value-focused investors interested in dividends and a company with a massive installed user base.

title: Online Music Performance Market is Going to Boom | Spotify Technology S.A. , Meta Platforms
summary: The global Online Music Performance market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 14.6% during the forecast period (2025-2030), driven by increased digital entertainment consumption, global reach for independent artists, and advancements in live streaming technology. North America is the dominant region, with Asia Pacific showing the fastest growth. Major players in this market include YouTube, Spotify, Meta Platforms, Apple Inc., and Amazon Music.

title: 10 Information Technology Stocks Whale Activity In Today's Session
summary: This article details significant "whale activity" in the options market for ten Information Technology stocks, including Apple, Micron Technology, and Palantir Technologies. It lists call option sweeps and trades with their respective sentiments (bullish, bearish, neutral), expiration dates, strike prices, and trade volumes. The report explains how tracking such large-scale transactions can help traders identify potential market opportunities.

title: New phase ahead for office space market: JLL Taiwan
summary: Taiwan's commercial property market is entering a transitional and more competitive phase this year, driven by increased office availability, regulatory changes, and demand from AI and semiconductor industries. JLL Taiwan predicts a shift from a landlord-driven market to one favoring tenants, giving them greater choice and bargaining power. Despite this, demand for high-quality, newly completed office buildings, especially from tech-related sectors, remains strong.

title: Ex-Apple engineers launch Lyte with $107M to build “visual brain” for robots
summary: Three former Apple engineers, veterans of Face ID technology, have founded Lyte, a startup aiming to provide robots with a "visual brain." Lyte has secured $107 million in funding and introduced its LyteVision product, which integrates advanced 4D sensing, RGB imaging, and motion awareness. This technology is designed to enable robots to perceive and navigate complex environments for diverse applications, from humanoid robots to autonomous vehicles.

title: Vietnã: Crescimento anual atinge 8% e superávit comercial com EUA bate recorde apesar de tarifas
summary: The Vietnamese economy is projected to grow by 8% in 2025, surpassing 2024 figures but falling short of its five-year target. The article highlights a record-breaking trade surplus with the U.S. in 2025 due to unprecedented export levels, even amidst tariffs. However, it also notes record imports from China, leading to U.S. accusations of transshipment.

title: Trex (TREX) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Trex Company (NYSE:TREX) jumped 3.6% after UBS upgraded the stock to Buy from Neutral and raised its price target to $52, reflecting confidence in future sales growth and margin expansion. Despite the upgrade and recent positive sentiment from Goldman Sachs, Trex's shares are still trading significantly below their 52-week high, with a 5-year investment showing a substantial loss. The company benefits from rising demand for sustainable building materials.

title: If Intel Builds a Foundry, Will They Come? Why the Stock Depends on the Answer.
summary: Intel's stock showed early Tuesday volatility after the company launched new processors using its 18A manufacturing process. The crucial issue for Intel's foundry business remains its ability to attract external customers to mitigate ongoing losses. The article explores whether Intel can successfully revive its chip-manufacturing segment by drawing in new clients.

title: Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) Daily Snapshot—1/6/25
summary: The Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) recently experienced a slight pre-market dip of 0.07% but is up 0.03% over five days and 0.31% year-to-date. With $300 million in net flows over the past five days, investors are adding capital to VTI, which holds 3,484 stocks worth $573.10 billion. The ETF is considered a "Moderate Buy" with a potential 16.4% upside based on analysts' average price target of $394.54.

title: Why We Highly Rate JPMorgan Large Cap Growth
summary: JPMorgan Large Cap Growth R6 (JLGMX) receives a Gold Morningstar Medalist Rating due to its highly experienced lead manager, Giri Devulapally, and a solid team of sector analysts. The fund's strategy combines robust fundamental research with a momentum component, enabling early identification and long-term holding of market-winning companies like NVIDIA and Tesla. Devulapally's tenure has resulted in impressive performance, consistently outperforming peers and the Russell 1000 Growth Index while effectively managing market volatility.

title: NVIDIA Reveals Why the Company Is “Immune” to Memory Shortages — and How The Firm Prepaid Inventory to Keep the AI Boom Running
summary: NVIDIA claims to be "immune" to the current memory shortages affecting the industry, attributing this to early and massive investments in partners, including prepayments, to expand capacity. The company's direct purchasing of DRAM at a global scale and its ability to transform it into CoWoS supercomputers provide a significant advantage in managing its supply chain. While NVIDIA's AI division benefits from these strategies, its consumer gaming business, however, is feeling the pinch, experiencing product launch delays and necessitating the reintroduction of older GPU models.

title: Apple Health Studies: How Apple Is Powering the Largest Health Research Effort in History - AppleMagazine
summary: Apple Health Studies are revolutionizing medical research by leveraging iPhone and Apple Watch data to conduct large-scale, long-term health studies in partnership with academic institutions. This initiative allows for unprecedented data collection, enabling researchers to study human health at scale, identify subtle patterns, and understand disease progression more inclusively. Privacy is a foundational element, ensuring voluntary participation, data anonymization, and user control, which fosters trust and widespread engagement.

title: V. M. Manning & CO. Inc. Purchases New Stake in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: V. M. Manning & CO. Inc. has acquired a significant new stake in Apple Inc., totaling 52,347 shares valued at approximately $12.17 million, making it their second-largest holding. Analyst sentiment remains largely positive with a "Moderate Buy" rating and an average price target of $283.92, despite recent insider selling by Apple executives. Institutional investors now own 67.73% of the company's stock, highlighting continued confidence in the tech giant.

title: From smart mirrors to low-vision eyewear, Gentex brings bold ideas to CES
summary: Gentex (NASDAQ: GNTX) is showcasing its latest automotive technology and product diversification at CES 2026. Highlights include a next-generation Full Display Mirror with Dynamic View Assist, advanced mirror-integrated driver monitoring systems, dimmable sunroofs, and the cloud-connected HomeLink system. The company is also emphasizing its expansion into smart home, biometrics, medical assistive devices with eSight Go, and premium audio markets.

title: Is Costco Stock Set to Rebound Higher in 2026?
summary: Costco Wholesale (NASDAQ: COST) stock faced a "rare weak stretch" in 2025 despite strong business growth, including an 8.2% rise in total sales and 14% growth in membership fee income in fiscal Q1 2026. The article questions whether Costco's stock, currently trading at a high valuation of 47 times earnings, is overvalued, fairly valued, or undervalued, suggesting that the lofty price leaves little room for error and could lead to underperformance. Despite the company's solid fundamentals, the author indicates a preference to stay on the sidelines due to valuation concerns.

title: Wallace Advisory Group LLC Sells 4,325 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Wallace Advisory Group LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 30% in the third quarter, selling 4,325 shares but retaining 10,106 shares valued at $2.573 million. This makes Apple its 8th largest holding, representing about 2.0% of the fund's investment portfolio. Insider selling also occurred, with Chris Kondo selling 3,752 shares and CFO Kevan Parekh selling 4,199 shares, contributing to a 1.4% dip in the stock price.

title: Morgan Stanley price target raised to $190 from $172 at Goldman Sachs
summary: Goldman Sachs has increased its price target for Morgan Stanley (MS) to $190 from $172, while maintaining a Neutral rating on the shares. This announcement, originally published by TheFly, indicates a positive adjustment in the outlook for Morgan Stanley's stock by Goldman Sachs. Additional news mentions other analysts also raising price targets for MS, suggesting a generally bullish sentiment for the company.

title: Robeco Institutional Asset Management B.V. Increases Position in VeriSign, Inc. $VRSN
summary: Robeco Institutional Asset Management B.V. significantly increased its stake in VeriSign, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSN) by 12.3% in Q3, now owning 965,600 shares valued at approximately $269.95 million. This move comes as institutional investors increase their holdings, despite some insider selling by executives. VeriSign reported strong Q3 earnings, beating EPS estimates, and maintains a "Hold" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $281.67.

title: Rtx Corp stock hits all-time high of 188.14 USD
summary: Rtx Corp stock has reached an all-time high of $188.14 USD, reflecting strong investor confidence and a 64.62% 1-year return. The aerospace and defense company’s market cap now stands at $253.6 billion, buoyed by significant defense contracts for its Raytheon business, including a $1.7 billion Patriot system deal with Spain. Despite a UBS downgrade to Neutral citing balanced risk/reward, the company maintains a 1.45% dividend yield and has been a consistent dividend payer for 55 consecutive years.

title: Better Broad-Market ETF: Schwab's SCHB vs. iShares' ITOT
summary: This article compares two broad-market ETFs, Schwab's SCHB and iShares' ITOT, highlighting their similarities in cost, performance, and holdings, as both aim to offer broad exposure to the total U.S. stock market. While nearly identical in investment approach, ITOT is noted for its larger assets under management and slightly higher liquidity compared to SCHB. The choice between them ultimately comes down to investor preference for the fund manager.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald raises Xenon Pharmaceuticals stock price target to $55
summary: Cantor Fitzgerald has increased its price target for Xenon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XENE) to $55.00 from $45.00, reiterating an Overweight rating. The firm notes that Xenon's broader pipeline, beyond its seizure treatments, is the primary driver of this increased valuation, with its upcoming XTOLE-2 catalyst being less critical. Despite not being profitable yet, Xenon maintains strong financial health with more cash than debt and a high current ratio.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF’s Standout Year
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) had a strong year in 2025, returning over 22% and growing its assets to more than $6.8 billion, primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The ETF provides diversified access to large and mid-cap companies across 23 developed nations, with a significant allocation to U.S. mega-cap firms, particularly in technology. Despite its concentration in U.S. tech, the fund holds 1,320 individual securities and maintains a 5-star Morningstar rating, making it suitable for investors seeking developed market exposure while avoiding emerging economies.

title: Covea Finance Trims Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Covea Finance reduced its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 1.7% in Q3, selling 11,325 shares but still holding 657,284 shares valued at over $167 million, making Apple its second-largest holding. title: Apple fined €98.6m by Italian Competition Authority
summary: The Italian Competition Authority has fined Apple Inc. €98.6 million ($115.5 million) for abusing its dominant market position in the supply of platforms for app distribution to iOS users. Apple was found to violate Article 102 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU) by maintaining "absolute dominance" through its App Store. This fine signifies the latest regulatory challenge for the tech giant in Europe, which has increasingly scrutinized the business practices of major technology companies.

title: Italy's antitrust fines Apple for alleged abuse of dominant position with App Store
summary: Italy's competition authority has fined Apple 98.6 million euros ($115.53 million) for alleged abuse of its dominant position regarding the distribution of mobile applications for iOS users. The regulator asserts that the tech giant violated European regulations with its App Store, where it holds "absolute dominance" in providing platforms to developers. Apple was not immediately available for comment on the ruling.

title: Apple's ATT draws €98m antitrust fine in Italy
summary: Apple's App Tracking Transparency (ATT) feature has resulted in a €98 million antitrust fine from the Italian Competition Authority. The authority found that Apple's privacy prompt was disproportionate and harmed competition among app developers. This decision signals regulatory scrutiny over data privacy mechanisms and their competitive impact.

summary: Sonora Investment Management Group LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 2.7% in Q3, now holding 260,565 shares valued at $66.35 million, making it their second-largest holding. Cook and SVP Deirdre O'Brien significantly occurred last quarter. Apple recently announced a quarterly dividend of $0.26 per share, paid on November 13th.

(NYSE: BRK.A, BRK.B) is undergoing a significant leadership transition as Greg Abel prepares to take over as CEO from Warren Buffett on January 1, 2026, alongside other key management reshuffles. The company faces scrutiny over its record $381.7 billion cash pile and future capital allocation strategies, especially following investment manager Todd Combs' departure and recent portfolio shifts like the Alphabet stake and Apple trimming. Investors are closely watching how Abel will manage this transition, the company's vast stock portfolio, and its operational performance moving forward.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL is Fragasso Financial Advisors Inc's 7th Largest Position
summary: Fragasso Financial Advisors Inc. reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 2.3% in Q3, now holding 261,723 shares valued at $67.53 million, making it their 7th largest position. title: Destiny Wealth Partners LLC Raises Stake in Apple Inc. $AAPL

title: Nancy Pelosi And Dan Ives Pile Into The Same 8 AI Stocks — What Do They See Coming?
summary: This article highlights eight artificial intelligence stocks that are present in both Wedbush analyst Dan Ives' AI Revolution ETF and Congresswoman Nancy Pelosi's investment portfolio. The article details the specific holdings and past transactions involving each of these companies by Pelosi and her husband.

title: Cue Biopharma prices $10 million public offering at $0.28 per share
summary: Cue Biopharma announced an underwritten public offering to raise approximately $10 million by selling 35,714,286 shares of common stock (or pre-funded warrants) and accompanying warrants at a combined price of $0.28 per share. The offering is expected to close around December 22, 2025, with proceeds supporting the clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company's development of biologics for autoimmune diseases.

title: Musk says SpaceX discussed iPhone satellite service With Apple
summary: Elon Musk revealed that SpaceX engaged in "promising conversations" with Apple regarding the use of Starlink connectivity for the iPhone's new satellite features. While Apple partnered with Globalstar Inc. for its Emergency SOS via satellite feature for the iPhone 14, a future collaboration with SpaceX remains possible. This news follows SpaceX's collaboration with T-Mobile to enable text messaging via satellite in remote areas.

title: Amiral Gestion Invests $2.48 Million in VeriSign, Inc. $VRSN
summary: Amiral Gestion initiated a new position in VeriSign, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSN) during the third quarter, purchasing 8,883 shares valued at approximately $2.48 million, making it their 19th largest holding. VeriSign reported strong Q3 results, beating analyst estimates with an EPS of $2.27 and revenue of $419.10 million, an increase of 7.3% year-over-year. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.77 per share.

title: Is First Trust Dow 30 Equal Weight ETF (EDOW) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The First Trust Dow 30 Equal Weight ETF (EDOW) offers broad exposure to the Style Box - Large Cap Blend category, aiming to outperform the market through equal-weighted stock selection. With assets over $230.75 million and an expense ratio of 0.50%, EDOW's top holdings include Information Technology, Financials, and Healthcare. The ETF has shown strong performance, gaining 15.17% year-to-date as of December 18, 2025.

title: ATS Corporation Participates in UBS Global Industrials and Transportation Conference
summary: ATS Corporation participated in the UBS Global Industrials and Transportation Conference in Manalapan, Florida, on December 3, 2025, where Interim CEO Ryan McLeod and Interim CFO Anne Cybulski engaged with institutional investors. The company, a leading automation solutions provider, emphasizes strong investor relations. Despite strong revenue and cash flow, ATS faces profitability challenges, as indicated by a negative P/E ratio, according to TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark, who rates the stock as Neutral with a C$52.00 price target.

title: A Standout Year for the iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) achieved a powerful performance in 2025 with a year-to-date return of approximately 20.5%, driven by strong technology holdings, a rally in developed equity markets, new US policy initiatives, and a softening US dollar. The fund's portfolio is heavily influenced by technology, with US equities dominating its geographic allocation, making it a "US-plus" strategy. Despite its higher expense ratio, URTH offers efficient global stock exposure specifically excluding emerging markets.

title: 5G take-up lags in Europe
summary: Six years after the first commercial launches, 5G adoption in Europe remains low in many markets, with less than 40% of mobile subscribers using 5G in 11 of 14 markets with available data. This slow take-up contrasts with the rapid adoption of 4G services and is attributed to regulatory delays, low investment, uneven economic conditions, and stagnation in smartphone shipments. Spectrum limitations and the initial reliance on non-standalone 5G have also hindered widespread expansion and advanced feature monetization.

title: Should Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM), launched in 2020, is a passively managed fund designed for exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, with over $68.87 billion in assets. It maintains a low expense ratio of 0.15% and has a significant allocation to the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The QQQM has a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy) and has shown strong performance, making it a compelling option for investors focusing on large-cap growth.

title: Is MP Materials Stock a Millionaire Maker?
summary: MP Materials, a rare-earth metals company, garnered attention recently due to U.S. government and Apple investments, but its stock has since declined by 45%. While the company is still building its business and carries significant risk, its long-term prospects remain attractive given the vital role of rare-earth metals and the desire to diversify supply chains away from China. However, only aggressive growth investors should consider it given the current valuation is based more on sentiment than financial performance.

title: Apple releases open source SHARP AI model that turns single photo into 3D scene in under 1 second
summary: Apple has introduced an open-source AI model named SHARP, capable of converting a single 2D image into a 3D scene in under a second. The technology, detailed in a study titled "Sharp Monocular View Synthesis in Less Than a Second," showcases the U.S. tech giant's advancements in artificial intelligence. This development could have significant implications for various applications requiring rapid 3D model generation from simple inputs.

title: Tech stocks fuel rebound as Micron jumps 10%: Markets Wrap
summary: Tech stocks, particularly Micron Technology Inc., rebounded following an upbeat forecast from the largest US memory-chip maker. This rebound occurred on a day filled with new data releases and central bank meetings, including upcoming US inflation data and monetary policy decisions from the European Central Bank and Bank of England. Investors are keenly watching these developments for insights into interest rates and the broader economic outlook.

title: PayPal Slips After Morgan Stanley Downgrade on Growth, Execution Concerns
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded PayPal (PYPL) to Underweight due to structural and operational difficulties, citing concerns over Branded Checkout's market share loss to Apple Pay and Stripe, and Venmo's failure to monetize. Analyst James Faucette also highlighted PayPal's poor technical integrations as a hinderance to participating in new platforms like ChatGPT and predicted slower growth and increased marketing costs would impact profitability. Following the downgrade, PayPal shares experienced a premarket drop of 1.7%.

title: Thrive Wealth Management LLC Lowers Stock Position in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Thrive Wealth Management LLC significantly reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 19.4% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 6,634 shares and now holding 27,527 shares valued at $6.704 million. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.21 per share, reflecting a 0.3% yield and an 8.28% payout ratio.

title: Morgan Stanley Reaffirms Their Buy Rating on Teradata (TDC)

Despite a slight decrease in revenue compared to the previous year, the company's net profit increased.

title: Globalstar (GSAT) Stock News Today (Dec. 18, 2025): Insider Sale Sparks Pullback as Band n53 and XCOM RAN Momentum Builds

While the market reacted negatively, the company simultaneously announced a successful joint technology trial with Skydio using its licensed Band n53 and XCOM RAN private 5G platform, validating its strategy for critical applications like autonomous drones. Analysts are divided, with Deutsche Bank initiating a "Hold" rating due to valuation concerns, despite the growing momentum in Globalstar's core licensed spectrum business.

title: After Earnings, Is Broadcom Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?

The company secured impressive AI chip orders and is expected to see significant momentum continuing into 2027, making its stock moderately undervalued. Despite some concerns regarding gross margin dilution and a high uncertainty rating, Broadcom maintains a wide economic moat and strong financial health with robust cash generation.

title: Park National Corp OH Sells 4,332 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Park National Corp OH has reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 0.9%, selling 4,332 shares and now holding 474,459 shares valued at $120.8 million, making Apple its sixth-largest holding. title: EchoStar director Ortolf sells $182,521 in shares

summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) is at a pivotal moment in its 27-year history, having undergone an "AI-first" pivot that has propelled its revenue past the $100 billion threshold for the first time, driven by innovations like the Gemini 3 model. title: The AI Sovereign: A Deep-Dive Analysis of Apple Inc. (AAPL) in 2025

summary: Jefferies & Company has reiterated its "Hold" rating for Apple Inc. (AAPL) and raised its price target to $283 from $247. title: 1 No-Brainer Growth S&P Index Fund to Buy Right Now for Less Than $500

summary: KeyBanc upgraded ZoomInfo Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:GTM) to ‘Sector Weight’ from ‘Underweight’, indicating the company has moved past the worst of its market pressure and potential challenges from private rivals. title: Forget CarPlay, General Motors is Bringing Apple Music Capability to Some Chevys and Cadillacs
summary: General Motors is implementing native Apple Music integration into select 2025 and newer Chevrolet and Cadillac models, reducing the reliance on Apple CarPlay. This integration runs directly on GM's infotainment platform, offering features like Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos in Cadillac models, and will become a standard feature through OnStar Basics. While CarPlay will remain in gas-powered vehicles, native Apple Music will be available in many upcoming EV and gas models from Chevy and Cadillac, with Buick and GMC to follow.

title: DoubleDown Interactive prices secondary offering at $8 per ADS
summary: DoubleDown Interactive (NASDAQ:DDI) has announced the pricing of a secondary offering of 2,330,468 American Depositary Shares (ADSs) at $8.00 per ADS by STIC Special Situation Diamond Limited. title: Morgan Stanley bumps Apple stock price target, but maintains Overweight rating
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its price target for Apple's stock to $315 from $305, while retaining an Overweight rating, citing a higher revenue forecast for fiscal year 2027 despite projected increases in memory costs. This new target reflects an anticipated 15.8% upside from Apple's current closing price, influenced by expectations of slightly higher iPhone shipments and the impact of incremental AI investments on operating expenses. The bank expects a 130 basis points drop in gross margin due to higher memory input costs, offset by a 5% higher revenue forecast driven by price hikes.

title: Artivion Inc stock hits all-time high at 48.06 USD By Investing.com
summary: Artivion Inc.'s stock (AORT) reached an all-time high of $48.06, driven by strong investor confidence and impressive financial performance, including a 58.86% one-year return and a recent beat on Q3 2025 earnings. title: Want a better employee experience? Give them a choice of devices.

DXC Technology, in partnership with Apple, provides solutions for managing and securing diverse devices while ensuring consistency and economic value.

title: Otter Tail stock hits 52-week high at 86.23 USD

Despite recent third-quarter earnings falling short of analyst expectations, the stock's stability and perceived undervaluation suggest potential for further growth.

title: The Unassailable Fortress: Why TSMC Dominates the Semiconductor Landscape and What It Means for Investors
summary: TSMC is an undisputed leader in the global semiconductor industry, particularly for advanced AI and HPC chips, commanding approximately 70-72% of the pure-play foundry market. Its technological prowess with 3nm, 5nm, and impending 2nm nodes, alongside advanced packaging solutions like CoWoS, makes it indispensable to major tech giants. The company's financial performance is robust, but it faces geopolitical risks due to its concentration in Taiwan and increasing competition.

title: T-Mobile’s 2 new December changes in push to poach rival customers
summary: T-Mobile is introducing two new initiatives in December to attract customers from rival carriers: the "15 Minutes to Better Initiative" and a free iPhone 17 256GB offer. The "15 Minutes to Better Initiative" allows customers to switch efficiently through the T-Life app, while the free iPhone deal requires signing up for specific plans and involves bill credits over 24 months, along with an activation fee and taxes. These moves come amid backlash from customers over T-Mobile's new late fees introduced in November.

title: 3 Top-Ranked AI-Driven Computer Storage Devices Stocks to Buy for 2026
summary: This article identifies three top-ranked AI-driven computer storage device stocks – Western Digital (WDC), Teradata (TDC), and Seagate Technology (STX) – positioned for strong performance in 2026. The companies are expected to benefit from increasing demand for robust data storage solutions driven by cloud computing, IoT, AI, and generative AI. Each of these stocks currently holds a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), indicating their strong potential for investors.

title: Morgan Stanley raises Apple stock target to $315, citing incredible 2026
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its Apple (AAPL) stock price target from $305 to $315, maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This adjustment reflects anticipated opportunities for Apple's growth in 2026, driven by an estimated 5% higher revenue due to price hikes and a marginal increase in iPhone shipment forecasts, particularly benefiting from an extended 5-year replacement cycle for the iPhone 17. The firm also expects sustained double-digit revenue growth in Services and improved supply chain leverage.

title: Why Microsoft is Morgan Stanley’s Top Pick in large-cap software
summary: Morgan Stanley has maintained Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) as its top pick in large-cap software, citing robust demand across business lines and strong prospects for operating margin expansion. The firm highlighted Azure AI as a key driver, expecting significant upside to its model in the coming years due to improving gross margins for Azure AI, even excluding OpenAI revenue share. Despite trading at 23x its CY27 GAAP EPS, Morgan Stanley believes the durability of top-line demand and potential for further margin expansion are well underpriced.

title: Total Wireless Introduces Edge, a Comprehensive Device Financing Program For Prepaid Customers
summary: Total Wireless has launched Edge, a new device financing program for prepaid customers, in partnership with Glow Services Corp. This program aims to eliminate traditional prepaid obstacles by offering premium devices with $0 down and monthly payments as low as $0, with eligibility based on payment history rather than credit score. It's designed to reward customer loyalty, provide access to high-end technology, and expand device options for budget-conscious consumers.

title: Aaron Wealth Advisors LLC Takes $1.17 Million Position in The Middleby Corporation $MIDD
summary: Aaron Wealth Advisors LLC has acquired a new position of 8,761 shares, valued at approximately $1.17 million, in The Middleby Corporation (NASDAQ:MIDD) during the third quarter. Nerbonne purchasing 780 shares, increasing his holdings by 3.77%.

title: Why Texas Roadhouse (TXRH) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Texas Roadhouse (TXRH) stock rose by 2.9% after Wells Fargo upgraded the restaurant company's shares to "Overweight" from "Equal-Weight" and increased its price target to $195 from $170. The analyst cited an attractive buying opportunity due to a recent stock decline, viewing higher beef costs as a temporary issue already factored into the share price and expecting these costs to ease in the second half of 2026. Despite earlier profitability concerns and a missed Q2 earnings report, the upgrade signals a positive outlook for the company's future performance.

title: Teradata price target raised to $35 from $30 at Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Erik Woodring has increased the price target for Teradata (TDC) shares from $30 to $35, maintaining an Overweight rating. This adjustment comes as part of a broader recommendation for the IT Hardware group, favoring cloud capex winners and product-cycle beneficiaries over memory-exposed stocks. The company recently announced a new $500M stock buyback program and was upgraded to Outperform by Citizens JMP.

title: Squarepoint Ops LLC Boosts Stock Position in Cirrus Logic, Inc. $CRUS
summary: Squarepoint Ops LLC significantly increased its stake in Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) by 1,042.9% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 34,103 shares valued at approximately $3.56 million. The semiconductor company's stock has seen substantial institutional ownership, with 87.96% of shares held by such entities.

title: Is Keysight Technologies Stock Outperforming the Dow?
summary: Keysight Technologies (KEYS) has shown strong performance, outperforming the Dow Jones Industrials Average over the past three months, year-to-date, and over 52 weeks. The company, a leading provider of electronic design and test solutions, reported a 10% year-over-year increase in Q4 2025 revenue and a significant rise in non-GAAP EPS, contributing to positive investor sentiment. Analysts rate KEYS a "Strong Buy" with a projected upside of 7.3%.

title: Cintas (CTAS) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Cintas (CTAS) is set to report its Q4 earnings on Thursday before the market opens, with analysts expecting revenue to grow 7.8% year over year to $2.76 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.20 per share. The company has a strong record of exceeding revenue estimates and enters earnings with positive investor sentiment in its segment. Cintas is the first among its peers to report, making its performance a key indicator for the business services & supplies sector.

title: Warren Buffett Sells Apple Stock and Buys a Trillion-Dollar AI Stock Up 12,180% Since Its IPO
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold a significant portion of its Apple stock and initiated a new, albeit small, position in Alphabet during the third quarter. While Apple is well-positioned to capitalize on AI, its current valuation is considered expensive. Alphabet, on the other hand, presents attractive opportunities across digital advertising, cloud computing, and autonomous driving, with a more reasonable valuation and impressive historical returns.

title: Adams Wealth Management Sells 2,335 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Adams Wealth Management reduced its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 17.6%, selling 2,335 shares to hold 10,960 shares valued at $2.249 million. Institutional ownership of Apple is high at 67.73%, with significant activity from firms like Vanguard, State Street, and Norges Bank, while insiders including CEO Tim Cook have been net sellers.
