title: NACCO Industries amends retirement plan and ends consulting agreement with Rankin
summary: NACCO Industries (NYSE:NC) has announced significant changes to its executive compensation and consulting agreements. The company amended its Excess Retirement Plan to allow separate deferral elections and terminated its consulting agreement with Alfred M. Rankin, Jr. These moves follow a strong year for NACCO Industries, marked by a 70% stock surge and recent financial developments including increased revenue, a new stock repurchase program, and dual stock listing.

title: Roomba maker files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, seeks acquisition by contract manufacturer
summary: iRobot Corp., the company behind Roomba vacuums, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy to reduce debt and go private, with a plan to be acquired by its primary contract manufacturer, Shenzhen Picea Robotics Co. This move follows a multi-year market downturn, including a failed acquisition attempt by Amazon, and aims to secure the company's long-term future by combining iRobot's innovation with Picea's manufacturing expertise. The bankruptcy process is expected to be completed by February 2026, after which iRobot shares will no longer be listed on the Nasdaq, and current shareholders will receive no equity.

title: Tesla’s Rally to Record High Is Leaving Big Tech Peers Behind
summary: Despite sales challenges and market share loss in China and Europe, Tesla's shares have rallied 25% since November 21st, hitting a record this year and outperforming the Bloomberg Magnificent Seven Index. Investors are optimistic due to CEO Elon Musk's focus on AI and autonomous driving, seeing Tesla as a potential AI powerhouse. However, the company faces hurdles like a potential sales halt in California and high valuations, with some analysts considering its multiples "crazy."
authors: Sagarika Jaisinghani, Julien Ponthus and Isolde MacDonogh

title: Gene Munster's 11 Predictions For 2026: AI Trade Continues, Small‑Cap Tech Outperforms, This Magnificent Seven Stock Leads - Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN)
summary: Deepwater Asset Management's Gene Munster has released his 11 market predictions for 2026, marking his 10th consecutive year of forecasts. Key predictions include the continued strength of the AI trade with the Nasdaq rising 10% or more, small-cap tech outperforming broad tech, and Apple being the top-performing Magnificent Seven stock in the first half of 2026. However, Munster expects Alphabet to finish the year as the top Magnificent Seven performer, citing its strong AI integration, and also predicts Tesla will miss delivery expectations while Waymo achieves significant Robotaxi milestones.

title: 3 Fidelity ETFs You Can Buy and Hold Forever to Generate $100,000 in Yearly Dividend Income, Starting in 2026
summary: This article suggests three Fidelity ETFs – Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV), Fidelity International High Dividend ETF (FIDI), and Fidelity Total Bond ETF (FBND) – for investors aiming to generate $100,000 in yearly dividend income. It highlights the benefits of dividend-paying investments and provides a comparison with the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), outlining the capital needed to reach the income goal with each. The author emphasizes the importance of a solid retirement plan and encouraging steady investment in dividend payers.

title: The Developed Markets Mandate: Analyzing the iShares MSCI World ETF’s 2025 Trajectory
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) saw a strong 20.5% return in 2025, driven by U.S. tech and AI, but its exclusion of emerging markets led to potential underperformance during a late-year emerging market rally. The fund is highly concentrated in U.S. mega-cap technology stocks, with the U.S. dominating its geographical allocation. Investors are now evaluating whether the AI-driven advantage of developed nations will maintain its dominance over the recent strength in emerging markets.

title: Jim Cramer Says Corning (GLW) Is the "One I Would Suggest to Start With"
summary: Jim Cramer recommends Corning (GLW) as a stock to consider, highlighting its role in the data center business due to its optical fiber technology which can displace copper wiring. He notes the company's innovation in glassmaking, including its cover glass for Apple products, and its potential to solve heat problems in data centers. Cramer suggests starting small with GLW, anticipating potential market rotations.

title: Hycroft Mining director Wieshofer sells $51,575 in stock

Following this transaction, Wieshofer directly owns 70,125 shares, including unvested RSUs. The company has also announced significant silver grades at its Vortex zone, eliminated all debt, and raised substantial capital through a public offering.

title: Alphabet Seizes Mag 7 Crown With 62% Stock Surge — But Amazon's Bargain Is The Plot Twist
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOG, NASDAQ: GOOGL) has significantly outpaced its fellow "Magnificent 7" stocks this year with a 62.26% surge, making it the top performer and solidifying its position among mega-cap companies. Conversely, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) has lagged dramatically with only a 1.05% year-to-date gain, but its consequently lower valuation metrics, like a price-to-sales ratio of 3.48, suggest it might be a bargain compared to its more expensive peers. This creates a contrasting narrative within Big Tech, where Alphabet wears the performance crown while Amazon quietly offers a potential deal.

title: Adobe hit with proposed class-action, accused of misusing authors’ work in AI training
summary: Adobe is facing a proposed class-action lawsuit alleging it used pirated books, including those by author Elizabeth Lyon, to train its SlimLM AI model. The lawsuit claims Adobe's SlimPajama dataset, derived from RedPajama, incorporated the "Books3" collection of 191,000 copyrighted works without consent or compensation. This case is part of a growing trend of lawsuits against AI companies for using copyrighted material in their training data, following similar actions against Apple, Salesforce, and Anthropic.

title: Ações da Douglas Emmett atingem mínima de 52 semanas a US$ 11,42
summary: As ações da Douglas Emmett Inc. (DEI) atingiram uma mínima de 52 semanas, negociadas a US$ 11,42, e caíram 40,58% no último ano, e 20,2% nos últimos seis meses, indicando uma potencial subavaliação segundo dados do InvestingPro. A empresa, um fundo de investimento imobiliário sediado em Los Angeles, mantém um rendimento de dividendos de 6,6% e pagamentos consecutivos por 20 anos, apesar dos desafios no mercado de escritórios. Analistas ajustaram seus preços-alvo para a DEI devido a preocupações com a ocupação, com Jefferies reduzindo para US$ 13,00 e Piper Sandler rebaixando para Neutra com preço-alvo de US$ 14,00.

title: General Motors Is Doing The Unthinkable: A Paid Feature Is Now Becoming Free On Some Of Its Cars

This changes GM's previous approach of charging customers for such connectivity services.

title: GM secures deal to bring Apple Music to Chevrolet, Cadillac models
summary: General Motors has secured a deal to integrate Apple Music into a range of its Chevrolet and Cadillac models. The move aims to enhance in-car entertainment options for GM customers.

title: Utility watchdogs accuse PGE of skirting new law meant to make data centers pay for rising demand
summary: Oregon's largest electrical utility, Portland General Electric (PGE), is accused by utility watchdogs of attempting to circumvent a new law, the POWER Act, which mandates that data centers bear the costs of their growing energy demands. PGE's proposed "Peak Growth Modifier" plan would only directly charge data centers for the first three years of infrastructure investment costs, leaving residential and other customers to fund the remaining 47 years of typical infrastructure investments, despite data centers being the primary driver of demand growth. Critics from the Citizens' Utility Board label this approach as "twisted logic" and advocate for direct assignment of costs to data centers for the entire lifespan of assets primarily serving them.

title: GM strikes deal to put Apple Music in all of its new vehicles

The new integration will provide native access to Apple Music, including Spatial Audio on some Cadillac models, without needing CarPlay.

title: General Motors Attempts To Soften The Blow Of Removing Apple CarPlay
summary: General Motors is trying to appease customers upset about the removal of Apple CarPlay and Android Auto by integrating a native Apple Music app into select 2025 and newer Cadillac and Chevrolet models. This move, while seemingly beneficial, is seen by critics as GM's strategy to eventually funnel customers into subscription services after an initial eight-year complimentary period. GM aims to capitalize on new revenue streams by encouraging the use of its own app-focused interfaces and collecting customer data.

title: Jim Cramer makes the case for buying Procter & Gamble stock
summary: Jim Cramer advocates for investing in Procter & Gamble, highlighting its effective use of technology to cut costs and innovate. He distinguishes these "business-to-business users of technology" from "tech hyperscalers" who spend heavily on AI to compete. Cramer suggests P&G is a strong buy due to its efficient operations, current valuation, and dividend yield, contrasting it with increasingly competitive and costly big tech stocks.

title: Tesla board made $3 billion via stock awards that dwarfed tech peers
summary: Tesla's board of directors has collectively earned over $3 billion through stock awards, significantly exceeding the compensation of their peers at other major U.S. technology firms. This discrepancy, highlighted by an Equilar analysis, shows Tesla directors' awards were disproportionately large at the time they were paid, leading to massive windfalls as the company's stock price appreciated. Despite a suspension of new stock grants since 2020 due to a shareholder lawsuit, the existing awards have generated substantial wealth, sparking criticism over director independence and the structure of their compensation.

Despite facing short-term pressures from a new ERP system, the company anticipates mid-single-digit revenue growth and improved margins through business separation, supply chain enhancements, and new product launches. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for REZI with a significant upside potential.

title: Cincinnati Financial Stock: Is CINF Outperforming the Financial Services Sector?
summary: Cincinnati Financial Corporation (CINF) has shown strong performance, with its stock increasing 6.8% over the past three months and 13.2% year-to-date, outpacing the Financial Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLF) in both periods. Despite a slight dip after its Q3 2025 earnings report, CINF has outperformed XLF over the past 52 weeks and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, with a mean price target suggesting further upside.

title: VTI ETF Daily Update—12/11/25
summary: The Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) provides investors with broad access to the entire U.S. stock market. In today’s VTI ETF snapshot, we highlight the fund’s recent performance, key technical indicators, and top holdings to help investors track trends in the broader market. VTI is down by 0.12% in pre-market trading on Thursday, while gaining 0.74% in the previous session due to a Federal Reserve interest rate cut.

title: Socket Mobile Launches XtremeScan v16e Industrial Barcode Scanners
summary: Socket Mobile has launched its XtremeScan v16e industrial barcode scanners, designed for the iPhone 16e. These new models feature an enhanced design with improved ergonomics, a higher-capacity battery, and expanded scanning options, including full camera access for frontline workers. Developed with extensive customer feedback from various demanding environments, the v16e line prioritizes durability, extended usability, and seamless integration with mobile workflows.

title: Qualcomm (QCOM): Navigating the AI Era with Strategic Diversification
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) is undergoing a significant strategic transformation, diversifying beyond mobile handsets into high-growth areas like automotive, IoT, and AI-enabled computing. This pivot is aimed at achieving a 50/50 revenue split between mobile and non-mobile segments by 2029, driven by substantial investments in on-device AI, the Snapdragon Digital Chassis for automotive, and the Snapdragon X Series for AI PCs. While facing intense competition and potential shifts in its mobile modem business due to Apple's in-house chip development, Qualcomm's robust financial performance and aggressive pursuit of new markets position it for long-term growth in the evolving tech and AI landscape.

title: Cresset Asset Management LLC Reduces Position in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS
summary: Cresset Asset Management LLC significantly reduced its stake in Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) by 59.1% in the second quarter, selling 22,430 shares, though other institutional investors like AE Wealth Management LLC increased their holdings. Skyworks Solutions reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations with an EPS of $1.76 and revenue of $1.10 billion, and announced a quarterly dividend of $0.71 per share. The stock currently holds a "Hold" rating from analysts with an average target price of $83.18, despite recent insider selling.

title: Rep. Cleo Fields bought up to $1.5M in Netflix stock just before Warner Bros. deal
summary: Louisiana Congressman Cleo Fields purchased between $500,000 and $1.25 million worth of Netflix stock from October 31 to November 20, just weeks before Netflix announced its $82.7 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. The timing of these purchases is drawing scrutiny, especially as Netflix's stock has since declined amid deal uncertainty. This comes amid a bipartisan push in Congress to ban members from trading individual stocks.

title: Hatching the Automobile’s Future in a Cloistered Los Angeles Lab
summary: Ford Motor Company's chief of electric vehicles, Doug Field, is attempting to revolutionize the automaker's development process to compete with Chinese manufacturers and EV startups. He established a secretive "skunk works" lab in Los Angeles and a Silicon Valley office, recruiting talent from tech and electric vehicle companies to foster innovation and creative freedom, shielded from traditional corporate interference. This initiative aims to redesign Ford's fleet and secure its future in the rapidly evolving automotive landscape.

title: Is MP Stock a Buy, Hold or Sell After Its 98.9% Six-Month Rally?
summary: MP Materials (MP) has seen a 98.9% rally in the past six months due to strategic partnerships with Apple and the Department of War, and solid production numbers. Despite this strong performance and long-term potential in the rare earth market, the company's stock currently trades at a premium valuation with recent downward revisions in earnings estimates, leading to a "Hold" rating for new investors. Existing investors are encouraged to hold due to its unmatched positioning in the U.S. supply chain and robust fundamentals.

title: JEPQ’s 10% Dividend Is Legendary, But At What Cost?
summary: The article analyzes the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ), which offers an 11.52% dividend yield by selling covered calls on Nasdaq-100 stocks. While providing high monthly income, JEPQ significantly caps upside capital appreciation compared to growth-focused ETFs like QQQ, essentially trading 10-12 percentage points of annual total return for its yield. The fund's distributions also fluctuate greatly, making it less predictable for budgeting, and its high tech concentration and portfolio turnover present specific risks.

title: Morgan Stanley Upgrades MP Materials (MP) to Overweight on US Supply Chain Push and Rare Earth Outlook
summary: Morgan Stanley has upgraded MP Materials (MP) to Overweight due to its strategic position in developing a US rare earth supply chain and strong production growth. The company achieved record NDPR oxide production and is on track to commission a heavy rare earth circuit by mid-2026, supported by a significant partnership with Apple and a Purchase Price Agreement with the Department of War. These developments are expected to drive profitability and reduce US dependency on foreign critical mineral sources.

title: IDEAYA Biosciences Announces IND Submission for IDE574, a Potential First-In-Class KAT6/7 Dual Inhibitor for Breast and Lung Cancers
summary: IDEAYA Biosciences has submitted an investigational new drug (IND) application to the FDA for IDE574, a potential first-in-class KAT6/7 dual inhibitor for breast and lung cancers. A Phase 1 dose escalation trial is expected to commence in Q1 2026, with preclinical data detailing its pharmacologic profile and anti-tumor activity slated for presentation in H1 2026. This molecule aims to disrupt tumor lineage identity by inhibiting tumor-promoting epigenetic modulators.

title: Is Principal Financial Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
summary: Principal Financial Group (PFG) stock has surpassed the Nasdaq Composite over the last three months, despite underperforming it in longer periods like six months and 52 weeks. The company, a large-cap financial services provider, reported mixed Q3 results but maintains a "Hold" rating from analysts, with a potential upside.

title: Check out CDW Corp's stock price (1CDW-IT) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock information for CDW Corp (1CDW-IT) on the Milan Stock Exchange, including its current price, 52-week range, and key financial statistics like dividend yield. It also lists recent news and analyst calls related to CDW, offering a comprehensive overview of the company's market position and profile.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly reduced its stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc. by 60.15%, selling over 44 million shares at $17.63 each. Despite this large reduction, the impact on JPMorgan's overall portfolio was minimal, decreasing its position by only 0.02%. Host Hotels & Resorts remains a leading REIT, considered modestly undervalued with strong growth potential, attracting other notable investors.

title: Why Microsoft Stock Tumbled Today
summary: Microsoft's stock declined by nearly 3% following a letter from a bipartisan group of state attorneys general expressing concerns about AI chatbots. The letter warned major tech companies, including Microsoft, about "sycophantic and delusional outputs" and child safety issues, calling for immediate action and independent auditing. Despite this regulatory pressure, the article suggests Microsoft will likely find a way to operate effectively, as it has with past regulatory challenges.

title: Microsoft Stock Slips After Hours as AI Scrutiny Rises: What MSFT Investors Should Know Before the December 11 Open
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) experienced a slight dip on December 10, 2025, closing down 2.7% and trading marginally lower after hours, primarily due to increased regulatory scrutiny on AI and concerns over monetizing its substantial AI investments. This comes as state attorneys general warned tech companies about "delusional outputs" from AI chatbots and Microsoft announced $23 billion in new AI data center investments. Despite these near-term pressures, Wall Street analysts maintain a broadly bullish outlook on Microsoft's long-term prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside, though some quantitative models show mixed signals and long-term caution on valuation.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Bought by Prudential PLC
summary: Prudential PLC significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 5.6%, acquiring an additional 74,129 shares to now hold over 1.4 million shares valued at $287.9 million, making Apple its 9th largest position. Apple recently exceeded quarterly earnings estimates with an EPS of $1.85 and revenue of $102.47 billion, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $282.51. Despite corporate insider sales totaling $58.6 million in the last quarter, institutional investors collectively own 67.73% of Apple's stock.

title: Apple supplier Corning to begin India Gorilla cover-glass finishing in first half of 2026 with JV partner Optiemus, eyes exports
summary: Apple supplier Corning plans to start Gorilla cover-glass finishing in India by the first half of 2026, partnering with Optiemus. This joint venture aims to supply major smartphone manufacturers in India and later expand to tablets, laptops, and wearables. The initiative also includes future plans for exports.

title: Best Buy offers deals, services for late holiday shoppers
summary: Best Buy is targeting last-minute holiday shoppers with a variety of deals, services, and extended policies. These include an Apple sales event, multi-day sales, Friday doorbusters, and flexible delivery and pickup options. The retailer is also offering price matching, extended return periods, gift idea pages, an AI gift finder, and in-store showcases to enhance the shopping experience.

title: New Disney Board Nomination For Former Apple Executive
summary: The Walt Disney Company's Board of Directors has nominated former Apple executive Jeff Williams to stand for election as an independent director at the 2026 annual shareholders meeting. If approved, the board will expand to 11 members. Williams, who previously served as Apple's Chief Operating Officer, is lauded for his extensive experience in technology, global operations, and product design, which Disney believes will be invaluable for its continued focus on creative storytelling and innovation.

title: Cirrus Logic stock gets Buy rating reiterated by Stifel on auto haptics launch
summary: Stifel has reiterated a Buy rating and $150.00 price target on Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) following the company's entry into the automotive haptics market with its new CS40L5X series. This strategic move diversifies Cirrus Logic beyond the smartphone market, aligning with Stifel's thesis on the High-Performance Mixed-Signal segment as a key growth driver. The company also reported strong Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations for EPS and revenue.

title: Socket Mobile (NASDAQ: SCKT) launches XtremeScan v16e industrial iPhone 16e scanners
summary: Socket Mobile (NASDAQ: SCKT) has launched the XtremeScan v16e industrial barcode scanners, redesigned and optimized for the iPhone 16e. The new line features an improved ergonomic design, higher-capacity battery, optional pistol grip with enhanced durability, and integrated scanning engines, all while retaining IP67 rugged protection and full access to the iPhone camera and touchscreen. XtremeScan v16e devices are available for preorder now and will be distributed globally starting Q1 2026.

title: The Walt Disney Company Nominates Ex-Apple COO Jeff Williams To Board
summary: The Walt Disney Company has nominated Jeff Williams, former Chief Operating Officer of Apple Inc., to join its board as an independent director. Williams, who retired from Apple in 2025 after nearly three decades, is recognized for his contributions to Apple's supply chain, design team, and the development of the Apple Watch. This nomination aims to expand Disney's governance and blend creative storytelling with technical innovation.

title: United States Satellite-to-Phone Service Market to Reach $3.28 Billion by 2032 | Leading companies - SpaceX (Starlink), Iridium Communications Inc., Globalstar Inc., Inmarsat
summary: The U.S. satellite-to-phone service market is projected to reach $3.28 billion by 2032, driven by increasing demand for global connectivity and emergency communication. Key players like SpaceX, Iridium, and Globalstar are spearheading advancements in direct-to-device connectivity. Recent industry developments in the U.S. and Japan highlight rapid expansion and regulatory support for these services across various applications and user segments.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) Stock on December 9, 2025: EU AI Probe, Antitrust Ruling and $400 Price Targets
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (GOOG) are trading lower due to new regulatory actions in Europe and the US, including an EU antitrust probe into its AI products and a US search antitrust judgment. Despite these regulatory pressures, the company reported record Q3 2025 results driven by AI demand and cloud growth. Analysts remain largely bullish, with price targets as high as $400, reflecting confidence in Alphabet's long-term AI strategy balanced against significant regulatory and competitive risks.

title: Adobe Photoshop, Express, and Acrobat now available for free on ChatGPT
summary: Adobe is integrating features from Photoshop, Express, and Acrobat directly into ChatGPT for free, allowing users to perform image edits, create animations, and manage PDFs using natural language prompts. This integration aims to make Adobe's tools more accessible and provide a faster way for both new and pro users to make quick edits within ChatGPT, with options to seamlessly transition to the full web-based applications for advanced control. The new functionalities are available on ChatGPT desktop, web, and iOS, with Android support for Photoshop and Acrobat coming soon.

title: Euronet Worldwide (EEFT) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Euronet Worldwide (NASDAQ: EEFT) rose after the company acquired CoreCard, expanding its presence in credit card issuing and flexible payment products. This strategic move aims to leverage the growing "buy now, pay later" (BNPL) market, which is projected to reach US$560 billion by the end of 2025. Although the stock initially jumped, it later cooled to $76.70.

title: The Apocalyptic Potential of the Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal
summary: This article discusses the acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery by Netflix and its potential ramifications for the film industry, particularly cinematic exhibition. It highlights the concerns raised by this deal, contrasting it with a potential Paramount merger, and explores Netflix's historical aversion to traditional theatrical windows. The author also touches upon Warner Bros.' recent creative successes despite its financial struggles, making the acquisition high-stakes, and speculates on the future of filmmaking amidst increasing corporate consolidation.

title: 1 Tech ETF to Buy Hand Over Fist and 1 to Avoid in 2026
summary: This article identifies one tech ETF to buy and one to avoid in 2026, targeting growth opportunities for investors. The recommended ETF is the Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQM) due to its lower expense ratio and diversification across top tech and other sectors. Conversely, the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is advised against because of its high concentration in just three stocks and its exclusion of major tech companies categorized in other sectors.

title: Nasdaq Market Activity December 9: Volume Leaders and Price Moves - News and Statistics
summary: On December 9, Nasdaq trading saw high volume led by Netcapital Inc. (over 130 million shares, up $0.9411 to $1.60) and Paranovus Entertainment Technology Ltd. (over 126 million shares, down $0.0038 to $0.0451). Major tech stocks like NVIDIA, Tesla, AMD, Apple, Plug Power, Intel, Palantir, and Meta also experienced significant trading activity, with mixed price movements. The report also covered activity in iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) and iShares Ethereum Trust ETF (ETHE).

title: Best Buy brings shoppers last-minute magic with savings, gifts and fast fulfillment
summary: Best Buy is offering last-minute holiday savings and fast fulfillment options for shoppers, including an Apple Sales Event, 3-Day Sales, and a Last-Minute Savings Event running until December 15th. The retailer also highlights gift ideas across various price points and provides multiple delivery and pickup options to ensure gifts arrive on time before Christmas. Customers can also trade in old tech for Best Buy e-Gift Cards.

title: Billionaire Warren Buffett Offers 184 Billion Reasons for Investors to Be Fearful in the New Year
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen net stock selling for three consecutive years, totaling $183.53 billion, according to its cash flow statements. This signals a cautious approach from Buffett, who often advises being "fearful when others are greedy." The "Buffett indicator" for market valuation also sits at a historically high 225%, suggesting an overvalued market, which aligns with Buffett's selling activity.

title: RedChip Companies Congratulates Former Client Cidara Therapeutics on Its $9.2 Billion Acquisition by Merck
summary: RedChip Companies, a leader in investor relations for microcap and small-cap companies, congratulated its former client, Cidara Therapeutics, on its $9.2 billion acquisition by Merck. RedChip had introduced Cidara to its investor network in 2021 when its market capitalization was under $100 million, highlighting its vision and the importance of early investment in promising small-cap opportunities. The acquisition focuses on Cidara’s investigational long-acting antiviral, CD388, which is in Phase 3 development and was granted Breakthrough Therapy Designation by the FDA.

title: Baldwin Insurance group executive Roche sells $376k in stock By Investing.com
summary: James Morgan Roche, President and CEO of Underwriting at Baldwin Insurance Group, sold 15,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $376,200. This sale comes as the company's shares have significantly declined, yet InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock is undervalued despite current market performance and recent strategic appointments within the company. Baldwin also reported exceeding analyst expectations in its Q3 2025 earnings.

title: Best Buy brings shoppers last-minute magic with savings, gifts and fast fulfillment (2025-12-10)
summary: Best Buy is offering last-minute holiday shoppers various savings events and deals on tech products, including Apple products, TVs, laptops, and more, leading up to Christmas. Shoppers can also find gifts for every budget across different product categories and utilize fast fulfillment options like curbside pickup and same-day delivery. Best Buy also highlights in-store experiences and e-gift card options for the very latest shoppers.

title: Zimmer Biomet Stock: Is ZBH Underperforming the Health Care Sector?
summary: Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. (ZBH) is a large-cap medical technology company specializing in orthopedic implants. The company's stock has underperformed the Health Care Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLV) over various periods, including a 12.7% decline year-to-date compared to XLV's 9% gain. ZBH also lags behind competitor Penumbra, Inc. (PEN) and analysts currently rate ZBH as a "Hold" with an 11.3% upside to the mean price target.

title: InterDigital (IDCC): Assessing Valuation After Legal Wins Boost Streaming Patent Revenue Prospects
summary: InterDigital (IDCC) has seen its valuation propelled by recent legal victories in Germany and Brazil regarding streaming patents, leading to significant share price growth. Despite a narrative fair value of $412 based on strong licensing agreements and recurring revenue, Simply Wall St's DCF model suggests a fair value of $70.67, indicating a potential overvaluation. Investors are weighing the impact of patent litigation wins, a reaffirmed dividend, and analyst targets against underlying cash flow strength and future growth prospects.

title: Costco (COST) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Costco (NASDAQ:COST) is set to report its Q4 earnings this Thursday afternoon, with analysts expecting revenue growth of 7.9% year over year to $67.03 billion and adjusted earnings of $4.27 per share. Despite positive investor sentiment in the non-discretionary retail segment, Costco's shares are down 3.1% over the last month, heading into earnings with an average analyst price target of $1,057, compared to its current share price of $887.58. The company has missed Wall Street's revenue estimates three times in the last two years.

title: Apple chip chief tells staff he’s not leaving 'anytime soon'
summary: Johny Srouji, Apple's chip chief, has assured his staff he is not leaving the company "anytime soon," following recent reports of his potential departure. Srouji, a senior vice president of hardware technologies, told his team directly that he loves his job and the company. Earlier reports indicated that CEO Tim Cook was working to retain Srouji, offering a substantial compensation package and increased responsibilities.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid PFBC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Preferred Bank (PFBC) has seen its stock rise by 11% over the past six months, in line with the S&P 500. However, analysts are cautious due to its net interest income growth slightly lagging the industry, a 74 basis point contraction in its net interest margin, and a decline in EPS and revenue over the last two years. The article suggests avoiding PFBC and instead seeking superior opportunities in other sectors.

title: Apple gets a big price target hike, and Wells Fargo plants a big dealmaking flag
summary: Citi has raised its price target on Apple to $330 due to anticipated iPhone sales growth and promising AI developments, while Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf aims to elevate the bank into a top-five player in Wall Street dealmaking. These updates highlight positive outlooks for both companies, based on new product cycles for Apple and strategic expansion for Wells Fargo.

title: A Triple-Leveraged Bet on Tech Giants: Examining the TQQQ ETF
summary: The ProShares UltraPro QQQ ETF (TQQQ) offers three times the daily return of the Nasdaq-100 Index, targeting leading technology companies. After recent volatility, TQQQ has shown renewed strength, with a year-to-date gain of 38.6%. Investors should be aware of the daily reset mechanism, which can cause long-term returns to diverge from simple triple leverage.

title: Former Apple COO Jeff Williams Nominated to Walt Disney Company Board of Directors
summary: The Walt Disney Company has nominated former Apple Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams to its board of directors, increasing the board's size from 10 to 11 members. Williams, who retired from Apple in July 2025, will stand for election as an independent director at Disney's 2026 annual shareholder meeting. He previously held roles such as Head of Worldwide Procurement and VP of Operations at Apple, and was central to the launch of the first iPhone and the Apple Watch project.

title: Disney nominates former Apple COO Williams to board
summary: The Walt Disney Company has nominated former Apple COO Jeff Williams to stand for election as a new independent director at the company’s 2026 annual meeting of shareholders. Williams, who retired earlier this year, was instrumental in developing the Apple Watch and architecting Apple's health and fitness strategy during his nearly three-decade career. His election will expand Disney's board to 11 members, effective from the 2026 annual meeting.

title: VIG ETF Near Record Highs at $220.60 — Dividend Growth and Fed Cuts Fuel 26' Upside
summary: The Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) is trading near its 52-week high at $220.60, demonstrating consistent investor demand for quality dividend growth. With a 10.61% total return over the past year and $116.6 billion in assets under management, VIG focuses on companies with at least 10 consecutive years of dividend increases, offering a resilient portfolio. Its low expense ratio, strong liquidity, and diversified holdings contribute to its appeal as a long-term dividend growth vehicle.

title: Old Dominion Freight Line board member resigns, board size reduced to eleven
summary: Old Dominion Freight Line announced the resignation of board member Debra S. King effective December 3, 2025, due to other professional commitments, reducing the board size to eleven members. In related news, the company reported a 4.4% decline in November 2025 revenue per day, while analyst ratings showed a mixed outlook, with Morgan Stanley and BMO Capital upgrading the stock, Rothschild Redburn initiating a "Sell" rating, and Benchmark maintaining "Hold."

title: Alphabet Stock Jumped 13.9% In November. What's Next?
summary: Alphabet's stock (GOOG, GOOGL) saw a significant 13.9% increase in November, outperforming the Nasdaq amidst broader tech sell-offs and AI bubble fears. This surge was attributed to the successful release of Google's new AI model, Gemini 3, which was trained on its own custom-built TPUs, validating its long-term investment in proprietary silicon. Despite a recent court ruling requiring annual renegotiation of its search contracts, the article suggests Alphabet's core business remains strong, positioning it well for future AI advancements.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Stock (BRK.A, BRK.B) Today: Leadership Shake-Up, Q3 Earnings, and 2026 Forecasts – December 9, 2025
summary: Berkshire Hathaway is undergoing a major transition with Warren Buffett stepping down as CEO at the end of 2025, to be replaced by Greg Abel, amidst a significant leadership reshuffle and strong Q3 2025 earnings. The stock is trading under mixed views, with analysts split on its future valuation and returns given the post-Buffett uncertainty. Investors are closely watching how the new leadership will manage capital allocation and maintain the company's unique culture and performance.

title: Spotify expands music videos access to premium users in US, Canada to take on YouTube
summary: Spotify is expanding music video access to its premium subscribers in the U.S. and Canada, aiming to compete with YouTube in the streaming market. This move follows a beta launch last year and is intended to enhance user engagement and attract more subscribers and advertisers. Spotify's shares saw a nearly 4% increase following the announcement.

title: Aflac EVP beaver sells $377k in stock after option exercise
summary: Aflac Executive Vice President and CFO of Aflac Japan, Steven Kent Beaver, sold 3,452 shares of common stock for $377,165 after exercising options to acquire the same number of shares. Following the transaction, Beaver directly owns 43,860 shares of Aflac. This news comes as Aflac reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, exceeding analyst expectations, and announced a dividend increase.

title: Euronet Targets Credit Growth With CoreCard Acquisition
summary: Euronet Worldwide is strategically expanding into credit card issuing and flexible payment products through its acquisition of CoreCard. This move aims to capitalize on the growing demand for revolving credit and BNPL services, enabling banks to modernize their systems with Euronet's robust and agile platform. The company seeks to differentiate itself from legacy processors and overcome challenges faced by many fintechs in the complex credit card landscape.

title: Spotify takes on YouTube as it expands video access to US and Canada
summary: Spotify is expanding its video access to premium subscribers in the US and Canada, aiming to compete with YouTube and boost user engagement with a limited catalog of music videos from artists like Ariana Grande. This move coincides with the company's pricing adjustments and a leadership transition, as Spotify prioritizes engagement metrics for growth. The expansion follows a successful beta test and is intended to strengthen Spotify's position against rival streaming services.

title: Go Big or Go Green: Should You Buy SPGM's Broad Diversification or NZAC's Climate Focus?
summary: This article compares two ETFs, SPDR Portfolio MSCI Global Stock Market ETF (SPGM) and SPDR MSCI ACWI Climate Paris Aligned ETF (NZAC), highlighting their different investment philosophies. SPGM offers broad, low-cost global equity exposure, suitable for a core portfolio, while NZAC applies a climate-focused ESG screen, appealing to investors prioritizing sustainability. Despite their differing focuses, both funds share similar top holdings and have shown comparable performance recently, driven by tech giants.

title: Klarna (KLAR) Hits High Q3 2025 Growth According to UBS' Timothy Chiodo
summary: Klarna reported strong Q3 2025 results, with both Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV) and revenue growing by over 20% year-over-year, surpassing expectations. This growth is attributed to an expanded merchant network, new retail partnerships, and the adoption of the Klarna Card. UBS analyst Timothy Chiodo lowered Klarna's price target to $46 from $48 but maintained a Buy rating on the shares.

title: Aurora Mobile launches AI-driven customer service platform LiveDesk
summary: Aurora Mobile (NASDAQ:JG) has launched LiveDesk, an AI-driven customer service platform through its EngageLab subsidiary. This new platform aims to help enterprises manage multi-channel customer communications by combining AI and human agents, potentially handling up to 90% of common inquiries and reducing operational costs by 70%. LiveDesk offers intelligent routing, smart ticketing, and data tracking across various communication channels and is applicable across industries like e-commerce, gaming, and lifestyle services.

title: Klarna (KLAR) expands Apple Pay Pay Later to France, Italy, 114M consumers
summary: Klarna has expanded its flexible payment options to France and Italy through Apple Pay, allowing millions of consumers to use installment payments online, in-app, and in-store. This expansion brings Klarna's Apple Pay integration to eight major markets globally. Customers can choose interest-free installments or longer payment plans with competitive interest rates after a responsible lending assessment.

title: QDVO ETF Price Targets $35 as Nasdaq Rally Boosts 9.8% Yield
summary: The Amplify CWP Growth & Income ETF (QDVO) is trading at $29.30, demonstrating strong performance with a 9.82% yield and a 17.95% annual return, outperforming peers like JEPQ. Its tactical covered call strategy and concentration in mega-cap tech stocks like Apple, NVIDIA, and Microsoft position it favorably for continued growth, with analysts setting near-term price targets of $32.50 and a medium-term target of $35.00. The fund is seen as a "Strong Buy" due to its hybrid growth-income design, robust yield, and strategic alignment with projected AI-driven earnings growth and anticipated Fed rate cuts in 2026.

title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Snap Win Streaks as Sentiment Cools
summary: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 ended their five-session winning streaks, closing lower as rising bond yields and impending Fed meeting jitters cooled market sentiment. Despite strong odds for a rate cut, the Dow also fell significantly. Commodities like crude oil and gold also experienced pressure due to the upcoming Fed decision and geopolitical tensions.

title: ICEBlock creator sues Trump administration officials saying they pressured Apple to remove it from the app store
summary: Joshua Aaron, creator of the ICEBlock app, is suing the Trump administration, alleging they abused government power and infringed on his free speech by pressuring Apple to remove his app from the app store. Aaron claims the app, which allowed users to report ICE agent sightings, is constitutionally protected speech and was designed to help people avoid contact with agents, not interfere with operations. The lawsuit seeks a declaration that the government's actions violated the First Amendment and an order blocking similar statements in the future.

title: Intel Stock After Hours: Why INTC Rebounded on December 8, 2025 — And What to Watch Before the December 9 Open
summary: Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) experienced a volatile session on December 8, 2025, initially falling but then rebounding after hours due to a late-day political headline regarding chip exports to China. This article details the factors that influenced Intel's stock movement, including a new partnership with Tata in India, the decision to retain its Networking and Edge (NEX) division, and the broader macro economic backdrop. It also provides insights into analyst sentiment and key points for investors to monitor before the market opens on December 9, 2025.

title: Should You Buy MP Materials Stock While It's Under $65?
summary: MP Materials, the sole operator of a scalable rare earth mine in the U.S., is crucial to the White House's plan for a domestic supply of rare earth elements. The company is poised to begin shipping U.S.-made high-performance magnets by late 2025, with further expansion plans into 2026, including a heavy rare-earth separation facility. While facing executional risks in scaling magnet factories, MP Materials offers a potential ground-floor opportunity for investors if it continues to hit milestones and receive government support.

title: Tornado Infrastructure Equipment Completes Acquisition by The Toro Company
summary: Tornado Infrastructure Equipment Ltd. has finalized its acquisition by The Toro Company, with Toro's affiliate Tornado Acquisition Company ULC purchasing all outstanding Class ‘A’ common shares for $1.92 per share. Consequently, Tornado's shares are slated for delisting from the TSX Venture Exchange, and the company has begun the process to cease being a reporting issuer in several Canadian provinces. This move signifies a major change for Tornado, a leader in the hydrovac truck industry.

title: Tesla Stock After Hours: Morgan Stanley Downgrade, China Milestone and 0% Deals – What to Know Before the Market Opens on December 9, 2025
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) experienced a volatile Monday due to a Morgan Stanley downgrade to "Equal-Weight," aggressive new buyer incentives, and a major production milestone in China. The downgrade, while raising the price target to $425, suggests that Tesla's AI and robotics potential is largely priced in and anticipates a choppy 12 months for the EV business. Meanwhile, Tesla is pushing year-end sales with 0% APR financing and other deals, and its Shanghai Gigafactory produced its 4 millionth vehicle, highlighting both scale advantages and concentration risks in China.

title: United Bankshares stock holds steady as KBW reiterates Market Perform rating
summary: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods (KBW) has reiterated its Market Perform rating and a $40.00 price target for United Bankshares Inc. (NASDAQ:UBSI), following a marketing session with the company. KBW projects increased capital deployment in 2026 for United Bankshares, driven by improved loan growth and buyback activity. Despite the stock remaining flat for the year, KBW maintains its neutral stance due to a rebound in share valuation and increased earnings estimates for future years.

title: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) Price Holds $90,218 as IBIT ETF at $51.19 Leads $352M Inflows
summary: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) is holding above $90,000, driven by significant institutional inflows into spot Bitcoin ETFs, totaling $352 million. While the iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) experienced temporary outflows, other ETFs like ARK's ARKB and Fidelity's FBTC saw strong capital inflows, indicating a broader institutional rebalancing and renewed conviction in Bitcoin as macro conditions suggest potential rate cuts. The article gives Bitcoin a "Strong Buy" rating with short-term targets of $97,000–$100,000.

title: Guarantor: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
summary: JPMorgan Chase Financial Company LLC has issued $555,000 Digital Barrier Notes guaranteed by JPMorgan Chase & Co. These notes are linked to the performance of the Nasdaq-100 Technology Sector Index and the S&P 500 Index, offering a 7.75% fixed return at maturity if both indices perform above 70% of their initial value. Investors face the risk of losing principal if either underlying index falls below its barrier amount.

title: 'Stay calm and Apple on:' Recent exec changes at iPhone maker not a worry: Evercore (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Evercore advises investors to "stay calm" despite recent executive changes at Apple, asserting that these departures are a pattern of controlled succession planning rather than a crisis. The firm suggests these leadership transitions could be a net positive, enabling a new generation to drive Apple's AI and innovation strategy. Concerns about further executive exits are eased by senior executives reaffirming their commitment to the company.

title: Tarsus Pharmaceuticals stock hits all-time high at 83.67 USD
summary: Tarsus Pharmaceuticals Inc. (TARS) stock reached an all-time high of $83.67, with current trading at $83.77, reflecting a significant 63.72% increase over the past year. The company boasts a strong financial position, with a 4.29 current ratio and substantial revenue growth of 182.44%, leading to a "strong buy" consensus among analysts. Recent news includes beating Q3 2025 earnings expectations and Mizuho initiating "Outperform" coverage with a $100 price target, highlighting their approved ophthalmology product, Xdemvy.

title: Spotify to Hike US Premium Prices to $12.99+ in Q1 2026
summary: Spotify is preparing for its third US premium price hike in as many years, expected in Q1 2026, which could push individual plans to $12.99 or higher. This move is driven by pressures from record labels, inflation, and investments in new features like audiobooks, aiming to boost profitability. The company faces mixed user reactions and competitive challenges as it seeks to balance increased revenue with user retention.

title: Apple's chip boss squashes exit rumors, says he's not leaving the company
summary: Apple's chip leader Johny Srouji has denied rumors of his impending departure in a memo to staff, stating he loves his job and team at Apple and has no plans to leave. This comes after Bloomberg reported he was considering leaving, and amidst several other high-profile executive exits at the company. Srouji is crucial to Apple's chip development, including the M-series and A-series chips.

Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in Intel, which now constitutes 0.8% of WINTON GROUP Ltd's investment portfolio. The article also touches on Intel's stock performance, recent earnings, guidance, and analyst ratings, alongside other institutional buying activities.

title: Now available: Create YouTube Shorts from Adobe Premiere Mobile
summary: Adobe has partnered with YouTube to integrate YouTube Shorts creation directly into the Adobe Premiere mobile app. This new feature provides creators with exclusive templates, transitions, and effects, making it faster and easier to produce and publish short-form video content. The update aims to help creators stand out and grow their audience on YouTube, leveraging powerful Adobe editing tools and AI-powered features.

title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Tech-Sorgen belasten
summary: The global stock market is experiencing volatility due to high AI valuations shifting capital into defensive sectors, though strong tech earnings continue to provide fundamental support. Despite current consolidation, robust earnings from these tech heavyweights are essential to maintaining the structural upward trend amid valuation concerns.

title: AeroVironment stock price target lowered to $400 by RBC Capital
summary: RBC Capital has decreased its price target for AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) to $400 from $440, while reaffirming an Outperform rating. This adjustment comes ahead of the company's fiscal second-quarter 2026 results, with analysts anticipating continued strong revenue growth despite potential impacts from a recent government shutdown on bookings. The firm believes upcoming results could act as a positive catalyst for the stock, which has recently underperformed but shown strong longer-term returns.

title: Morgan Stanley’s new Tesla analyst cuts stock rating on rich valuation
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) stock to Equal Weight due to elevated expectations for its AI-driven businesses making the stock’s valuation appear rich. The firm set a $425 price target, implying a 6.5% downside from current levels, despite acknowledging Tesla's leadership in EVs, energy, and AI. The new lead analyst, Andrew Percoco, believes non-auto segment catalysts are largely priced in, and anticipates a choppy trading environment with downside risk to Street estimates.

title: Alphabet Stock Wins a New Street-High Price Target as AI Momentum Accelerates
summary: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) has received a new Street-high price target of $400 from Pivotal's Jeffrey Wlodarczak, up from $350, due to its strong position in the AI transition. The bullish outlook is driven by Google's resilient search business, the advanced Gemini AI, and the significant partnership with Apple, which is expected to boost margins and market share. Wlodarczak anticipates that Google's TPUs and dominant position on handsets will further solidify its AI leadership, despite potential market consolidation driven by issues faced by competitors like OpenAI.

title: Should Investors Give Intel Stock Another Look After Its AI Strategy Reset?
summary: Intel, which previously struggled with missed opportunities, has undergone a significant strategy reset under CEO Lip-Bu Tan, focusing heavily on AI inference and forging key partnerships. While this new direction has led to a remarkable turnaround in its stock performance and financials, its current high price-to-earnings ratio suggests that now might not be the optimal time for new investors to buy in. The company's focus on AI inference, partnerships with Nvidia, and improved financial results offer a promising outlook for long-term investment once the stock price adjusts.

title: Intel networks U-turn is a relief for Ericsson and Samsung
summary: Intel has decided against selling its Network and Edge (NEX) business, opting to keep it in-house. This decision is a relief for key 5G customers like Ericsson and Samsung, who feared a change of ownership could disrupt their critical supplier relationships for virtual radio access network (RAN) chips. The move enables tighter integration between Intel's silicon, software, and systems, strengthening customer offerings in AI, data center, and edge segments.

title: Riyadh Air and IBM Partner to Launch World's First AI-Native Airline
summary: Riyadh Air and IBM have announced a partnership to launch Riyadh Air as the world's first AI-native airline, incorporating AI into its foundational operations. Leveraging IBM Consulting's expertise and IBM watsonx Orchestrate, Riyadh Air aims to transform guest and employee experiences by eliminating legacy systems and creating a new benchmark in aviation. This collaboration, which has reached a pivotal moment with initial flights underway, is set to redefine modern enterprise through AI-driven agility and innovation.

title: Executive Exodus Hits Apple As Fears Grow Over Possible Chip Chief Departure
summary: Apple is experiencing significant executive turnover, with several key personnel, including heads of AI and interface design, departing. This exodus is causing concern, particularly with the potential departure of Johny Srouji, senior VP of hardware technologies, which could impact Apple's in-house chip initiative and AI development as competitors lure away talent. Despite CEO Tim Cook's assurances about innovative products, the company faces challenges in AI and has not launched a successful new product category in a decade.

title: Key facts: Apple Invests in AI; Faces Leadership Changes and Competition
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) is actively investing in AI infrastructure and data centers, aligning with other major tech companies in the AI race. These changes, coupled with talent poaching by rivals and product delays, have led to negative market reactions.

(NYSE American:CLDI) and Nova Minerals Limited (Nasdaq:NVA) on the RedChip Small Stocks, Big Money ™ show on Bloomberg TV this Saturday, December 6, at 7 p.m. Eastern Time (ET). Srouji has been instrumental in developing Apple's custom silicon for iPhones, iPads, and Macs.

title: This AI ETF Could Dominate for Decades to Come

These companies remain strong draws for investors, maintaining positive analyst outlooks despite individual challenges.

title: iOS 26.2 Will Add Two New Features To CarPlay In December
summary: Apple is set to release iOS 26.2, which will introduce two new CarPlay features: the ability to unpin messages directly from the infotainment display and the option to add a third widget to the home screen. These updates build on larger CarPlay improvements released with iOS 26, including the Liquid Glass design and enhanced notification management. The new widget option may, however, impact Live Activities display.

summary: Intel (INTC) shares experienced significant volatility in early December 2025 due to a $5 billion Nvidia equity stake, government backing, and rumors of Apple potentially becoming a foundry client. The stock, currently trading around $41.41, faces a mixed Wall Street consensus, with most analysts suggesting limited upside despite Intel's operational improvements and strategic push into AI and foundry services. The company's future hinges on the successful execution of its 18A/14A technology roadmap and securing major external foundry customers.

title: Meta AI Becomes Real-Time News Hub With New Media Partnerships

Meta is also shifting its investment strategy by scaling back metaverse spending to prioritize AI development and infrastructure.

title: US lawmakers press Google, Apple to remove apps tracking immigration agents
summary: The House Committee on Homeland Security has urged Google and Apple to remove mobile applications that allow users to track federal immigration officers, citing safety concerns for DHS personnel. While both companies have previously removed apps like ICEBlock, lawmakers are requesting a briefing by December 12th to ensure these apps cannot be used to target officers or obstruct lawful immigration enforcement. The committee emphasized that free speech does not protect advocacy that incites imminent lawless action.

title: Heavy Tech Weighting Poses Challenge for iShares MSCI World ETF

The ETF's heavy concentration in U.S. technology giants, making up over 70% of its portfolio, is a key risk factor amid reassessments of AI equities and expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut. The article questions whether investors should buy or sell the MSCI World ETF given its tech-heavy composition and ongoing market shifts.

Despite this reduction, the fund still holds 221,451 shares of SLQD, worth $11.26 million, indicating a routine portfolio rebalancing rather than a loss of confidence in the ETF. SLQD accounts for 0.84% of Waterloo Capital's AUM and is noted for its low expense ratio and attractive dividend yield, making it a viable option for conservative investors.

title: Reborn Coffee to be delisted from Nasdaq Capital Market on December 11
summary: Reborn Coffee, Inc. (NASDAQ:REBN) announced it will be delisted from the Nasdaq Capital Market on December 11, 2025, due to non-compliance with the minimum stockholders' equity rule. The company, facing severe financial distress with a market capitalization of $11 million and an Altman Z-Score of -12.78, plans to appeal Nasdaq's decision and present a compliance plan. In related news, Reborn Coffee has recently seen leadership changes, including new directors and an interim CFO, and the formation of a new advisory board.

title: 3 Reasons Costco Stock Is Struggling

Furthermore, the company lacks a near-term catalyst as a membership fee increase is unlikely for several years, following a recent hike.

summary: Sprouts Farmers Market, a Phoenix-based grocery chain, has historically prohibited filming in its stores. The show features multiple scenes in a Sprouts store, not as a product placement deal, but because the writer and director specifically requested the brand.

title: Billionaire Warren Buffett Has Over $75 Billion Invested in 3 "Magnificent" Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks
summary: Warren Buffett, CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, has over $75 billion invested in three "Magnificent Seven" AI stocks: Apple, Alphabet, and Amazon. While Buffett's initial investment rationale for these companies was not directly AI-related, focusing instead on strong moats and customer loyalty, these companies are now significantly involved in AI development. Apple is integrating "Apple Intelligence" into its products, Google Cloud (Alphabet) is using generative AI, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) is deploying AI and LLM solutions for its subscribers.

title: AI Growth Will Keep Magnificent 7 The Place To Be In 2026, BlackRock Says
summary: BlackRock predicts that artificial intelligence will continue to drive market leadership, growth, and inflation for years to come, with global AI capital expenditure reaching $5-8 trillion by 2030, primarily in the U.S. This shift toward a capital-intensive AI regime will sustain economic growth despite cooling traditional business-cycle indicators. BlackRock also warns against divesting from U.S. megacap tech, viewing it as an active bet against the primary engine of global growth, and expects structurally higher term premia in bond markets due to increased debt and sticky inflation, discouraging long-duration Treasury investments.

title: QLD vs. SSO: Which 2x Leveraged ETF Is Best for Investors Right Now?

These departures occur as Apple (AAPL) navigates market challenges and strategic shifts.

(MP), highlighting its founder James Litinsky's vision to re-establish a fully integrated U.S. mine-to-magnet rare earth supply chain. While execution remains a key challenge, the company has the potential to deliver substantial long-term value.

summary: Intel's stock (INTC) has retreated after a significant rally fueled by rumors of an Apple chip manufacturing deal, aggressive AI ambitions, and a major U.S. government equity stake. title: LiveOne Announces Tesla Subscription Pricing

Two tiers are offered: LiveOne Plus ($3.99/month or $34.99/year) provides an ad-free experience with unlimited skips and premium stations, while LiveOne Premium ($9.99/month or $99.99/year) adds on-demand listening, queuing, and download capabilities, though these are not currently supported in Tesla vehicles. The article also mentions ongoing regulatory scrutiny in the EU, Meta's talent acquisition of Alan Dye, and Evercore ISI's optimistic outlook for WhatsApp's revenue potential.

title: From reckoning to renewal: An interview with KKR’s Philipp Freise
summary: Philipp Freise of KKR discusses how Europe can leverage its current challenges—including security threats and technological shifts—to drive a new wave of growth. He emphasizes the need for capital markets reform, scaled innovation, and the strategic application of AI across industries. Freise believes that with urgency, coordination, and public-private partnerships, Europe can transform adversity into progress and foster its next generation of champions.

title: Apple shuffles executive ranks again, as Adams and Jackson set to depart (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Apple is undergoing another executive reshuffle, with long-time general counsel Kate Adams and head of environmental policy Lisa Jackson set to leave the company. Jennifer Newstead will take over as the new general counsel, leading both legal and government affairs, while the departure of Jackson raises questions about the future direction of Apple's sustainability initiatives. These leadership changes also include adjustments in AI leadership, potentially impacting Apple's machine learning strategy.

title: Globalstar, Inc. (GSAT): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article presents a bullish thesis on Globalstar, Inc. (GSAT), as outlined by Francesco Ferrari on Business Invest’s Substack. It highlights Globalstar's LEO satellite network, strategic partnership with Apple for iPhone emergency messaging, strong revenue growth, high gross and free cash flow margins, and impressive 5-year stock performance. Despite negative ROIC and a decrease in hedge fund holdings, the thesis emphasizes the company's long-term potential in satellite-enabled communication services.

title: Apple announces departure of general counsel and policy chief
summary: Apple announced the retirement of its general counsel, Kate Adams, and its vice president for environment, policy, and social initiatives, Lisa Jackson. These departures signify a continued trend of senior leadership exits at Apple, following other recent high-profile retirements. Jennifer Newstead, currently Meta's legal and regulatory head, will take over as Apple's new general counsel.

title: Meta Tried Poaching Talent Largely Unsuccessfully, Says OpenAI Exec: 'Zuck Actually Went And Hand Delivered Soup To People He Was Trying To Recruit'
summary: An OpenAI executive revealed that Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg personally delivered homemade soup to AI researchers he was trying to poach, indicating the intense competition for top talent. Despite Meta's aggressive recruitment efforts and substantial budget, many of OpenAI's direct reports declined Meta's offers. This highlights the fierce "recruitment wars" in the AI sector, where personal gestures are becoming part of the hiring strategy.

title: Nvidia, other tech giants grilled over money for Trump's ballroom
summary: Democratic lawmakers, led by Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Rep. Dave Min, are demanding answers from Nvidia, Meta, Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon regarding their significant donations to President Donald Trump's ballroom. They are concerned these contributions could be a "quid-pro-quo" for favorable government treatment and potentially violate federal bribery law. The letters inquire about the donation timeline, business interests with the U.S. government, discussions with Trump aides, and potential tax benefits.

title: Apple, Tesla accused of profiting from abuses, environment destruction
summary: Apple Inc. and Tesla Inc. are facing separate lawsuits alleging "deceptive marketing" by portraying their products as ethically and sustainably manufactured. The lawsuits claim both companies profit from raw materials like cobalt and coltan sourced from the Democratic Republic of Congo, which are linked to child labor, forced labor, and severe human rights and environmental abuses. Both companies are accused of violating consumer protection laws, with Apple denying the claims and Tesla not issuing a response.

title: BTIG thinks Apple stock is poised to drop, PepsiCo nears settlement
summary: BTIG analysts believe Apple's stock is overextended and expect a drop, while PepsiCo is reportedly nearing a settlement with activist investor Elliott Management. Brown-Forman Corporation, known for Jack Daniels, warned of a challenging outlook for 2026, though its recent results were seen as better than feared. The article highlights these key stock movements and market reactions based on analyst insights and company announcements.

title: Intel Stock Near 52‑Week High as Apple Chip Rumors, Malaysia Expansion and NEX Pivot Redefine the 2025 Story
summary: Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: INTC) is trading near a 52-week high, driven by Apple foundry rumors for its 18A process, significant manufacturing investments in Malaysia for packaging and test facilities, and a strategic decision to keep its Network and Edge (NEX) unit in-house. Despite strong Q3 2025 earnings fueled by AI and PC demand, Wall Street analysts remain cautious, with average price targets below the current share price, citing high valuation and continued foundry losses. The article highlights both bull and bear cases, emphasizing future milestones like Q4 earnings, 18A yield performance, and Apple's final decision as critical for the stock's trajectory.

title: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company (GT): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article presents a bullish thesis on The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company (GT), highlighting its strategic divestitures, debt reduction, and operational improvements. Despite recent weak headline numbers due to non-cash charges, the company's "Forward" program is delivering substantial savings, and the shift towards premium, high-margin operations is expected to drive a re-rating as leverage normalizes and cash generation accelerates. Although the stock has depreciated since a previous bullish coverage, the underlying fundamentals are stable, supported by increasing hedge fund interest.

title: Corning Stock Rises 75.9% YTD: How to Play the Stock?
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) has seen a 75.9% year-to-date increase, driven by strong demand in its Specialty Materials and Optical Communications segments, with particular growth from consumer electronics and AI data centers. The company also boasts solid cash flow, robust liquidity, and an attractive valuation, earning it a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).

title: Jamf Holding Corp. (JAMF): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Jamf Holding Corp. (JAMF), highlighting its leadership in Apple device management and growing security solutions. JAMF serves over 75,000 customers, manages 35 million devices, and has expanded its product portfolio into security, which now accounts for nearly 30% of its total ARR. Despite market skepticism leading to low valuations, the company is experiencing improving bookings, aggressive margin expansion, and strong competitive positioning, with potential catalysts for significant stock appreciation.

title: GXO Logistics, Inc. (GXO): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on GXO Logistics, Inc. (GXO), a pure-play contract logistics company that leverages automation to optimize supply chains for major global enterprises. Despite thin operating margins, GXO generates stable, recurring revenue, with profitability expected to improve through scaling automation. The company operates in a growing global logistics market, and strategic acquisitions are expected to further expand its scale and margins, making GXO a compelling investment.

title: Edgestream Partners L.P. Takes $4.10 Million Position in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS
summary: Edgestream Partners L.P. has initiated a significant position in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. by acquiring 55,044 shares valued at over $4.10 million in Q2. title: Apple design executive Alan Dye poached by Meta in major coup
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has hired Alan Dye, Apple's head of user interface design since 2015, in a significant move underscoring Meta's push into AI-equipped consumer devices. Dye will lead a new design studio at Meta, focusing on hardware, software, and AI integration for interfaces, reporting to Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth. This departure marks another loss for Apple's design team after Jony Ive's exit in 2019, while Meta aims to revamp its consumer devices with AI features.

title: Apple (AAPL) Price Target Raised as Loop Capital Sees Stronger iPhone 17 Demand
summary: Loop Capital analyst Gary Mobley has raised the price target for Apple (AAPL) to $325.00 from $315.00, reiterating a "Buy" rating. This adjustment is based on updated iPhone estimates, reflecting a "material increase" in anticipated iPhone 17 base model units and incorporating iPhone 18 models into their projections along with lower ASPs. The firm's research indicates a shift in demand, with stronger interest in the iPhone 17 base model compared to previous estimates for Pro/Pro Max models.

title: Russell Investments Group Ltd. Buys 11,595 Shares of Cirrus Logic, Inc. $CRUS
summary: Russell Investments Group Ltd. increased its holdings in Cirrus Logic, Inc. by 12.2% in the second quarter, bringing its total ownership to 106,864 shares valued at $11.16 million. title: (AAPY) and the Role of Price-Sensitive Allocations

authors: Luke Campbell, Thomas H. Kee Jr.

title: Vericel’s chief medical officer sells $64,659 in VCEL stock
summary: Vericel's Chief Medical Officer, Jonathan Mark Hopper, sold 1,652 shares of VCEL stock for $64,659 on December 2, 2025, while also exercising options to acquire an equivalent number of shares. This transaction was part of a pre-arranged trading plan, and Hopper now directly owns 66,562 shares. The company recently reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, surpassing revenue and EPS expectations.

title: Resideo Redefines Smart Comfort with Launch of Honeywell Home X8S Smart Thermostat
summary: Resideo Technologies has launched the Honeywell Home X8S smart thermostat, claiming it redefines smart comfort. This new thermostat features a large touchscreen that can stream live video from compatible doorbells, alongside offering precision sensing, control, and an intuitive interface. It also includes advanced features like indoor air quality monitoring, proactive HVAC system alerts, and intelligent energy savings.

title: The AI Surge Fuels Unprecedented Gains for the Broad Market iShares ETF
summary: The iShares Russell 3000 ETF (IWV) is showing significant strength, driven by enthusiasm for AI and solid corporate earnings, despite a high concentration in its top ten holdings. Mega-cap tech stocks and the AI revolution, particularly Nvidia, are the main engines of growth. However, concerns about mega-cap valuations and potential market bubbles are rising, making the IWV ETF a critical barometer for the US equity market's health.

title: Devvstream stock plunges after merger announcement with Southern Energy
summary: DevvStream Corp (NASDAQ:DEVS) stock plunged 14.1% after announcing a definitive agreement to merge with Southern Energy Renewables. The combined entity will be a new U.S.-domiciled, Nasdaq-listed company focused on producing carbon-negative sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) and green methanol, with Southern equity holders owning approximately 70% and DevvStream shareholders retaining about 30%. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2026, aiming to help aviation and maritime operators meet global emissions mandates.

title: Blue-Chip Index Pops as Interest Rate Cut Anticipation Grows
summary: Wall Street saw significant gains following a weaker-than-expected ADP private payrolls report, increasing anticipation for another Federal Reserve interest rate cut next week. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 408 points, reaching its highest close in three weeks, as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq also posted strong performances. Adding to the positive sentiment was a better-than-expected October services purchasing managers' index (PMI) reading from the Institute for Supply Management (ISM).

title: Cnx Resources stock hits 52-week high at 39.86 USD

Despite aggressive share buybacks, the stock's RSI suggests it may be in overbought territory.

title: PayPal (PYPL) Stock Today: Selloff After Checkout Warning, AI Commerce Deals and 2025–2026 Forecast
summary: PayPal (PYPL) experienced a sharp selloff after management warned of slowing branded checkout growth, despite strong Q3 2025 earnings, a new dividend, and strategic moves into AI commerce with OpenAI and Perplexity. The stock trades at value-stock multiples, leading to a split among analysts regarding whether it represents a value opportunity or a trap, with forecasts for 2025-2026 focusing on its ability to leverage new initiatives against competitive pressures. Investors are closely watching Q4 results, AI commerce adoption metrics, and BNPL performance for future direction.

title: Intel (INTC) Stock Surges on Apple Chip Rumors and $208M Malaysia Expansion: 2025 Rally, Analyst Forecasts and What’s Next
summary: Intel (INTC) stock has surged due to rumors of Apple becoming an Intel Foundry customer and a new $208 million expansion in Malaysia. While analysts remain cautious with "Hold" ratings and price targets below current levels, the news validates Intel's 18A process and strengthens its position in global manufacturing and U.S. industrial policy. The company's Q3 2025 results showed early improvements, but challenges remain in foundry execution and competition.

title: S&P: Global Credit Outlook For 2026 Looks Resilient, If Uneven, Report Says
summary: S&P Global Ratings predicts a resilient but uneven global credit outlook for 2026, driven by sustained economic growth, tech investments, and proactive refinancing. While defaults are expected to remain contained, geopolitical tensions and potential overinvestment in AI could introduce volatility and challenges. The report highlights diverging performance across sectors and geographies, with the U.S. and China slowing while the eurozone recovers and emerging markets continue their resilient streak.

title: Best Cyber Monday 2025 deals still live at Best Buy: AirPods Max, Windows laptops, and more
summary: Many Cyber Monday deals are still available at Best Buy, even after the official sale period has ended. The article highlights specific products and their discounted prices, emphasizing that Best Buy offers a holiday price match guarantee for purchases made after October 31.

title: Intel: More Potential Ahead With New Likely Partnerships For Contract Chipmaking Business
summary: The bull case for Intel Corporation hinges on its Foundry business securing tier-one external customers, with recent unconfirmed Apple deal rumors sparking market sentiment. While the 118% rally since August is notable, fundamental improvements for Intel are primarily seen in margins and earnings due to cost cuts in Foundry operations. The article suggests that INTC shares will remain susceptible to momentum traders until significant manufacturing contracts are secured, which could then re-rate its valuation.

title: Apple Design Executive Alan Dye Poached by Meta in Major Coup
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has hired Alan Dye, Apple's head of user interface design since 2015, signaling Meta's aggressive push into AI-equipped consumer devices. This move is considered a major coup, with Apple replacing Dye with Stephen Lemay.

title: Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 5: 36% Faster Than Apple, AI-Enhanced for Mid-Range Androids
summary: Qualcomm has unveiled its Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chipset, co-developed with OnePlus, aiming to challenge Apple's silicon dominance. The new chip claims 36% better overall performance than its predecessor, enhanced AI capabilities via its Hexagon NPU, and 3nm efficiency, targeting mid-range Android devices. This strategic move by Qualcomm seeks to provide premium features more affordably, reshaping competition in the mobile market.

title: Intel Stock Surges on Apple Deal Buzz: Can INTC Sustain This Momentum?
summary: Intel's stock surged 8.7% following rumors of a potential deal with Apple to develop M-series chips for MacBooks and iPad Pros by early 2027. This development, coupled with Intel's focus on AI PCs, new processor developments, and significant capital infusions from NVIDIA, Softbank, and the U.S. government, positions the company for growth despite past innovation lags and challenges in the Chinese market. However, declining earnings estimates and margin pressures suggest investors should proceed with caution.

title: Intel (INTC) Hits New Record on Apple Deal Hype
summary: Intel (INTC) reached a new record high due to speculation that it might supply chips to Apple Inc. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo suggested Apple could tap Intel for its lowest-end M-series chips within two years, improving Intel's visibility as an advanced-node supplier. This development is part of Intel's broader turnaround efforts, which also include a $5 billion investment from Nvidia Corp. and a 10 percent stake acquisition by the US government.
