title: Microsoft Stock Falls After Software Giant Reportedly Revises AI Sales Targets As Growth Falls Short Of Expectation
summary: Microsoft's stock fell over 2% after The Information reported that the tech giant revised its AI sales targets. Less than 20% of employees in the Azure cloud division met their projected Foundry sales growth for the fiscal year ending June, leading to scaled-back expectations for AI offerings. Microsoft had implemented new benchmarks in July, aiming for a 25% growth goal for AI products for fiscal year 2026.

title: Intel (INTC) Stock Soars on Apple Chip Rumors and $208M Malaysia Expansion
summary: Intel (INTC) stock has surged around 90-100% in 2025, reaching new 52-week highs, driven by a $208 million expansion in Malaysia, increasing speculation that Apple may become a foundry customer, and a 9.9% equity stake by the U.S. government. Despite the rally, analysts remain cautious, with average price targets suggesting a downside, reflecting concerns about execution risk, capital intensity, and political involvement. The company's turnaround hinges on successful execution of its 18A and 14A process nodes and securing external foundry customers like Microsoft and potentially Apple.

title: Onemain Holdings stock hits all-time high at 63.27 USD

The property, now called The Abbey at Aventura, is adjacent to the Aventura Mall, which is also owned by the buyers. This acquisition highlights the strong Miami retail market, which had one of the lowest retail vacancy rates in the country at 3.1 percent through Q2 2025.

Wall Street analysts, however, maintain a "Strong Buy" rating with a considerable potential upside.

summary: Apple has appointed Amar Subramanya, a former Microsoft and Google AI expert, as its new Vice President of AI, replacing John Giannandrea. This leadership change signals Apple's intensified focus on advancing its AI capabilities amid strong competition. Subramanya will lead key AI teams, including work on Apple Foundation Models and ML research, aiming to accelerate updates to products like Siri and Apple Intelligence.

summary: CNBC's "Halftime Report Final Trades" featured picks for Nike Inc (NKE), Amazon.com Inc (AMZN), Delta Air Lines Inc (DAL), and Apple Inc (AAPL). Apple saw a leadership transition within its AI group following its Apple Intelligence platform launch.

title: Top Research Reports for Apple, Tesla & Micron Technology
summary: This article presents Zacks' top research reports for major stocks like Apple, Tesla, and Micron Technology, along with micro-cap companies Hamilton Beach Brands and Key Tronic Corp, as of December 2, 2025. title: All 30 Dow Jones Stocks Ranked: Buy, Sell or Hold?
summary: The article ranks all 30 Dow Jones Industrial Average stocks based on analysts' consensus recommendations, from Strong Buy to Hold. The ranking provides investors with insights into which Dow components Wall Street favors amid economic uncertainties.

title: Apple Just Parted Ways With Its Head of AI Over a Key Feature That Still Frustrates Users
summary: John Giannandrea, Apple's head of machine learning and AI strategy, is departing the company after failing to deliver significant AI updates, particularly for Siri. His departure follows reports of internal conflicts and indecision that delayed key AI initiatives. Amar Subramanya, formerly of Microsoft and Google, will replace Giannandrea, reporting to Craig Federighi, as Apple prepares for major AI improvements in iOS 27 next year.

title: Apple’s AI chief paid the price for the company’s stalled progress
summary: John Giannandrea, Apple's AI chief, is stepping down after seven years due to the company's perceived stalled progress in generative AI, affecting Siri and other devices. His departure, effective next spring, follows a reallocation of his AI group to Craig Federighi's software development team and signals Apple's new urgency to catch up in the AI race with the hiring of Amar Subramanya from Google. The news led to a slight boost in Apple's stock price, reflecting investor optimism for a renewed AI strategy.

title: INTC: Intel Shares Slide as Apple Bonanza Talk Faces Reality Check
summary: Intel shares dropped by 1.5% after an earlier 10% surge, as investors reevaluated an analyst's prediction about Intel supplying Apple with low-end M processors starting in 2027. While this potential deal could validate Intel's foundry efforts, analysts caution that volumes would be small, and Intel still faces challenges in consistent execution to compete with TSMC and Samsung. The company's road to recovery is fragile, marked by competitive and legal headwinds despite recent momentum.

title: Wall Street's Sleeping Giant: Is Amazon About to Wake Up?

Despite a flat year, the stock is considered cheaper than many tech peers, offering an appealing risk-reward profile for investors heading into 2026. Analyst price targets suggest significant upside, with some forecasting over 50% growth.

title: KLA, IBD Stock Of The Day, Flashes Buy Signal Amid AI Demand
summary: KLA (KLAC) has been named IBD Stock Of The Day, flashing a buy signal as it bounces off its 50-day/10-week moving average amid strong AI chip demand. The company boasts a Composite Rating of 96/99 and an Industry Group Ranking of 14/197, indicating strong fundamentals and market position. While currently in an emerging base, analysts expect its actionable buy point to solidify by the end of next week.

title: Peter Thiel Sells All His Nvidia Shares and Buys Microsoft and Apple Instead

He subsequently reinvested these proceeds into Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). This move comes amidst concerns about an AI bubble and growing competition in the chipmaking sector, with Thiel seemingly favoring the established tech giants for their strong financial performance and AI integration strategies.

title: Walmart credits AI, fast delivery for strong Black Friday-Cyber Monday
summary: Walmart reported strong sales growth, led by digital, over the Black Friday and Cyber Monday shopping period, attributing its success to advanced technology like its generative AI assistant "Sparky" and efficient ship-from-store operations. The company saw a significant increase in orders delivered from stores and utilized its app for in-store customer engagement, with top-selling items including Apple Airpods and gaming consoles. Walmart has extended some Cyber Monday deals and will offer last-minute deals throughout December.

title: Apple names Microsoft, Google veteran Amar Subramanya as AI chief
summary: Apple has appointed Amar Subramanya, a veteran from Microsoft and Google's DeepMind, as its new AI chief, replacing John Giannandrea. This move comes as Apple aims to bolster its artificial intelligence efforts, which experts have suggested lagged behind competitors, especially after OpenAI's ChatGPT launch. Subramanya will lead critical areas including Apple Foundation Models, ML research, and AI Safety and Evaluation, reporting to software chief Craig Federighi.

title: Apple continues gain for seven straight sessions (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Apple (AAPL) shares have experienced a gain for seven consecutive sessions, closing 1% higher at $286.15 on Tuesday. The tech giant's stock rose over 4% in the preceding six sessions and is up nearly 13% year-to-date.

title: Buffett Bought Alphabet After I Named It My Top Tech Stock (GOOG, BRK.B)
summary: The article discusses why Alphabet (GOOGL) is considered a top tech stock, highlighting its stable core businesses like Search and YouTube that fund AI and chip expansion. title: EU to assess gatekeeper status after Apple confirms its services meet Digital Markets Act requirements
summary: Apple has informed the European Commission that its Apple ad and Apple Maps services meet the thresholds established by the Digital Markets Act (DMA). The European Commission will now have 45 working days to determine whether to designate Apple as a "gatekeeper" under the DMA regulations. This decision will impact Apple's operations within the EU, potentially subjecting it to stricter rules regarding its digital services.

title: What time will Walmart stores open on Black Friday? Timings, locations, and more to know
summary: Walmart announces its Black Friday plans for 2025, with stores opening at 6 AM on Friday, November 28, and closing at 11 PM. The event features deals on electronics, toys, and apparel, with early online access for Walmart+ members beginning November 24. Walmart emphasizes budget-friendly options and a convenient shopping experience, encouraging customers to check local store hours online.

title: TSMC Ex-VP's Home Raided As Chip Giant Alleges Intel Recruit Leaked Trade Secrets
summary: Taiwan prosecutors raided the homes of a former TSMC vice president, Wei-Jen Lo, following allegations from TSMC that he leaked confidential trade secrets to Intel Corp after joining them. Authorities seized devices and froze Lo's assets as part of the investigation into suspected violations of Taiwan's National Security Act. While TSMC believes there's a "high probability" Lo disclosed sensitive 5-nanometer, 3-nanometer, and 2-nanometer manufacturing process details, Intel denies the claims and states employee movement between chipmakers is common.

title: Is Trimble Fairly Priced After Its 7.3% Weekly Surge and Digital Expansion News?
summary: Trimble's stock has seen significant gains, up 7.3% in the past week and 16.6% year-to-date, driven by its expansion into digital construction technologies. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Trimble is undervalued by 20.9% at $102.69 per share, while its Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 54.07x indicates it is overvalued compared to industry averages and Simply Wall St’s proprietary "Fair Ratio" of 33.65x. The article encourages investors to use "Narratives" to form their own valuation based on personal views of the company's future.

title: Handelsbanken Fonder AB Cuts Stock Holdings in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS
summary: Handelsbanken Fonder AB significantly reduced its stake in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. ($SWKS) by 69.7% in Q2, selling 87,911 shares and retaining 38,200 shares worth $2.85 million. title: “Biggest launch ever" planned for Royal Caribbean’s Legend of the Seas
summary: Royal Caribbean is planning its "biggest launch ever" for the Legend of the Seas, set to debut in July 2026. The launch event in London featured promises from executives for an unprecedented welcome for the ship in Europe, with its inaugural sailing from Civitavecchia (Rome). The company also plans significant investments in new "zero emissions" cruise terminals and the use of virtual reality tools for sales and marketing.

title: ETtech Explainer: Why Apple is fighting India’s heavy-fine rule
summary: Apple has filed a challenge in the Delhi High Court against new Indian antitrust rules that allow the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to impose fines based on a company's global turnover, arguing the retrospective and wide-reaching penalty system is unfair and disproportionate. The company states the amended law could expose it to a $38 billion penalty and is seeking to strike down parts of the CCI's orders and penalty guidelines. This case could have significant implications for both foreign and Indian companies with substantial overseas revenue operating in India.

title: Swiss National Bank Has $21.83 Million Stock Position in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS

BOSC expects to meet the high end of its revenue and net income guidance for the full year 2025.

title: Apple contests India’s antitrust penalty law with risk of $38 billion fine, filing shows
summary: Apple is challenging India's new antitrust penalty law that could lead to a fine of up to $38 billion based on its global turnover. The company argues that penalties should only be based on Indian revenue of the specific unit violating antitrust law, deeming the current law "manifestly arbitrary, unconstitutional, grossly disproportionate, unjust." Apple's challenge comes as the CCI investigates alleged "abusive conduct" related to its iOS app market.

title: Cayman Islands - Appleby Advises Blue Acquisition Corp. In Its Definitive Business Combination Agreement With Blockfusion USA, Inc. With A Transaction Value Of USD450M
summary: Appleby served as Cayman Islands legal counsel to Blue Acquisition Corp. in its definitive business combination agreement with Blockfusion USA, Inc., a transaction valued at USD450 million. Upon closing, the combined entity will be named Blockfusion Data Centers, Inc., and its securities are anticipated to be listed on The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC. This transaction further establishes Appleby's expertise in de-SPAC combinations and capital markets transactions.

title: 3 Things We (And Markets) Are Grateful For This Season
summary: J.P. Morgan's Global Investment Strategy Team highlights three market dynamics to be thankful for heading into 2026: a broad-based "everything rally", underlying economic durability in the U.S., and a powerful innovation cycle driven by artificial intelligence. The article details how these factors are creating significant investment opportunities across various asset classes and sectors. Despite lingering risks, the current environment offers flexibility for diversified portfolios.
authors: Global Investment Strategy Team, J.P. Morgan Wealth Management

title: Nasdaq ISE Seeks to Quadruple Trading Limits on BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF Options
summary: Nasdaq's International Securities Exchange (ISE) has filed a proposal with the U.S. SEC to quadruple the position limits on options for BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) from 250,000 to 1,000,000 contracts. This move, aiming to increase market depth and liquidity, would place IBIT options on par with major equities and ETFs like Apple and NVIDIA. Analysts suggest this change reflects growing institutional demand for Bitcoin derivatives and a shift towards allocation-driven behavior for the cryptocurrency, expecting it to facilitate larger allocations and potentially compress volatility.

title: Buffett's Big Bet Banks Billions: Here's How Much Berkshire Hathaway Is Up On Alphabet
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen a significant return on its investment in Alphabet stock, with gains exceeding $1.35 billion since the end of the second quarter. The investment in Alphabet, now Berkshire's 10th largest holding, marks a growing trend for the conglomerate to invest in technology stocks. While Berkshire Hathaway currently trails the S&P 500 year-to-date, its tech bets, including Alphabet and Apple, are closing the gap.

title: Google Stock Gains Momentum as Nvidia Faces Losses | NVDA

Meanwhile, Nvidia's shares are under pressure due to concerns about its AI chip market dominance after Meta reportedly considered Google's AI chips, despite Nvidia's record Q3 earnings. Analysts view Alphabet as a more balanced investment due to its diverse business segments and growth prospects.

title: General Motors Just Lost Its Chief AI Officer After Only 8 Months
summary: General Motors' first-ever Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer, Barak Turovsky, has left the company after only eight months, sparking concern due to a wave of high-profile departures. Turovsky's departure follows that of Dave Richardson and precedes Baris Cetinok's exit, leading a PR professional to warn investors about the implications of losing talent with expertise in "physical AI." The company states it is strategically integrating AI capabilities into its business despite these changes.

summary: This article details Apple Inc.'s research and development (R&D) expenditure from 2007 to 2025, highlighting its significant investment in R&D to drive product innovation. title: GM loses 3rd high-profile software exec in a month after restructure

This exodus includes former Apple exec Dave Richardson and GM's first chief AI officer Barak Turovsky. The departures come as GM made significant investments in California-based tech experts to revolutionize its software approach, a sector where the Detroit Three have faced setbacks, including software glitches affecting vehicle sales.

title: Apple settles with EPA regarding hazardous waste management
summary: Apple Inc. has settled with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) over violations of federal hazardous waste law at its Santa Clara, California facility, agreeing to pay a penalty of $261,283. The EPA's actions have led Apple to address hazardous waste management and air emissions issues, bringing the company into compliance with the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA). Violations identified during inspections in 2023 and 2024 included improper characterization of waste, failure to maintain permits, and inadequate control of air emissions.

title: Counterpoint forecasts Apple iPhone shipments to surpass Samsung for first time in 14 years
summary: Counterpoint Research predicts Apple's iPhone shipments will surpass Samsung's smartphone shipments in 2025, ending Samsung's 14-year lead and maintaining the top spot through 2029. This growth is driven by strong reception for the iPhone 17, a post-COVID upgrade cycle, and a large base of used iPhone users. The release of the iPhone 17e in early 2026 is expected to boost Apple's market share in emerging markets.

title: Nvidia's stock is sinking as doubts about its AI dominance grow
summary: Nvidia's stock is declining amid growing concerns about its AI chip market dominance, with rivals like Google gaining ground. The chipmaker's shares have fallen significantly, leading to a reassessment of its valuation despite strong revenue growth projections and overwhelming buy ratings from analysts. While competition is increasing, Nvidia maintains it is a generation ahead and continues to forecast strong revenues from its AI chips.

summary: This article provides a detailed overview of Meta Platforms Inc. stock, including its live price, key financial metrics, analyst ratings, and historical performance. The company is also bringing in new talent to fill key roles in robotics and AI.

summary: The United States Home Healthcare Market is projected to grow significantly from US$ 115.13 billion in 2024 to US$ 210.25 billion by 2033, driven by an aging population, rising chronic diseases, and a preference for in-home care. title: HP announces up to 6,000 job cuts as Apple trims sales roles in latest tech layoffs
summary: HP Inc. announced plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 jobs worldwide by 2028 as part of an AI-driven restructuring to streamline operations, product development, and customer satisfaction. Simultaneously, Apple Inc. quietly eliminated dozens of sales roles to streamline product offerings for business, education, and government clients, with affected employees offered opportunities to apply for new internal positions. These layoffs highlight ongoing cost-cutting and strategic shifts within the tech sector, with other companies like Amazon and Synopsys also reporting significant job reductions driven by AI investments and efforts to become leaner.

title: Intel CEO defends hiring former TSMC exec: ‘He continues to have our full support’
summary: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan defended the company's hiring of former TSMC executive Wei-Jen Lo, despite a lawsuit from TSMC alleging a nondisclosure agreement violation. Tan asserted that Intel acted ethically and that Lo, who will work in Intel's manufacturing and packaging business, has the company's full support. Intel views the hiring as part of its strategy to revitalize engineering and reclaim market share from TSMC, which also manufactures some of Intel's advanced chips.

title: Three GM Tech Leaders Exit as Software Restructuring Continues
summary: General Motors is experiencing a significant exodus of high-profile tech executives, with three leaders, including software VP Baris Cetinok, departing within a month. This coincides with a major software reorganization led by new Chief Product Officer Sterling Anderson, highlighting the friction between traditional automotive culture and Silicon Valley talent. The departures raise questions about GM's ability to retain key tech talent as it aims to transform into a software-driven company.

title: T-Mobile Unwraps the Ultimate Apple Bundle — All on Us for Black Friday
summary: T-Mobile is launching a Black Friday Apple bundle offer, providing nearly $2000 in savings, including an iPhone 17 Pro, iPad (A16), and Apple Watch SE 3 "on Us." Additionally, new T-Mobile 5G Home Internet customers can get a month free and a $300 prepaid Mastercard, while also offering deals for families switching to T-Mobile. The company is also enhancing customer perks through its T-Life app and Magenta Status benefits, such as a free year of DashPass by DoorDash for a limited time.

title: Singapore orders Apple, Google to prevent government spoofing on messaging platforms
summary: Singapore's police have ordered Apple and Google to implement measures on their messaging platforms, iMessage and Google Messages, to prevent the spoofing of government agencies. This directive, issued under the Online Criminal Harms Act, aims to combat scams where messages falsely claim to be from government bodies like "gov.sg". Both tech giants have committed to complying with the order, which will require them to block or filter messages that spoof official government names.

title: Microsoft Eases Compliance Remediation with Intune and Defender on iOS
summary: Microsoft has introduced a new "Resolve" button for Intune and Defender on iOS, streamlining compliance remediation with a one-tap solution. This update utilizes Just-in-Time checks to quickly identify and fix non-compliance issues, reducing IT workload and improving user experience. The JIT registration and remediation process embeds compliance checks directly into app workflows, making the resolution process faster and simpler.

title: A third high-profile tech leader is leaving GM as part of a software-product restructuring
summary: Baris Cetinok, GM's senior vice president of software and services product management, is departing the company as part of a major restructuring of its software and product units. This marks the third high-profile technology executive to leave GM in a month. The reorganization aims to unify vehicle software engineering and global product units under new Chief Product Officer Sterling Anderson to accelerate in-vehicle experiences.

title: NC agrees to push back job-creation deadlines for Apple as RTP buildout remains on hold
summary: North Carolina has agreed to grant Apple Inc. more time to meet job-creation targets tied to economic incentives due to the company's decision to delay building its new Research Triangle Park campus. A state Commerce Department committee voted to push back the timeline for Apple's 2021 incentives deal by four years, allowing the tech giant to adjust to its updated real estate plans. Apple had initially planned to create 3,000 jobs by 2034 with a 1 million-square-foot R&D campus but announced a delay in construction last year, while still committed to growing in the region by leasing space elsewhere.

title: Alphabet on pace to hit $4 trillion market value as AI gains momentum
summary: Alphabet is on track to achieve a historic $4 trillion market valuation, driven by a year-long rally fueled by the Google parent's focus on artificial intelligence tools. Shares of the company were up 4.1% in premarket trading, positioning it to breach this key milestone. This achievement places Alphabet among an elite group of Big Tech companies competing to dominate the rapidly growing AI technology sector.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor Drags Ex-VP To Court Over Intel Move
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd (TSM) has sued its former Senior Vice President Wei-Jen Lo for joining rival Intel Corp (INTC), citing a non-compete agreement and concern over trade secret leakage. Lo, who spent 21 years at TSMC and played a key role in advanced chip production, recently moved to Intel, prompting the Taiwanese chipmaker to initiate legal action and the economy ministry to monitor the situation. Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has denied claims that Lo brought TSMC trade secrets to Intel, emphasizing respect for intellectual property, even as Taiwanese authorities investigate.

title: Skyworks Solutions extends revolving credit agreement maturity to 2030
summary: Skyworks Solutions, Inc. announced a second amendment to its revolving credit agreement, extending the maturity date to November 18, 2030. This amendment, executed on November 18, 2025, involves Skyworks Solutions and its borrowing subsidiaries with JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. The company recently surpassed Q4 2025 revenue expectations but saw a stock decline due to a mixed outlook for its mobile segment.

title: Apple layoffs: iPhone maker cut dozens of sales jobs to streamline workforce, eliminate overlapping roles
summary: Apple Inc. has reportedly laid off dozens of sales employees in the U.S. as part of a reorganization to streamline product offerings to businesses, governments, and schools. This move comes despite the company experiencing significant revenue growth and is aimed at eliminating overlapping roles and potentially shifting more sales to third-party resellers. Affected employees have until January 20 to secure another internal position or face termination with a severance package.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Dan Ives Bet On The Same 16 Stocks – Some Might Surprise You
summary: This article highlights the surprising overlap in stock investments between Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene and Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, both prominent figures in their respective fields. A total of 16 stocks, predominantly in the tech and AI sectors, are found in both Greene's personal portfolio and Ives' Wedbush AI Revolution ETF. The article details these shared holdings and briefly discusses their differing investment approaches and motivations.

title: Alphabet Stock Is a Berkshire Win. The Gain So Far May Be 40%.
summary: Berkshire Hathaway's investment in Alphabet has proven highly profitable, with an estimated gain of up to 40% on shares worth over $500 million. This success follows a period of reduced stakes in Apple and HP, suggesting a strategic reallocation towards Alphabet's strong performance. The move reflects Berkshire's ability to capitalize on market opportunities despite a relatively conservative investment style.

title: Best Buy (BBY) Stock Today, Nov. 25, 2025: Price, 5% Yield and What to Watch Before Earnings
summary: Best Buy (BBY) stock declined 1.1% on November 25, 2025, ahead of its critical Q3 FY26 earnings report, despite a strong broader market. Investors are keenly watching the earnings to assess the impact of tariffs and holiday demand, given BBY's 5% dividend yield and current valuation. Key themes for the earnings include comparable sales, margin trends due to product mix and tariffs, and the potential impact of its retail media business.

title: Apple cuts jobs in latest round of tech layoffs
summary: Apple announced a new round of job cuts across its sales teams, specifically targeting account managers for businesses, schools, and government agencies, as well as staff operating briefing centers. The company stated that these layoffs affect a small number of roles and are designed to strengthen customer engagement, with affected employees eligible to apply for new positions. These layoffs come amidst a trend of other major tech companies like Verizon, Synopsys, and IBM also announcing job reductions.

title: Feeling Brand VOO: A New Inflows Record for ETF
summary: The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO) set a new inflows record in 2025, surpassing $120.5 billion despite market volatility and geopolitical tensions. Its success is attributed to its exposure to the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, particularly Nvidia, and its cost-effective, flexible structure compared to competitors like SPY. This achievement highlights VOO's popularity for US equity exposure and the broader growth of the ETF industry.

title: Tempus AI CEO Lefkofsky sells shares worth $12.6m
summary: Tempus AI CEO Eric P. Lefkofsky sold Class A Common Stock worth $12.57 million in multiple transactions on November 18 and November 20, 2025. Following these sales, Lefkofsky directly and indirectly holds millions of shares through various entities. The company recently reported strong Q3 2025 earnings and announced a new research study.

title: Apple Cuts Jobs Across Its Sales Organization in Rare Layoff
summary: Apple Inc. has implemented rare layoffs across its sales organization, affecting dozens of roles focused on businesses, schools, and government clients. The company aims to streamline its sales approach, though some affected employees suggest a shift towards third-party resellers. Despite these cuts, Apple projects record revenue for the December quarter and is developing a new low-end laptop to attract more business and education customers.

title: iPhone 17 Boosts Apple's China Sales: What's Ahead for the Stock?
summary: Apple's latest iPhone 17 series has significantly boosted its sales in China, with October sales jumping 37% year over year, despite facing strong competition and other headwinds. The company expects double-digit growth in iPhone sales for the December quarter in Greater China, driven by the new iPhone portfolio and Apple Intelligence features. However, Apple faces tough competition in the AI space from companies like Alphabet and Microsoft, and its stock is currently trading at a premium with a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).

title: French Group Sues Apple Over App Store Fees Inflating Streaming Prices
summary: A French consumer group, UFC-Que Choisir, has sued Apple over its 30% App Store fees, alleging they inflate music streaming subscription prices for services like Spotify by up to €3 per month. The lawsuit seeks compensation for affected French consumers and builds on recent EU regulations and a UK ruling that found Apple's commissions excessive. This legal challenge could force Apple to reform its fee model and impact its global services revenue.

title: 3,853 Shares in Cirrus Logic, Inc. $CRUS Purchased by AXQ Capital LP

Cirrus Logic recently beat Q3 earnings expectations and received several analyst price target upgrades, with the stock holding a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating.

title: I tried Apple’s iPhone Pocket. It’s as awkward as it is beautiful
summary: The author reviews Apple's new iPhone Pocket, a collaboration with Issey Miyake Design Studio, finding it aesthetically pleasing but functionally awkward. Despite its high price and practical shortcomings, the accessory is appreciated for its design philosophy, which challenges conventional utility and embraces user creativity, aligning with Miyake's design principles. The article discusses its mixed reception and potential success, particularly comparing its embrace in Asian markets to its less certain future in the US.

title: Masimo Wins $634M Patent Fight with Apple
summary: Masimo Corp. won a $634 million patent infringement lawsuit against Apple Inc. with a jury finding Apple infringed on Masimo's pulse oximetry technology patent. This verdict is part of ongoing litigation between the two companies, which includes other patent disputes and trade secret claims. Masimo's founder, Joe Kiani, also updated his stake in the company and is seeking damages from its board members.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) Stock Soars Above $315 as AI Wave Pushes Valuation Toward $4 Trillion – 24 November 2025
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (GOOG) surged above $315, pushing its market valuation towards $4 trillion, driven by strong Q3 2025 earnings, renewed confidence in its AI leadership with Gemini 3, and significant growth in Google Cloud. The stock's rally of 70-75% over the past year reflects growing investor enthusiasm, although analysts note rich valuations and ongoing antitrust risks. The company's vertically integrated AI strategy, including custom chips and a new NATO cloud deal, further bolsters its position.

title: Apple reduces headcount across sales teams to streamline process: report (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Apple has reportedly reduced staff positions across its sales teams in an effort to streamline processes for offering products to educational institutions, businesses, and government agencies. Dozens of sales workers were notified of the changes over the past two weeks. This move aims to enhance efficiency in the company's product distribution strategies for these sectors.

title: DOJ Confirms Former eBay Security Chief’s CIA Past As Cyberstalking Civil Suit Set Heads For 2026 Trial
summary: The Department of Justice has officially confirmed former eBay Security Chief Jim Baugh's CIA past, revealing this information in newly released documents related to the eBay cyberstalking scandal civil suit. This confirmation arises as the civil trial, seeking compensation for victims Ina and David Steiner, is now scheduled for March 2026. The article explores how Baugh's intelligence background and the revolving door between Big Tech and national security agencies illuminate the systemic corporate governance failures at eBay and broader implications for free speech and press freedom.

Despite challenges like competition and regulation, Apple plans to continue investing in its Services, indicating a future where digital experiences and hardware are deeply integrated.

title: Apple focusing on ‘quality, underlying performance,’ and AI for iOS 27, macOS 27 next year
summary: Apple is preparing "refinement-focused" updates for iOS 27 and macOS 27, prioritizing quality, underlying performance, and enhanced AI features. The updates aim to cut bloat, eliminate bugs, and significantly boost performance, laying groundwork for future hardware like foldable iPhones. Key AI developments include upgrades to Siri, a health-focused AI agent, and an expansion of Apple's AI-powered web search, with collaboration from Google's Gemini technology.

title: Inside look at MP Materials amid the rare earth race
summary: The Pentagon has partnered with MP Materials through a $400 million investment and purchase commitments to secure a domestic supply chain for rare earth minerals, crucial for defense and commercial technologies. This initiative aims to reduce U.S. reliance on China, which currently dominates the rare earth market and has used its position to restrict supplies. MP Materials is expanding its production capabilities in Texas and California to meet growing demand and counter geopolitical vulnerabilities.

title: Nokia targets €1B profit boost via mobile rejig and 5,000 more job cuts
summary: Nokia is undertaking a major restructuring to improve profitability, collapsing four business groups into two and planning to cut 5,000 more jobs. CEO Justin Hotard aims to boost annual operating profits by €1 billion to between €2.7 billion and €3.2 billion by 2028, primarily by reducing costs and shifting the mobile networks business toward a software-centric model with Nvidia's help. This strategy involves a significant bet on AI-RAN products, expected to be commercially available from 2027, to revive the company's financial performance after past disappointments in its mobile networks division.

title: Two Paths to the Total US Market: Vanguard’s Total Stock Market ETF vs. iShares’ Core S&P Total US Stock Market ETF
summary: This article compares two popular ETFs designed to track the total U.S. stock market: Vanguard’s Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) and iShares’ Core S&P Total US Stock Market ETF (ITOT). While both offer similar market exposure, expense ratios, and yields, the article highlights VTI's significantly larger assets under management and deeper trading liquidity as key differentiating factors, especially for long-term investors. It concludes that VTI’s scale and efficiency make it a slightly more resilient foundation, although ITOT remains an excellent choice, particularly for those within the iShares Core lineup.

title: Vanguard Information Technology ETF and iShares US Technology ETF: Two Visions of Tech Investing
summary: This article compares two popular tech ETFs, Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) and iShares US Technology ETF (IYW), highlighting their differing approaches to tech investing. VGT offers broader diversification, lower costs, and a higher yield, appealing to long-term investors seeking stability. IYW, on the other hand, is more concentrated on mega-cap tech stocks, exhibiting higher one-year returns but also deeper drawdowns, suited for investors comfortable with more volatility.

title: Watch HDGE's Lamensdorfs Speaks on Short Stock Fund
summary: Brad Lamensdorf, Co-Portfolio Manager of the AdvisorShares Ranger Equity Bear ETF (HDGE), discusses his approach to shorting stocks with Bloomberg's 'ETF IQ'. He highlights the fund's focus on identifying vulnerable companies through specific screens, emphasizing areas like car credit (ABS) due to high default rates, and avoiding "Mag 7" stocks. Lamensdorf explains the fund's active management, short average holding period, and high turnover, aiming for 30-50% drops in targeted stocks rather than small corrections.

title: Exclusive / CNN drops out of Apple News feed, for now
summary: CNN has reportedly removed its content from Apple News as its contract lapsed, though discussions for a new deal are ongoing. This move coincides with CNN's push for digital monetization and a more aggressive stance on sharing content with tech platforms, highlighting a broader tension between publishers and platforms over distribution and revenue. Publishers like People Inc. and Conde Nast have embraced Apple News, while others fear over-reliance on tech platforms for traffic and revenue.

title: Mark Gurman Says Tim Cook Likely To Remain As Apple CEO Through At Least Mid-2026
summary: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman refutes earlier reports of Tim Cook's imminent departure as Apple CEO, stating that Cook is likely to remain in his position until at least mid-2026. Gurman emphasizes that internal signs do not suggest Cook is planning to step down soon and identifies John Ternus as a potential successor when the transition eventually occurs. This news aims to quell speculation about Apple's leadership, suggesting stability in the company's strategic direction for the coming years.

title: Microsoft Skips 2025 DEI Report Amid Big Tech Accountability Concerns
summary: Microsoft has decided not to release its 2025 annual diversity and inclusion (DEI) report, opting to integrate DEI efforts into core operations instead of standalone publications. This move mirrors actions by other Big Tech companies like Google and Meta, raising concerns about accountability and transparency in the industry amidst political and economic pressures. The decision marks a significant shift from Microsoft's decade-long practice of public DEI reporting, prompting questions about the future of corporate social responsibility.

title: Hollywood Braces For Epic Bidding War As Paramount, Comcast And Netflix Eye Warner Bros. Discovery— Who Will Call Cut? - Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN)
summary: Hollywood is anticipating a significant bidding war for Warner Bros. Discovery, with Paramount Skydance, Comcast, and Netflix submitting offers. David Ellison of Paramount initiated the bidding, pushing the valuation of Warner Bros. Discovery substantially higher. Comcast and Netflix are also vying for the acquisition, each with unique advantages and challenges, as Warner Bros. Discovery's board expects to make a final decision by Christmas.

title: If Nvidia Stumbles, Pay Attention to Apple
summary: This article argues that while Nvidia has been central to the AI data center narrative, Apple is uniquely positioned to dominate the future of personal AI. Apple's on-device AI capabilities, integrated hardware and software stack, and vast installed base of devices could make it the leader in distributed personal AI, with even Sam Altman recognizing the importance of AI living directly with the user.

title: T-Mobile users will no longer get free Apple TV subscriptions
summary: T-Mobile has announced that its "Apple TV On Us" promotion, which provided free Apple TV subscriptions to high-tier plan users, will end on January 1, 2026. Instead, T-Mobile will offer a $9.99 discount on Apple TV, meaning users on select plans will pay $3 for the service. This change comes alongside other adjustments for T-Mobile customers, though Apple TV continues to add new content, including sports.

title: Verdict: Apple Hit With $634 Million in Damages in Masimo Lawsuit; Another Shoe May Drop
summary: A California jury has ordered Apple Inc. to pay Masimo Corporation $634 million in damages for infringing on Masimo's patents related to Apple Watch features. This verdict is a significant win for Masimo in its ongoing legal battles with Apple, which started several years ago. Despite the judgment, both companies continue to have multiple lawsuits pending across various courts and commissions, indicating the dispute is far from over, with Masimo also seeing a new ITC investigation open for Apple's latest Watches.

title: Is Apple’s Tim Cook about to retire?
summary: Reports suggest Apple CEO Tim Cook, who turned 65 recently, is contemplating retirement next year, prompting the company to accelerate its succession planning. Cook has significantly increased Apple's market valuation but faces challenges in new product categories and AI. Commentators speculate on the timing of his departure and potential successors, with John Ternus often mentioned.

title: PayPal’s Liverpool Pitch Pays Off and other Digital Transactions News briefs from 11/19/25
summary: PayPal has become an official digital payments partner for Liverpool FC, enhancing its visibility within the club's e-commerce and membership services. Additionally, SEON updated its fraud-prevention tools for global businesses, Zillow launched a service for renters to report on-time payments to credit bureaus, and Wetzel’s Pretzels began a gift card promotion.

title: World's biggest company Nvidia stuns Wall Street as it gives biggest clue yet to state of US economy

This strong performance by the chipmaker, which is a key driver of the AI boom, is seen as a significant positive indicator for the broader US economy and investor confidence. While Nvidia's success boosts market sentiment, concerns remain about the market's heavy reliance on a few AI-focused tech giants and potential volatility.
authors: DANIEL JONES, US CONSUMER AND REAL ESTATE EDITOR and BEN SHIMKUS, US CONSUMER REPORTER

title: Xiaomi’s EV division turns profitable in 19 months, beating Tesla’s timeline

The company reported a 700-million-yuan ($98-million) profit for its EV and AI division for the quarter ended Sept. 30, 2025, but faces future margin threats from scaled-back Chinese EV tax breaks and intensifying competition. Despite these challenges, Xiaomi aims to become a top-five carmaker globally and is expanding production and planning overseas sales by 2027.

title: Williams-Sonoma Earnings: What To Look For From WSM

The home furnishing retail sector has generally underperformed, though Williams-Sonoma is heading into earnings with an average analyst price target significantly above its current share price.

The moves by these major investors highlight growing anxiety about soaring tech stock valuations.

title: Alphabet stock jumps 6% to hit record high: what’s going on?

This investment signals a strategic shift for Berkshire, as it capitalizes on Alphabet's AI leadership despite broader market concerns about AI valuations. Additionally, Google announced a new subsea cable system, Dhivaru, to enhance global connectivity and support its AI-driven services, further solidifying its infrastructure for future growth.

title: 5 potential successors for Tim Cook at Apple

Other notable contenders include Craig Federighi, Eddy Cue, Katherine Adams, and Sabih Khan, each with different strengths and focuses within Apple.

title: Apple’s CEO Tim Cook May Retire Soon. How’s Your Succession Planning Going?
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook, 65 and Apple’s longest-serving CEO, is rumored to be retiring next year, prompting Apple's deep succession planning. John Ternus, senior vice-president of hardware engineering, is seen as the most likely replacement. This situation highlights the increasing pressures and complexities of the CEO role today, and serves as a prompt for other companies to review their own long-term leadership plans.

title: US Supreme Court won't hear patent appeal against Apple, Google, LG
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear an appeal from Gesture Technology Partners, thereby upholding a lower court's decision against Apple, Google, and LG Electronics. Gesture Technology Partners had accused the tech companies of infringing a patent related to camera technology in cell phones. This decision leaves in place the invalidation of the patent by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's Patent Trial and Appeal Board.

title: TORM Announces Capital Increase Following LR2 Vessel Delivery and RSU Exercise
summary: TORM plc announced on November 12, 2025, a capital increase of 2,395,426 Class A common shares. This increase resulted from the delivery of an LR2 vessel and the exercise of Restricted Stock Units within TORM's incentive program, aiming to strengthen the company's capital structure and market position. The newly issued shares are subject to a 40-day lock-up period and will be listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen, with the most recent analyst rating on TRMD stock being a Sell with a DKK89.00 price target.

title: Alphabet shares jump after Berkshire makes rare tech bet with $4.9 billion stake
summary: Alphabet shares surged to a record high after Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a new $4.9 billion stake in the tech giant, signaling an endorsement of its AI efforts. This rare move by tech-averse Berkshire comes amid broader concerns about AI spending and valuations, positioning Alphabet as an outlier among the "Magnificent Seven" with strong year-to-date performance. The investment also addresses Warren Buffett's past regret over missing out on Google's early growth and is seen as validation of Alphabet's strong fundamentals and AI leadership.

title: Buffett Trims Apple, Bets Big on Alphabet Ahead of Retirement
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway released its Q3 13F filing, revealing a significant reduction in its Apple holdings and a new $4.3 billion position in Alphabet. This strategic shift comes as Buffett nears retirement at the end of 2025, with Berkshire reshaping its portfolio by scaling back on Apple and VeriSign while making a substantial bet on Alphabet. The moves highlight a continued confidence in select technology and consumer-facing stocks as the conglomerate prepares for a post-Buffett era.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook could exit as early as next year — here’s who could replace him: report
summary: Apple is reportedly accelerating its CEO succession planning, with Tim Cook potentially stepping down as early as next year after a 14-year tenure. Hardware engineering chief John Ternus has emerged as a leading contender, though analyst Dan Ives believes Cook may stay until at least 2027 to see through Apple's AI strategy. Cook has overseen a massive increase in Apple's market capitalization and a successful pivot to services, and has stated his preference for an internal successor.

title: Reynolds, Volitionrx CEO, buys $7,000 in VNRX stock

The move comes as Berkshire rebalances its portfolio, including reducing its Apple stake, and seeks to deploy its record cash pile.

title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Fortinet Exploited, China's AI Hacks, PhaaS Empire Falls & More
summary: This weekly recap highlights several significant cybersecurity incidents including the exploitation of a silently patched Fortinet flaw, Google's lawsuit against Chinese PhaaS hackers, and the disruption of major malware operations. title: Peter Thiel dumps entire Nvidia stake, slashes Tesla holdings amid bubble fears
summary: Billionaire Peter Thiel has sold his entire stake in Nvidia and significantly reduced his holdings in Tesla, citing concerns about an "AI-fueled bubble" in tech valuations. Thiel, a co-founder of Paypal and Palantir, had previously voiced worries about stretched valuations in the tech sector.

title: AI Powerhouses Or Small-Cap Rebound? ETFs To Watch As Morgan Stanley Eyes S&P 500 At 7,800
summary: Morgan Stanley anticipates a "two-speed rally" in the S&P 500, projecting it to reach 7,800 by late 2026, driven by AI-led earnings and potential small-cap outperformance as interest rates decline. This outlook suggests strategic opportunities for investors in tech-heavy ETFs, small-cap funds, and equal-weight ETFs to capitalize on different market segments. The forecast considers both the continued dominance of mega-cap tech and a potential rebound in smaller companies.

title: US jury says Apple must pay Masimo $634 million in smartwatch patent case
summary: A federal jury in California has ordered Apple to pay Masimo $634 million for infringing a patent related to blood-oxygen reading technology in its Apple Watches. Apple plans to appeal the verdict, while Masimo considers it a significant win in its ongoing legal battles with the tech giant. This ruling is part of a larger multi-front patent dispute between the two companies.

title: HP Inc. downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley

This downgrade is part of a broader revision for global hardware names, expecting lower gross margins, negative earnings revisions, and multiple compression.

title: Cirrus Logic’s SWOT analysis: semiconductor stock faces valuation questions amid Apple dependency

title: US equity market investor sentiment improves with reduced macro concerns

The technology sector, especially AI-led companies, emerged as the most favored sector, though a divergence between IT stock performance and technology sector output was noted.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL Shares Sold by Ellevest Inc.

title: Morgan Stanley downgrades multiple hardware companies due to surging memory prices

Apple and Pure Storage are considered more insulated due to their differentiated business models and/or higher software mix.

title: Berkshire Hathaway | Overview, History, Stock, & Facts

title: Rep. Cleo Fields Buys Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Stock
summary: Rep. Cleo Fields (D-Louisiana) recently purchased between $100,001 and $250,000 worth of Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) stock on October 23rd, as disclosed in a November 12th filing. This transaction is part of several significant tech stock trades by Fields in late October, including purchases of Apple, NVIDIA, and Netflix shares, indicating a concentrated investment in the technology sector. Alphabet recently reported strong Q3 earnings, announced a quarterly dividend, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus analyst rating.

title: Patented: Fluor Corp.'s Offshore System for Growing and Harvesting Seaweed, Plus More North Texas Inventive Activity
summary: Fluor Technologies Corp. has patented an offshore system for growing and harvesting seaweed using idle platforms, converting non-producing rigs into ocean farms. This article details this invention and other notable patents granted this week to Dallas-Fort Worth area entities, spanning various fields from AI and cybersecurity to healthcare and aerospace. The weekly "Dallas Invents" report highlights local patent activity, offering insight into economic growth and emerging markets in the region.

title: Apple said to step up CEO succession planning as Tim Cook may leave next year
summary: Apple is reportedly increasing its CEO succession planning efforts as current CEO Tim Cook may step down as early as next year. The Financial Times cited sources familiar with internal discussions at the company regarding these plans. John Ternus, Apple's senior vice president, is mentioned in this context.

title: Peter Thiel Fully Exits Nvidia, Cuts Tesla, Moves Into Fresh Tech Plays With These Stocks - Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META), Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Billionaire Peter Thiel has completely sold off his Nvidia stake and significantly reduced his Tesla holdings, citing concerns about a potential AI bubble. His fund, Thiel Macro, subsequently invested billions into Apple and Microsoft, increasing holdings in these "Mag 7" stocks. This strategic shift follows Thiel's previous endorsement of Nvidia and comes amid broader discussions in the tech industry regarding AI valuation.

title: Apple Ordered To Pay Over $600 Million In Smartwatch Patent Case Against Masimo - Masimo (NASDAQ:MASI)
summary: A federal jury in California has ordered Apple Inc. to pay Masimo Corporation $634 million for infringing a patent related to blood-oxygen reading technology used in smartwatches. Masimo hailed the verdict as a significant win in its efforts to protect its intellectual property, following a prolonged legal battle dating back to 2023. Apple had previously removed the blood-oxygen feature from some of its Apple Watch models to avoid a sales ban but later reintroduced it, leading to further legal challenges from Masimo.

title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Tilts Toward Big Tech Again — This Time With A Bold Bet On Alphabet’s AI Future
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has initiated a significant position in Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) during the third quarter, holding 17.85 million shares valued at approximately $4.34 billion. This move represents a rare tech bet for Berkshire, signaling a renewed interest in AI-exposed big tech despite skepticism in the market. The investment, possibly driven by portfolio managers Todd Combs or Ted Weschler, reflects a positive outlook on Alphabet's AI leadership and performance.

title: Alphabet shares eye strong gains after Berkshire discloses $4.3 bln stake
summary: Alphabet shares are expected to see strong gains after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a $4.3 billion stake in the Google parent company. This investment makes Alphabet Berkshire's tenth-largest U.S. stock holding, despite growing concerns over tech valuations and artificial intelligence hype. Alphabet's stock rose significantly in after-hours trading following the disclosure.

title: Elizabeth Warren Says Likes Of Amazon, Apple And Meta Not Contributing To Trump's Ballroom Out Of Goodness Of Heart: 'Sure Looks Like Bribery'
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has accused tech giants Amazon, Apple, and Meta of potentially engaging in bribery by contributing to President Donald Trump's "gold-encrusted" ballroom project. She suggests these companies are seeking special favors from the administration, leading to an investigation into potential corruption. Warren has previously criticized other companies like JBS SA and Paramount Global for similar contributions linked to their business interests with the Trump administration.

title: Berkshire Added $4 Billion Alphabet Stake and Further Pared Apple Stock
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway added a new position in Google's parent company, Alphabet, during the third quarter, while also further reducing its stake in Apple. This move indicates a shift in Berkshire's portfolio, despite being a net seller of stocks overall in the same period. Alphabet shares reacted positively, gaining 1.9% in after-hours trading after the disclosure.

title: The Vanguard Dividend Appreciation Index Fund ETF (VIG) Delivers Stronger Growth Than the iShares Core High Dividend ETF (HDV)
summary: This article compares the Vanguard Dividend Appreciation Index Fund ETF (VIG) and the iShares Core High Dividend ETF (HDV), highlighting their differences in expense ratios, dividend yields, sector allocations, and performance. While HDV offers a higher current yield, VIG has demonstrated stronger dividend growth and total returns over the last five years due to its focus on companies with a history of increasing dividends. The piece concludes that VIG is likely to deliver more passive income over time despite its lower initial yield.

title: Chilton Investment Co LLC Boosts Stake in Apple Inc
summary: Chilton Investment Co LLC, managed by Richard Chilton, has increased its stake in Apple Inc (AAPL) by 26,195 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AAPL as an "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance, revenue growth, and profitability, despite a high valuation and overbought technical indicators. The company's strategic focus on expanding services and overcoming supply chain challenges supports its long-term growth prospects.

title: National Pension Service Sells 18,154 Shares of lululemon athletica inc. $LULU

title: Ross Gerber Urges Apple Leadership Overhaul, Suggests Replacing Siri With Google's Gemini AI For Future Growth
summary: Investor Ross Gerber is advocating for significant changes at Apple Inc., including a leadership overhaul and replacing Siri with Google's Gemini AI. He believes new leadership is necessary to maintain competitiveness and suggests a partnership with Google could be transformative for Apple's future growth. Gerber's comments come amidst reports of Apple's board intensifying discussions about Tim Cook's successor.

title: Apple intensifies succession planning for CEO Tim Cook
summary: Apple's board and senior executives are intensifying succession planning for CEO Tim Cook, who may step down as early as next year. John Ternus, senior vice-president of hardware engineering, is considered the most likely successor, though no final decision has been made. The transition is not linked to current performance, as Apple anticipates strong holiday sales for the iPhone.
authors: Tim Bradshaw, Stephen Morris, Michael Acton, Daniel Thomas

title: Intel Stock Outlook November 2025: Rallying on AI Hopes Amid Turnaround Challenges
summary: Intel's stock has seen a significant rebound in 2025, surging nearly 90% YTD, driven by strong Q3 earnings, aggressive cost-cutting measures, and strategic cash infusions from companies like Nvidia and the U.S. government. Despite this rally, analysts remain cautious due to lingering competitive challenges from AMD and Nvidia in critical areas like AI accelerators and CPU market share. The company's long-term outlook hinges on successful execution of its ambitious technology roadmap to regain leadership and capitalize on the booming AI and data center markets.

title: US trade tribunal to consider new Apple Watch import ban
summary: The U.S. International Trade Commission (ITC) will investigate whether redesigned Apple Watches still infringe on Masimo's blood-oxygen measurement technology patents, despite Apple's efforts to circumvent a previous import ban. This new proceeding is part of an ongoing multi-front patent dispute between Apple and medical monitoring technology company Masimo, which also includes lawsuits in federal court and Apple's challenge to the prior ban. Separately, a jury found Apple owes Masimo $634 million for patent infringement.

title: Benzinga Bulls And Bears: Nvidia, CoreWeave, Oklo — And AI-Linked Stocks Keep Falling

The broader market saw investors rotate defensively as concerns about the AI boom's rapid pace increased.

title: Seros Ulloa family trust sells Entravision (EVC) shares worth $425k

title: Apple Pay US online volumes to surpass PayPal in 2025 and beyond: analysts
summary: UBS analysts project that Apple Pay's US online transaction volumes will exceed PayPal's Branded Checkout in 2025 and beyond. This growth is anticipated due to increasing desktop adoption and expansion into third-party browsers on non-iOS devices. Apple Pay's 2024 volumes were estimated at $205 billion, representing about 6% of the total US eCommerce market.

title: Aura Biosciences Reports Q3 2025 Financial Results
summary: Aura Biosciences reported its Q3 2025 financial results, focusing on clinical execution for its early choroidal melanoma and non-muscle invasive bladder cancer trials. The company anticipates completing enrollment for the Phase 3 CoMpass trial in 2026, with topline data expected in late 2027, and data from the Phase 1b/2 NMIBC trial in mid-2026. Despite a current "Neutral" rating from TipRanks' AI Analyst due to its early-stage profile, Aura Biosciences aims to transform oncology treatment with its innovative therapies.

title: Google stock split: What next for GOOGL shares?
summary: This article examines Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split in July 2022, detailing its impact on share structure, pricing, and accessibility for traders. title: Tesla tests Apple CarPlay to address softening sales
summary: Tesla is reportedly testing Apple CarPlay integration internally, an unexpected move given CEO Elon Musk's previous resistance to Apple's ecosystem. This initiative aims to address softening sales, as a significant portion of car buyers view the absence of CarPlay as a deal-breaker. CarPlay will function as a window within Tesla's existing interface, maintaining Tesla's control while offering a highly requested feature to customers.

title: Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) reported strong Q1 2026 financial results, exceeding revenue and EPS guidance, driven by robust demand for AI infrastructure and networking solutions. The company highlighted significant growth in AI-related orders, particularly from hyperscalers, and discussed multi-year refresh opportunities in campus networking and the evolving security landscape. Management also addressed the shift to cloud subscriptions for Splunk and ongoing investments in AI and edge computing.

title: 3 Vanguard ETFs to Buy With $100 and Hold Forever

title: Ascentage Pharma (SEHK:6855): Evaluating Valuation After ASH Meeting Spotlights Pipeline Progress
summary: Ascentage Pharma's valuation is under scrutiny after its drug candidates gained attention at the 67th ASH Annual Meeting, highlighting pipeline progress. Analyst narratives suggest the company is undervalued, with its collaboration with Takeda on Olverembatinib poised for significant market expansion, though high R&D costs and reliance on this drug pose risks.

title: Apple Aims to Capitalize on Mini App Trend With New Program
summary: Apple Inc. has launched a new "Mini Apps Partner Program" to generate revenue from mini apps and games within larger "super apps." The program will take a 15% cut of in-app purchases, which is half of the standard 30% charge for developers. This initiative is designed to capitalize on the growing trend of mini applications.

title: Is iShares MSCI USA Quality Factor ETF (QUAL) a Strong ETF Right Now?

title: VOO vs. QQQ: Is S&P 500 Stability or Tech-Focused Growth a Better Choice for Investors?
summary: This article compares two popular ETFs, VOO and QQQ, highlighting their differences in focus, expense ratios, dividend yields, and risk profiles. VOO offers broad market diversification through the S&P 500, while QQQ provides concentrated exposure to technology-focused growth stocks from the NASDAQ-100. The choice between them depends on an investor's goals for stability versus potentially higher, but more volatile, growth.

title: Cisco Earnings: Expanding AI Pipeline and Broad-Based Networking Strength
summary: Cisco reported strong October-quarter results, with sales up 8% year over year, driven by broad-based growth in networking and a rising AI pipeline. Morningstar raised its fair value estimate for Cisco shares to $67 due to these factors, particularly robust growth expectations in campus and AI products. The company projects significant AI revenue for fiscal 2026, indicating immense growth in this sector.

title: Business News: Fossil Is Restructuring As Debt And Tariffs Take Toll
summary: Fossil Group is undergoing financial restructuring in the U.K. and U.S. bankruptcy courts due to mounting financial losses, declining sales, and the impact of U.S. tariffs. The company, which once produced 26 million watches annually, saw sales drop from $1.7 billion in 2022 to $1.1 billion in 2024, with net losses increasing significantly. This move comes as the watch market shifts towards higher-quality timepieces and competitors like Apple and Samsung dominate the smartwatch sector.

title: These 2 AI ETFs Are Ready to Crush the S&P 500 Over the Next 10 Years
summary: This article discusses two AI-focused ETFs that could outperform the S&P 500 in the next decade: the Invesco QQQ ETF and the Ark Autonomous Technology and Robotics ETF. The Invesco QQQ offers broad exposure to large-cap AI stocks with low fees, while the Ark ETF provides a more actively managed and specialized approach to AI and robotics, including investments in smaller, less-known companies. The choice between them depends on an investor's goals and risk tolerance.

title: About Us - Great American Insurance Group - Specialty Property & Casualty Insurance
summary: Karbon-X Corp. (OTCQX: KARX) is rapidly expanding its global presence in the carbon markets by restoring mangroves in Senegal and extending its blue-carbon model to Guinea's Konkouré Delta. This expansion is enhancing biodiversity, fostering community resilience, and increasing the company's verified carbon credit assets, positioning Karbon-X for significant growth and investor appeal in the escalating voluntary carbon market.

Acorn Financial Advisory Services Inc. ADV reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 3.7% in Q2, selling 2,103 shares, making Apple its 15th largest position. title: Is the 10% yielding JEPQ ETF a worthwhile investment today?
summary: The JEPQ ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq 100, offers a 10% dividend yield by selling call options, making it attractive to income investors. While it has benefited from the AI boom and Federal Reserve rate cuts, its total return often lags behind less aggressive Nasdaq 100 ETFs like QQQ due to its options strategy, suggesting it may not be the best choice for maximizing overall returns. The article questions if its high dividend yield compensates for the lower total return compared to other growth-focused index funds.

title: iPhone Pocket For $230? Marques Brownlee Says It's A 'Litmus Test For People Who'll Buy/Defend Anything' From Apple
summary: Popular tech YouTuber Marques Brownlee, known as MKBHD, criticized Apple's new $230 "iPhone Pocket," calling it a "litmus test" for extreme brand loyalty. The accessory is a 3D-knitted, cross-body pouch designed to carry an iPhone, AirPods, and small essentials, developed by Issey Miyake Design Studio. The article also notes Apple's strong financial performance, surpassing analyst expectations for revenue and earnings for 11 consecutive quarters.

title: Apple launches $230 iPhone Pocket case. See internet's reaction
summary: Apple has launched a new iPhone Pocket case, co-designed with fashion house Issey Miyake, with prices ranging from $150 to $230. The product has sparked mixed reactions online due to its high price and simplistic design, with some comparing it to the much cheaper iPod Socks of 2004. While some find it overpriced and uninnovative, others appreciate its whimsical design and collaboration with a renowned fashion brand.

title: Apple removes two gay dating apps in China after government order
summary: Apple has removed two major gay dating apps, Blued and Finka, from its App Store in China following an order from the Cyberspace Administration of China. This action reflects increasing pressure on China's LGBTQ+ community and underlines Apple's demonstrated willingness to comply with Chinese internet regulations due to the importance of the Chinese market. It follows similar removals of other apps and raises concerns about the dwindling space for LGBTQ+ advocacy in the country.
authors: Associated Press; Chan Ho-Him; Kelvin Chan; Kanis Leung

title: IBM and Apple lift the Dow Jones Industrial Average higher, even as tech falters
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average saw an uplift on Tuesday, primarily driven by strong performances from International Business Machines Corp. and Apple Inc., despite a general decline in tech stocks. IBM contributed 36.45 points, and Apple added 25.77 points to the Dow's gains. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and McDonald's Corp. also made positive contributions to the index.

title: Samsung’s Bold Bid to Challenge Apple in Financial Services
summary: Samsung is reportedly in advanced talks with Barclays to launch a co-branded credit card in the U.S., featuring Visa integration and cashback for Samsung products, directly challenging Apple's financial services. This move is part of Samsung's broader strategy to expand its financial offerings, including savings and BNPL, to deepen ecosystem loyalty and boost sales. The card could debut with the Galaxy S26 series in early 2026, aiming to transform Samsung Wallet into a comprehensive financial hub.

title: Nvidia is seeing the largest losses among the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks

This downturn follows bearish sentiment from notable investors such as Michael Burry, who bought put options, and Softbank, which exited its $5.8 billion position in Nvidia. While six of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks were down, Apple Inc. was the only one trading higher.

title: Apple shares hit new all-time closing high

The company's market value stands at $4.067 trillion, making it the world's second-most valuable publicly-traded company. This article details Apple's stock performance and lists market valuations of other major tech companies.

title: T-Mobile Revenue Rises as Postpaid Phone Subscribers Continue to Grow
summary: T-Mobile US reported an 8.9% increase in revenue to $21.96 billion in its latest quarter, driven by continued growth in postpaid wireless phone subscribers. The company added 1 million net subscribers to its postpaid phone service, with Finance Chief Peter Osvaldik attributing this growth to the speed of T-Mobile's networks and changing customer perceptions. Despite logging higher revenue, the profit decreased to $2.71 billion ($2.41 per share) from $3.06 billion ($2.61 per share) in the prior year, though it still beat analyst expectations of $2.40 per share.

title: Apple’s restraint in AI spending emerges as an advantage amid tech sector scrutiny
summary: Apple's relatively low AI spending, at $14 billion compared to rivals like Microsoft and Meta, is increasingly seen as an advantage by investors as scrutiny over massive tech spending intensifies. While Apple has lagged this year's "Mag 7" performers, its strategy offers a more defensive investment, allowing it to benefit from AI through other companies' models without incurring heavy capital expenditures. This approach is re-evaluating Apple's position as a potential AI winner, especially as concerns rise about the returns on significant AI investments by other tech giants.

title: Earnings call transcript: Xtant Medical Q3 2025 sees earnings beat and stock surge

title: Apple is starting to look like an AI winner thanks to one advantage
summary: Apple is emerging as an AI winner by leveraging its unique position as a platform owner, allowing it to integrate AI from other companies without significant in-house spending. A recent deal with Google for Siri's AI upgrade, reportedly for a fraction of what Google pays Apple for Safari's default search, highlights this strategy. Wall Street is beginning to recognize the advantage of Apple's financially restrained AI approach compared to competitors' massive investments, which often involve heavy losses.

title: Qualcomm Wants to Beat Nvidia in AI Chips, but QCOM Stock Needs to Win Over Wall Street First
