Despite a strong product pipeline and recent earnings beat, Wall Street remains skeptical, valuing QCOM significantly lower than its competitors. The company aims to win over investors by highlighting its AI advancements, automotive growth, and consistent dividend payouts.

title: The In re Motorola CAFC Ruling Reaffirms Discretionary, Nonappealable Nature of PTAB IPR Institution Decisions
summary: The Federal Circuit's ruling in In re Motorola Solutions, Inc. upholds the USPTO director's discretionary authority over inter partes review (IPR) institution decisions, limiting judicial review. The court rejected Motorola's due process and Administrative Procedure Act claims related to the rescission of the Vidal Memorandum, emphasizing that interim guidance does not create protected property interests and is subject to change. This decision reinforces the nonappealable nature of PTAB institution decisions and signals significant hurdles for future challenges to the USPTO's evolving policies.
authors: Dion M. Bregman, Theodore A. Rand

title: Jeff Bezos Was Always Confident That The iPad Was No 'Kindle Killer' And He's Still Turning The Page On Apple: 'You Don't Understand My Audience'
summary: In 2010, amid concerns that Apple's new iPad would threaten the Kindle, Jeff Bezos confidently asserted that Apple didn't understand his audience, emphasizing the Kindle's purpose-built design for reading. Fifteen years later, Amazon's Kindle sales continue to grow, while Apple's iPad revenue remains flat, seemingly vindicating Bezos's perspective. The article highlights Amazon's strong financial performance in Q3 2025 and Apple's all-time high stock despite flat iPad revenue.

title: Chegg Inc earnings beat by $0.06, revenue topped estimates
summary: Chegg Inc (NYSE: CHGG) reported third-quarter EPS of $0.00, exceeding analyst estimates by $0.06, and revenue of $77.7M, beating the consensus estimate of $76.3M. Despite the strong Q3 performance, the company provided lower-than-anticipated Q4 2025 revenue guidance of $70.00M-$72.00M against an analyst consensus of $83.73M. The stock has seen a significant decline, down -29.37% in the last three months and -49.72% in the last 12 months, with its financial health rated as "fair performance" by InvestingPro.

title: Tech selloff amplifies the case for diversification
summary: This article argues that the recent tech selloff, while not indicative of a bubble, reinforces the importance of diversification in investment portfolios. The authors highlight that mega-cap tech companies are experiencing strong earnings growth and funding capital expenditure from cash reserves, unlike the dot-com era. They recommend looking beyond mega-cap tech to US cyclical, smaller-cap, value stocks, and non-US markets for opportunities.

title: Jensen Huang says TSMC is the 'pride of the world'
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang publicly thanked TSMC at a company sports day in Taiwan, stating that "Without TSMC, there is no Nvidia today." He recognized TSMC as the "pride of Taiwan" and the "pride of the world," highlighting its critical role in Nvidia's success and the global tech industry. TSMC, being the world's largest semiconductor producer, is instrumental in manufacturing chips for companies like Nvidia, Apple, and AMD, with Huang emphasizing the importance of strong bonds with the Taiwanese manufacturer.

title: JD.com downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded JD.com (JD) to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $28 price target, believing it is the worst-positioned Chinese e-commerce stock for the next 12 months. The firm predicts the company's revenue growth will significantly slow and margins will erode due to easing trade-in effects and new business investments, weakening its ability to improve shareholder returns. This assessment was published after analyst Eddy Wang's note to investors.

title: Welch Group LLC Has $76.98 Million Stake in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Welch Group LLC increased its stake in Apple Inc. by 4.0% in the second quarter, bringing its total holdings to 375,181 shares valued at $76.98 million. This makes Apple the 4th largest holding for Welch Group LLC. Other institutional investors also made significant moves in Apple stock, while the company announced a quarterly dividend and recent insider stock sales.

title: ONE Advisory Partners LLC Grows Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: ONE Advisory Partners LLC significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. by 132.9% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 3,174 shares valued at $680,000. Meanwhile, Apple executives Katherine L. Adams and CEO Tim Cook sold substantial amounts of company stock in October. The company reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst expectations, and declared a quarterly dividend.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Position Increased by Hazlett Burt & Watson Inc.
summary: Hazlett Burt & Watson Inc. significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 7.3% in Q2, making Apple its largest holding. Despite this, insiders have been net sellers of the stock, while other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions. Apple recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend.

title: Apple Upgraded, DraftKings Downgraded: Updated Rankings on Top Blue-Chip Stocks
summary: Louis Navellier provides updated Stock Grader recommendations for 165 blue-chip stocks based on institutional buying pressure and fundamental health. The article details numerous upgrades and downgrades, with Apple Inc. moving from Neutral to Strong and DraftKings, Inc. being downgraded from Neutral to Weak. Navellier encourages readers to check their portfolios against these new rankings.

title: Americans Spend Nearly $1,000 A Year On Streaming, Says Scott Galloway. He Thinks Netflix Could Benefit If A Recession Hits
summary: Scott Galloway, a bestselling author and NYU professor, points out that Americans are spending nearly $1,000 annually on streaming services, with costs rising due to companies' "pricing power" in subscription models. He suggests that Netflix could even benefit from a recession as consumers prioritize "essential non-essentials" like streaming. Galloway also advises consumers to carefully review and manage their recurring subscriptions to avoid financial strain.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Bought by Almanack Investment Partners LLC.
summary: Almanack Investment Partners LLC significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 176.3% in Q2, acquiring 38,213 additional shares and making Apple its 12th largest holding. This move comes as institutional ownership in Apple stands at 67.73%, and analysts have raised price targets for the stock, with a consensus of "Moderate Buy." Meanwhile, several company insiders have been net sellers of their shares in recent months.

title: Here Are Monday's Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: Advanced Micro Devices, Alphabet, Apple, Eli Lilly, CarMax, HubSpot, and More
summary: This article provides a rundown of top Wall Street analyst upgrades, downgrades, and initiations for Monday, November 10, 2025, featuring companies like Advanced Micro Devices, Alphabet, Apple, and Eli Lilly. It also covers the overall market sentiment, including pre-market stock futures, treasury bonds, oil and gas, gold, and cryptocurrency performance, following a volatile trading week. The market is looking for direction with Q3 earnings winding down and focus shifting to economic data and potential rate cuts amidst hopes for an end to a government shutdown.

title: Centessa Pharmaceuticals stock falls after announcing public offering
summary: Centessa Pharmaceuticals PLC (NASDAQ:CNTA) stock dropped 2.5% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a new public offering of American Depositary Shares. The clinical-stage pharmaceutical company is offering ADSs, with underwriters having a 30-day option to purchase additional shares. This decline in stock price is a typical market reaction to public offerings, which can dilute existing shareholders' stakes.

title: JEPQ ETF (NASDAQ:JEPQ) Nears Record $59 as 10.3% Yield and $31.3B AUM Attract Massive Inflows — JPMorgan’s Income Giant Gains Momentum
summary: The JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) is approaching a record high of $59, driven by its 10.32% annual yield and substantial $31.34 billion in assets under management (AUM). The ETF, which uses a covered-call strategy on Nasdaq 100 large-cap equities, has seen significant institutional demand and strong performance, offering both income and some capital appreciation. With a BUY rating, JEPQ is projected to reach $62–$65 in 2026, solidifying its position as a key income-generating product for investors seeking cash flow stability and tech exposure.

title: Goldman Sees US Investors Flocking to Japan as Nikkei Surges
summary: US investors are increasingly buying Japanese stocks, particularly in tech and AI, due to their impressive returns compared to US equities. This surge in American investment marks the fastest pace observed since the "Abenomics" period, with active participation at its highest level since October 2022, according to Goldman Sachs. Bruce Kirk, Goldman's chief Japan equity strategist, notes frequent requests for meetings related to this trend.

title: PPG, Universal Display Corporation celebrate 25 years of partnership with community donations
summary: PPG and Universal Display Corporation (UDC) are celebrating 25 years of partnership by making significant donations to the Boys & Girls Clubs of Mercer County. This joint effort reflects their shared commitment to fostering innovation, education, and community engagement. The donations include a $25,000 grant from the PPG Foundation and 25 Apple iPad Pro OLED tablets from UDC, aimed at supporting STEM education for young people.

title: Oak Ridge Investments LLC Has $111.30 Million Stock Holdings in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Oak Ridge Investments LLC increased its stake in Apple Inc. by 1.1% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 542,495 shares valued at over $111 million, making Apple its third-largest holding. The article highlights Apple's strong Q3 earnings, robust stock performance metrics, recent insider selling activity by executives, and institutional investment trends. It also details recent analyst ratings and the company's dividend announcement.

title: Apple Almost Fixed the Worst Thing About the Podcasts App. There’s Just 1 Big Problem
summary: Apple recently announced new features for its Podcasts app, including automatic chapter creation and "Timed Links." While these updates seem promising, the author argues that Apple continues to neglect a crucial aspect for creators: support for embedded chapters in subscriber-only episodes. This omission makes the paid version of podcasts worse for loyal listeners, despite creators paying Apple 30% of their revenue.

title: MSTY vs. QQQI: Insane Dividends or High-Yield Stability?
summary: This article compares two high-yield ETFs, YieldMax MSTR Option Income Strategy ETF (MSTY) and NEOS NASDAQ-100 High Income ETF (QQQI), for passive income seekers. MSTY offers a significantly higher distribution yield with weekly payouts but comes with higher risk and potential share-price erosion due to its concentration in MicroStrategy stock options. QQQI, while having a lower yield and monthly payouts, provides greater diversification and stability through its NASDAQ 100 index exposure.

title: 179,518 Shares in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS Purchased by AE Wealth Management LLC
summary: AE Wealth Management LLC acquired 179,518 shares of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ:SWKS) totaling approximately $13.38 million in the second quarter. Other institutional investors also adjusted their holdings, with Pzena Investment Management LLC significantly increasing its stake. Wall Street analysts have issued mixed ratings, with a consensus "Hold" rating and a target price of $83.94, while Skyworks Solutions reported strong quarterly earnings and announced a dividend.

title: EOS: An Attractive Fund For The Income Investors, Nearly 8% Yield (NYSE:EOS)
summary: The Eaton Vance Enhanced Equity Income Fund II (EOS) offers high monthly income and long-term NAV growth, primarily focusing on large-cap technology stocks. With over 20 years of history, EOS provides nearly an 8% distribution yield and more than 10% annualized total returns, making it an attractive fund for income investors. Due to the market being near all-time highs, the fund is currently considered expensive, thus a "Hold" rating for existing owners and a recommendation for new buyers to dollar-cost-average.

title: The Motley Fool: Blue chip dividends, growth
summary: This article from The Motley Fool discusses blue-chip dividends and growth, focusing on the Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF and its top holdings like Microsoft and Apple. It also advises caution with Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) due to their volatility and the difficulty for ordinary investors to access initial prices. Additionally, it defines ETFs and naked call options, and emphasizes long-term wealth building through consistent stock market investing.

title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Konzentrationsrisiko!
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) faces significant concentration risk due to its heavy reliance on a few US technology stocks like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, making it vulnerable to market fluctuations. The ETF's performance is closely tied to these mega-caps, raising concerns about its stability if the tech boom ends or during quarterly rebalancing. An analysis from December 8th suggests urgent action for investors.

title: Apple Liquid Glass: You can’t turn it off in iOS26, but now you can tone it down
summary: Apple's new iOS 26 introduced a polarizing design called Liquid Glass, which features a transparent interface. While users cannot entirely disable Liquid Glass, Apple has provided several options in iOS 26.1 and through Accessibility settings to tone down its transparency and increase readability. This article details four methods to adjust Liquid Glass, including enabling a "Tinted" option, increasing contrast, reducing transparency, and showing button borders.

title: Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:SCHG) Hits $32.75 on AI Boom and Record Tech Earnings
summary: The Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Growth ETF (SCHG) has reached a new high of $32.75, driven by significant investments in AI infrastructure and strong earnings from major technology companies. With $51.4 billion in assets, SCHG is positioned as a leading growth ETF due to its low expense ratio and heavy allocation to AI-benefiting stocks like Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The article rates SCHG as a "BUY" due to its consistent outperformance and strong fundamentals in the burgeoning AI market.

title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Rekordjagd!
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF is nearing all-time highs driven by robust global equity markets and tech dominance, but faces valuation challenges. While beneficiaries of synchronized markets and tech growth, the concentration in large US tech stocks introduces cluster risks. Investors are advised to consider potential overvaluation despite strong fundamentals, with future performance hinging on upcoming quarterly reports.

title: Zedge, Inc. SEC 10-K Report
summary: Zedge, Inc. has released its annual 10-K report, revealing a total revenue of $29.4 million, a 2.3% decrease from the prior year, alongside significant improvements in operating and net income due to cost reductions. The report highlights strategic initiatives such as expanding digital marketplaces, enhancing product offerings with AI-driven tools like pAInt and DataSeeds.AI, and capital management through share repurchases and dividends. The company faces ongoing challenges including technological shifts, market risks, regulatory compliance, and intense competition, particularly in the AI sector.

title: ACWI ETF Explained: One Fund for Global Equity Exposure
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI) provides investors with diversified global equity exposure across developed and emerging markets through a single, low-cost fund. It tracks the MSCI All Country World Index, offering simplicity for long-term investors despite its concentration in US mega-cap technology stocks. This article details ACWI's structure, holdings, performance, and risks, helping investors assess its suitability for their portfolios.

title: Chris Bulman Inc Loads Up the First Trust Rising Dividend Achievers ETF With a 56K Share Acquisition
summary: Chris Bulman Inc. significantly increased its stake in the First Trust Rising Dividend Achievers ETF (NASDAQ:RDVY) by acquiring 55,611 shares, valued at $3.61 million and representing 1.81% of its reportable assets under management for the quarter. This acquisition makes RDVY the fund's 4th-largest holding. The ETF focuses on companies with consistent dividend growth, strong financials, and aims to provide diversification through small-, mid-, and large-cap companies.

title: Skyworks Solutions to buy Greensboro chipmaker Qorvo to form $22 billion company
summary: Skyworks Solutions is set to acquire Greensboro-based Qorvo in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $22 billion, forming a combined company that supplies radio-frequency chips to Apple and other smartphone makers. Qorvo shareholders will receive $32.50 in cash and 0.960 of a Skyworks common share for each Qorvo share, representing a 14.3% premium. Skyworks CEO Phil Brace will lead the combined entity, with Qorvo CEO Bob Bruggeworth joining the board.

title: Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Health Care ETF (NYSE:RSPH) Stock Quote
summary: This article provides a stock quote and detailed financial data for the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Health Care ETF (RSPH). It includes current trading information, performance metrics, and answers to frequently asked questions about the ETF. The article also lists recent news headlines mentioning related companies.

title: SPYG ETF S&P 500 Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:SPYG) Rises to $107.92, 26.8% Annual Surge
summary: The SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 Growth ETF (SPYG) has surged to a new 52-week high of $107.92, marking a 26.84% increase over the past year. This growth is largely attributed to its heavy allocation in AI-driven mega-cap stocks like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple, alongside investor optimism surrounding expected Fed rate cuts. Despite concentration risks, SPYG is considered a strategically positioned growth ETF due to its liquidity, cost efficiency, and exposure to the ongoing AI transformation.

title: QQQM ETF Climbs on $5T Nvidia Surge and $4T Microsoft, Apple Milestones as AI Momentum Lifts Nasdaq
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) is experiencing significant growth, driven by the AI expansion of its top holdings, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple. Nvidia recently surpassed a $5 trillion market cap, while Microsoft and Apple each breached $4 trillion, bolstering QQQM's returns despite its concentrated portfolio. The ETF is considered a strong buy with a target range of $265–$270, positioning it as an efficient gateway to U.S. technology dominance amid AI-driven capitalization momentum.

title: EverQuote (EVER) Q3 Earnings Beat: Stock Surges on Revenue Growth - News and Statistics
summary: EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) saw its stock surge by 11.4% after reporting strong third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations. The online insurance marketplace reported revenue of $173.9 million, a 20.3% year-over-year increase, and earnings per share of $0.50, significantly higher than the $0.38 forecast. The company also provided an optimistic revenue outlook for the fourth quarter, further boosting investor confidence.

title: Mirador Makes Invesco High Yield Corporate Bond ETF Its Biggest Holding
summary: Mirador Capital Partners LP has made the Invesco BulletShares 2026 High Yield Corporate Bond ETF (NASDAQ:BSJQ) its largest holding by adding almost 1 million shares, valued at over $22 million, to its portfolio. The investment now represents over 10% of Mirador's assets under management, with total holdings exceeding 3 million shares worth over $70 million. This move appears to be a portfolio rebalancing act, as Mirador simultaneously sold off shares in a similar fund maturing in 2025.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX explores acquisition of Globalstar - report
summary: SpaceX, led by Elon Musk, is reportedly considering acquiring Globalstar, an Apple-backed satellite operator, leading to a significant increase in Globalstar's share price. The potential acquisition would integrate Globalstar's extensive satellite network with SpaceX's ambitions in the commercial 5G and satellite phone markets, intensifying competition in the direct-to-device segment. However, the leak of these discussions and the subsequent market impact could complicate the negotiation process.

title: Apple Silicon Has a Very Real Problem: It’s Just Too Good
summary: This article argues that Apple Silicon's success creates a unique problem: continuous, modest year-over-year improvements now seem underwhelming compared to the revolutionary M1 chip. The author contends that while newer chips like the M5 are excellent, the narrative around them is challenging because they cannot replicate the massive leap seen with the M1, leading to reviewer disappointment despite exceptional product quality. Apple's marketing challenge has shifted from showcasing raw performance improvements to demonstrating how this power enables new user experiences.

title: Apple Will Power New Siri With Google’s Gemini AI Model
summary: Apple is reportedly finalizing a deal to integrate Google's Gemini AI model into its Siri voice assistant, paying Google an estimated $1 billion annually. This move is an interim solution to significantly boost Siri's capabilities with a 1.2 trillion-parameter model, while Apple develops its own long-term in-house AI technology. The new Siri, code-named Linwood, is slated for release next spring with an emphasis on data security through Apple's Private Cloud Compute servers.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS® Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Personal Care and Home Care Packaging - Ball
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have collaborated to pilot the first use of ELYSIS® carbon-free smelting technology in personal and home care packaging. This innovative approach eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum smelting, producing oxygen instead of CO2. The resulting aerosol can, made with 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content, represents a significant step towards low-carbon packaging solutions and demonstrates cross-industry collaboration for decarbonization goals.

title: Why the U.S. Economy and S&P 500 Are Diverging
summary: This article explains why the performance of the U.S. economy and the S&P 500 are diverging, attributing it to fundamental differences in what drives each. The economy is largely services-based and follows wages and household spending, while the S&P 500 is weighted towards goods and global platform businesses and is driven by corporate profits per share. Despite soft consumer sentiment and cooling wage growth, strong corporate margins and global sales contribute to the S&P 500's continued rise.

title: Direxion Qualcomm ETFs Trade on Earnings Beat
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) surpassed fourth-quarter earnings and revenue expectations, yet its shares fell due to news of potentially losing Apple as a modem customer. This volatility created a trading opportunity for Direxion's single-stock Qualcomm ETFs, QCMU (2x leveraged bull) and QCMD (1x inverse bear), which reacted sharply to the news. Despite the stock's muted reaction, analysts view Qualcomm as a fundamentally strong company with growing diversification into automotive and AI markets.

title: Apple TV boss Cue squashes idea of ad-supported plan: report (AAPL:NASDAQ)
summary: Eddy Cue, Apple's senior vice president of Services, has publicly stated that there are no current plans for an ad-supported version of its Apple TV streaming service. This declaration comes amidst speculation that the tech giant might be exploring such a model. Cue's statement indicates that Apple is not pursuing an ad-supported tier "at this time."

title: LANDFALL: New Commercial-Grade Android Spyware in Exploit Chain Targeting Samsung Devices
summary: Unit 42 researchers identified "LANDFALL," a new Android spyware actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-21042) in Samsung's image processing library. This commercial-grade spyware specifically targets Samsung Galaxy devices for comprehensive surveillance, including microphone recording and data exfiltration. The campaign uses malformed DNG image files, likely delivered via WhatsApp, and shares tradecraft with private-sector offensive actors, with evidence pointing to operations in the Middle East.

title: Apple Just Quietly Rolled Out 1 of the Best New macOS Features in Years
summary: Apple has quietly rolled out a new feature in macOS 26.1 that allows users to customize the duration their clipboard history is saved. This update addresses a long-standing need for more flexible clipboard management, enabling users to choose between 30 minutes, eight hours, or seven days. While not a flashy feature, it significantly enhances the daily usability of Macs by making a fundamental function work more intuitively, aligning with Apple's strength in refining user experience.

title: Alta Capital Management LLC Grows Stock Position in Amazon.com, Inc. $AMZN
summary: Alta Capital Management LLC increased its stake in Amazon.com, Inc. ($AMZN) by 5.2% in Q2, making AMZN its second-largest holding. The e-commerce giant also received several analyst price target upgrades following an earnings beat, with a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating. Despite recent insider sales, institutional ownership remains high.

title: Apple, Western Union, Palo Alto And More On CNBC's 'Final Trades'
summary: Joseph Terranova, Bryn Talkington, Jason Snipe, and Jenny Van Leeuwen Harrington shared their "Final Trades" on CNBC. Recommendations included Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: APPL), Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Health Care ETF (NYSE: RSPH), Palo Alto Networks, Inc. (NASDAQ: PANW), and The Western Union Company (NYSE: WU), backed by recent financial performance and upcoming reports.

title: Two Solar Stocks Surge In Momentum Amid Insatiable AI Power Demand
summary: Driven by the growing power demands of artificial intelligence infrastructure, solar stocks Canadian Solar (CSIQ) and First Solar (FSLR) have demonstrated significant momentum gains. Both companies have seen substantial improvements in their momentum percentiles and stock performance, positioning them as key players in the evolving energy landscape. This surge coincides with ambitious energy expansion plans from tech leaders looking at new data center strategies.

title: Apple (APPL) TV Streaming Service Suffers Outage on ‘Pluribus’ Premiere
summary: Apple Inc.'s streaming service, Apple TV, experienced a brief outage for some users in the US and Canada shortly after the premiere of its new series, "Pluribus." The service crash, reported by nearly 13,000 users on Downdetector, was resolved within approximately an hour and a half.

title: Exclusive: Intel Is Losing A Data Center AI Executive To AMD
summary: Intel is losing Saurabh Kulkarni, its vice president of data center AI product management, to rival AMD. This move occurs as AMD is rapidly advancing in the AI infrastructure market, securing high-profile customers like OpenAI, while Intel is restructuring its AI strategy after underperforming revenue expectations for its Gaudi chips. Kulkarni's departure is part of a trend of executive changes at Intel as the company's CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, attempts to refocus toward an engineering-led approach.

title: Aerosol can features Elysis primary aluminum, recycled content
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have partnered to launch an aerosol can featuring Elysis carbon-free primary aluminum and 50 percent postconsumer recycled content, marking the first use of Elysis technology in consumer personal and home care packaging. This collaboration aims to decarbonize aluminum packaging and aligns with global sustainability goals by significantly reducing the carbon footprint of the product. The Elysis process, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions during aluminum smelting.

title: Jim Cramer on Tyler Technologies: “Let’s Hold Off”
summary: Jim Cramer advised caution on Tyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL), suggesting investors "hold off" due to its high 40 PE ratio despite its strong market position and recent earnings beat. He acknowledged its past impressive performance but noted some recent softness in bookings. Cramer also alluded to better AI stock opportunities with higher return potential.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Increases Stake in Lowe's Companies Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly increased its stake in Lowe's Companies Inc. by adding over 5.2 million shares, bringing its total holdings to more than 36.7 million shares. This transaction, valued at $251.31 per share, reflects JPMorgan's confidence in Lowe's long-term growth potential and market position within the home improvement sector. Lowe's, despite a year-to-date price decline, maintains a strong market position, profitability, and growth metrics, appealing to various institutional investors.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Mohawk Industries Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. significantly reduced its stake in Mohawk Industries Inc. by over 30% on September 30, 2025, selling 1,084,001 shares. This strategic move, impacting less than 1% of JPMorgan's portfolio, leaves the firm with 2,427,971 shares and reflects a recalibration of its investment strategy in the flooring products manufacturer. Mohawk Industries, with a market capitalization of $6.61 billion, is considered fairly valued and has a strong financial and profitability rank despite recent declines in some growth indicators.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Expands Holdings in Hims & Hers Health Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. significantly increased its stake in Hims & Hers Health Inc. by acquiring an additional 15 million shares on September 30, 2025, bringing its total holdings to over 17 million shares. This move reflects JPMorgan's strategic interest in the rapidly growing telehealth sector, despite Hims & Hers Health Inc. being considered modestly overvalued with a GF Value of $34.38 against a trade price of $56.72. The transaction had a 0.06% impact on JPMorgan's overall portfolio, underscoring their commitment to this volatile yet potentially high-growth industry.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Eaton Corp PLC
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. reduced its stake in Eaton Corp PLC by 5,584,931 shares on September 30, 2025, decreasing its position by 23.38%. This transaction, valued at $374.25 per share, resulted in Eaton Corp PLC comprising 0.45% of JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s portfolio. Despite the reduction, Eaton Corp PLC, an industrial powerhouse with a 90/100 GF Score and strong growth metrics, remains a significant holding for the financial giant, with other prominent investors like Jefferies Group and Fisher Asset Management also holding stakes.

title: Final Trades: Apple, Palo Alto Networks, Western Union and the RSPH
summary: The Investment Committee presents their top stock picks for the second half of the year, focusing on companies like Apple, Palo Alto Networks, Western Union, and RSPH. The video segment details these "final trades" and provides insights into why these stocks were selected.

title: AI Is Probably Underestimated, Qualcomm CEO Says
summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon believes the growth and impact of AI are currently underestimated, comparing its future potential to that of the internet. The company is diversifying its portfolio beyond handsets into automotive, data centers, and personal AI devices, focusing on power-efficient inference solutions for AI implementation. Amon sees immense opportunity in the expanding premium tier smartphone market and new AI-driven devices.

title: Earnings call transcript: Inuvo Q3 2025 sees revenue rise, stock falls
summary: Inuvo Inc. reported a 1% revenue increase to $22.6 million for Q3 2025, but its stock fell over 9% due to a decline in gross profit and margin. Despite a narrowed net loss and strategic advancements like the AI-driven "Ranger" product and new client acquisitions, investor sentiment was negatively impacted by reduced profitability. The company remains optimistic about future growth, anticipating significant expansion from top clients and a substantial payout from a class-action lawsuit in Q1 2026.

title: Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) Price Target Raised to $73.00
summary: BNP Paribas Exane has raised the price target for Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) from $71.00 to $73.00, maintaining a "neutral" rating. This comes after Skyworks reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst expectations with an EPS of $1.76 and a 7.3% year-over-year revenue increase. The company currently holds an average "Hold" rating from analysts with a consensus price target of $84.22.

title: AT&T falsely promised “everyone” a free iPhone, ad-industry board rules
summary: The National Advertising Review Board (NARB) has ruled against AT&T for falsely promising "everyone" a free iPhone in its advertising. The offer for the iPhone 16 Pro was only available to customers on certain plans, not all AT&T subscribers. AT&T has agreed to comply with the NARB's decision to modify its advertising, despite having sued the organization previously over a separate ad dispute.

title: Jim Cramer on Altria: “I Won’t Recommend It Personally, But I Can’t Fight It”
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Altria Group, Inc. (NYSE: MO), acknowledging its strong long-term returns despite his personal reservations about tobacco stocks. He stated that while he wouldn't personally recommend or own Altria due to ethical concerns, the stock's historical performance—even surprising him—is undeniable. Cramer presented a two-sided view, recognizing its financial strength but also his moral conflict, advising callers to make their own decision.

title: T-Mobile’s Holiday Free-4-All: 4 Lines and 4 iPhone 17 for $100/mo. No Trade-in Needed
summary: T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) is launching a "Holiday Free-4-All" deal, offering four lines and four iPhone 17s for $100/month with no trade-in required, alongside other significant discounts on Apple products. The promotion aims to attract new customers by removing trade-in hassle and providing access to Magenta Status benefits. Additionally, T-Mobile for Business and Metro by T-Mobile are also offering various holiday deals, including new device protection and security services.

title: Apple could make $133 billion a year on humanoid robots by 2040: Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley projects that Apple could generate $133 billion annually from humanoid robots by 2040, leveraging its market share and resources. This forecast comes as advancements in generative AI and computing power make humanoid robots a viable commercial product, with other tech giants like Nvidia, Amazon, and Tesla also investing heavily in the sector. Challenges remain in perfecting computer vision and lowering costs for widespread consumer adoption.

title: Apple's $1 Billion AI Shock Deal: Siri Gets Supercharged by Google's Gemini
summary: Apple is reportedly close to finalizing a $1 billion annual deal with Google to license its Gemini AI model to power the next generation of Siri. This partnership will enable Siri to handle more complex tasks, serving as a temporary bridge while Apple develops its own advanced AI system. The move reflects Apple's strategic decision to leverage external technology to rapidly advance its generative AI capabilities, with plans for in-house models in the future.

title: Qualcomm Outlook Fails to Meet Lofty Investor Expectations
summary: Qualcomm Inc., a major smartphone processor maker, reported an upbeat forecast that still underwhelmed investors, causing its stock to dip. This follows a trend seen with other chipmakers like AMD and Micron, where strong outlooks fail to meet "stratospheric" investor expectations fueled by AI-driven rallies. Despite a significant one-time tax writedown, Qualcomm's core business in high-end Android phones remains robust, and the company is diversifying into chips for cars, PCs, and data centers, with a new AI chip line set to challenge Nvidia.

title: Earnings call transcript: ScanSource Q1 2026 beats EPS forecast, stock tumbles
summary: ScanSource (SCSC) reported Q1 fiscal year 2026 earnings, beating EPS forecasts but missing revenue expectations. The company's EPS was $1.06 against a forecast of $0.90, while revenue was $739.65 million, falling short of the $788.77 million forecast. Despite the EPS beat, the stock tumbled 15.98% in pre-market trading, reflecting investor concerns over the revenue shortfall, although the company reaffirmed its full fiscal year 2026 outlook for net sales and adjusted EBITDA.

title: Vanguard Group Inc Reduces Stake in Navient Corp
summary: Vanguard Group Inc reduced its stake in Navient Corp by 664,823 shares, a decrease of 8.09%, though it still represents 7.59% of Vanguard's total portfolio. Navient Corp (NAVI) is a credit services company specializing in education finance solutions, currently facing challenges including declining revenue and earnings growth. Despite these issues and a "poor future performance potential" GF Score, other notable investors like Hotchkis & Wiley Capital Management LLC maintain significant holdings.

title: Apple says EU's Digital Markets Act enforcement opens door for fraud: report
summary: Apple (AAPL) claims that the European Union's Digital Markets Act, by forcing them to allow in-app purchases outside of its App Store, increases the risk of fraud and scams for users. The company argues this undermines device security and exposes users to unsafe third-party payment platforms. This situation echoes concerns Apple raised during its U.S. legal conflict with Epic Games regarding App Store payment restrictions.

title: Blue Trust Inc. Raises Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Blue Trust Inc. increased its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 3.8% during the second quarter, acquiring an additional 6,443 shares. This made Apple the 29th largest position in Blue Trust Inc.'s portfolio, valued at $36,172,000. Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions, and insider selling activity was noted.

title: Apple, Google close in on $1-billion/year AI deal to use Gemini for Siri | Business News
summary: Apple is reportedly nearing a $1 billion annual deal with Google to use its Gemini AI model for a significant overhaul of Siri, with plans to introduce new features next year. This move is seen as an interim solution until Apple can develop its own powerful in-house AI models. The agreement would see Google's Gemini handling complex summarization and planning tasks for Siri, running on Apple's Private Cloud Compute servers to ensure user data privacy.

title: Sorry, GM - Apple's CarPlay Isn't Going Anywhere
summary: General Motors plans to phase out Apple CarPlay compatibility from its vehicles, citing a desire for customers to use their proprietary infotainment system and generate revenue through subscriptions. This decision is widely seen as anti-consumer, as GM's infotainment system is criticized for being subpar and unreliable compared to the highly popular and integrated Apple CarPlay. Despite GM's rationale, surveys indicate a strong preference for CarPlay among car buyers, making GM's move appear more financially motivated than geared towards user experience.

title: GM seeks site for Seattle base, hires new tech exec
summary: General Motors Co. has hired Apple Inc. alum Ed Nightingale as its new vice president of digital products and infrastructure, who will also lead the establishment of a GM office in Seattle for approximately 100 developers. This move is part of GM's strategy to accelerate in-house software development for its increasingly tech-focused vehicles and follows previous efforts to attract Silicon Valley talent. The company aims to strengthen its software foundation and has recently seen some Silicon Valley executives depart.

title: Apple to use Google’s AI model to run new Siri, report says
summary: Apple is reportedly finalizing a deal to use Google’s 1.2 trillion-parameter Gemini AI model to power a revamped Siri voice assistant. This move is seen as a temporary solution until Apple's own AI systems are ready, with the deal potentially costing Apple around $1 billion annually. This partnership aims to address Siri's historical limitations compared to competitors like Alexa and Google Assistant in handling complex requests.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG)’s Cloud Strength Drives Solid Q3 Results and Analyst Price Target Hike
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) reported strong Q3 results, driven by significant growth in Google Cloud, leading Stifel to raise its price target to $333. The company's revenue increased by 16% year-over-year, and EPS jumped 35%. Additionally, Google partnered with Reliance Intelligence to offer its AI Pro plan to Jio Unlimited 5G users in India, aiming to expand AI accessibility.

title: Need Income? These 3 Dividend ETFs Pay You 52 Times Per Year

Smith Corp, a leading manufacturer of water heaters and boilers, is noted for its strong financial health and market position, particularly in North America, and is currently considered modestly undervalued.

title: Qualcomm and Arm beat expectations, but investors’ reactions are mixed

While Arm saw its stock rise, Qualcomm's stock dipped despite impressive results, primarily due to a one-time tax expense. Both companies are making strategic moves into the AI market, with Qualcomm launching new accelerators and Arm emphasizing its role in AI chip architecture, though analysts note challenges in securing cloud vendor deals and showing an immediate AI revenue jolt for Arm.

title: Kimberly-Clark, Kenvue’s $48.7B deal among recent multibillion-dollar M&A

These deals reflect a trend of multibillion-dollar consolidations driven by market trends, including AI and an aging population.

title: T-Mobile brings free 911 emergency texting to AT&T and Verizon customers

Previously, this emergency 911 texting was part of a paid T-Satellite service. This free service is available for specific phone models like the iPhone 13, Pixel 9A, Samsung Galaxy S21 and up, or newer Motorola phones, but excludes those with built-in emergency satellite texting like the iPhone 14 onwards.

title: Tata Electronics Protest: Camera Found at Apple Supplier's Hosur Hostel
summary: A camera was found in a hostel bathroom at a Tata Electronics unit near Hosur, an Apple supplier, leading to a massive protest by employees. Police arrested the accused on Tuesday night, and employees demanded searches of all bathrooms on campus. The incident sparked concerns about privacy and security at the facility.

title: Apple nears deal to pay Google $1B annually to power new Siri, report says
summary: Apple is reportedly close to a deal with Google to pay approximately $1 billion annually for a custom version of Google's Gemini AI model. This model will power an overhauled Siri, serving as a temporary solution until Apple's own AI technology matures. The custom Gemini AI model would be significantly more complex than Apple's current cloud-based AI.

The author highlights how IBM has repeatedly missed opportunities to lead in various tech advancements and now faces significantly smaller revenue and market capitalization compared to modern tech giants like Microsoft and new players like OpenAI. The piece concludes that IBM's only path to a bright future may be acquisition by a larger company.

(AIZ) reported strong Q3 2025 results, significantly surpassing analysts' expectations with an EPS of $5.76 and revenue of $3.23 billion, leading to a 4.38% rise in its stock price. title: ​​Failure to launch: 3 Apple releases that were too ahead of their time

Their failures highlight that even innovative companies can misjudge market readiness for groundbreaking technologies.

The company aims to partner with various financial entities and entice users by offering services without transaction fees, differentiating itself from competitors.

title: Apple's App Store infected with XcodeGhost malware in China

This marks the first large-scale attack on Apple's App Store, stemming from hackers creating a counterfeit version of Apple's Xcode software which developers downloaded. The malware allowed for data theft and manipulation on infected devices, prompting Apple and affected developers like Tencent to take remedial actions.

title: Matter offers promise of single ecosystem for smart homes
summary: The Matter standard is poised to revolutionize smart homes by enabling seamless interoperability between devices from various manufacturers, addressing the long-standing fragmentation issue in the IoT. A major media launch event showcased industry commitment, with numerous companies demonstrating Matter-compatible products and emphasizing the standard's potential for a more connected, secure, and useful smart home ecosystem. While full adoption will take time, the strong industry backing and certification program suggest a significant shift towards unified smart home experiences.

title: 5 American Companies Reshoring After Trump’s Tariffs (AAPl, GE, INTC, NVDA, WHR)
summary: This article details how policies like President Trump's tariffs, tax cuts, and reduced regulations have incentivized American companies to reshore manufacturing operations and jobs. It highlights five major US companies—Apple, Nvidia, Intel, General Electric, and Whirlpool—that are making significant investments to bring production back to the United States. The article outlines specific investment commitments, job creation projections, and the historical context of their previous offshoring activities.

title: Live Nation Entertainment Reports Strong Q2 2025 Results
summary: Live Nation Entertainment reported strong Q2 2025 financial results, with significant increases in revenue, operating income, and concert attendance. The company's global expansion efforts and heightened fan engagement drove a 16% revenue increase to $7 billion and an 11% rise in adjusted operating income. Live Nation remains optimistic about future growth, projecting double-digit international fan growth and consistent full-year AOI margins.

title: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) Offers Broader Tech Diversification Than the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK)
summary: This article compares two major technology ETFs, the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) and the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK), highlighting their differences in diversification, cost, and performance. While XLK has a slightly higher five-year return despite fewer holdings, VGT offers broader diversification with significantly more stocks. Both ETFs have very low expense ratios and primarily focus on top tech companies like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft.

title: What a US stake in Intel means for the company and the INTC stock
summary: The Trump administration is reportedly planning to acquire a 10% stake in Intel Corporation, potentially converting $10.86 billion in federal grants into equity. This move could provide a significant boost to the company, which reported an $18.8 billion annual loss in 2024, and is seen by analysts as a way to stabilize Intel for chip production in the US. The potential government involvement, alongside SoftBank's $2 billion investment, has already positively impacted Intel's stock.

title: Eaton Announces Departure of Executive VP Ernest Marshall
summary: Eaton Corporation plc announced the upcoming departure of Ernest Marshall, their Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, effective September 30, 2025. Following his departure, Mr. Marshall will receive a compensation package including salary, incentives, and continued vesting of stock options and restricted share units. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates ETN as Outperform, citing strong financial performance and strategic positioning despite valuation concerns.

title: Meta, app makers launch Washington lobby to fight Apple and Google
summary: Meta, Spotify, and Match Group are forming a new lobbying coalition called "The Coalition for a Competitive Mobile Experience" to challenge Apple and Google on issues including age verification responsibility and app store practices. The group aims to lobby federal and state policymakers for legislation cracking down on smartphone companies and support Justice Department cases against Apple and Google. This initiative comes as legislation requiring age verification gains momentum and app makers anticipate costly legal responsibilities.

title: Johnson & Johnson plans $55 billion in US investments over the next four years
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced plans to invest over $55 billion in the United States over the next four years, including building four new manufacturing plants. This represents a 25% increase from previous investments and is estimated to have an economic impact of over $100 billion annually. The company cited 2017 tax cut legislation as a factor, a sentiment shared by other companies like Eli Lilly and Co., Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., and Apple, which have also announced significant US investments.

title: KKR & Co Releases Asset-Based Finance Overview
summary: KKR & Co. Inc. has released an 'Asset-Based Finance Overview' presentation for its stockholders and analysts to enhance transparency and investor confidence. The company's stock currently holds a Buy rating from analysts with a $155.00 price target, although TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates KKR as Neutral due to mixed financial indicators despite strategic growth.

title: Visa Inc. Reports Strong Q3 2025 Financial Results
summary: Visa Inc. announced robust financial results for Q3 2025, with net revenue increasing by 14% to $10.2 billion and a non-GAAP net income of $5.8 billion. The company saw significant growth in payments volume, cross-border volume, and processed transactions, driven by strategic innovation in areas like AI and stablecoins. Visa remains optimistic about its future growth, supported by strong financial positioning and continued product development.

title: Insulet’s Omnipod® 5 App for iPhone with Dexcom G7 Integration Now Available to all U.S. Users
summary: Insulet Corporation announced that its Omnipod® 5 App for iPhone is now compatible with the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System, making it available to all U.S. users. This integration allows users to manage their diabetes conveniently from their iPhone, combining tubeless Automated Insulin Delivery with Dexcom's latest technology. The company highlights that this update offers U.S. customers more choice and fewer devices to manage, simplifying diabetes management.

title: Affirm Holdings Approves Executive Equity Awards
summary: Affirm Holdings' Compensation Committee approved annual equity awards for certain executive officers on September 18, 2025. These awards, consisting of restricted stock units (RSUs) and performance stock units (PSUs), are contingent on time-based, service-based, and company financial performance conditions over a three-year period. The move aims to align executive incentives with the company's performance and long-term growth objectives.

title: Air T Announces Acquisition of Regional Express Holdings
summary: Air T, Inc. has announced its intention to acquire Regional Express Holdings Limited, an Australian regional airline, through an indirect subsidiary. The acquisition is anticipated to finalize by the end of 2025, contingent upon necessary approvals, including court approval. This news comes as Air T faces challenges in financial performance and valuation, with a recent analyst rating on AIRT stock being a Hold with a $21.00 price target.

title: Southern California Bancorp Reports Strong Q3 2025 Results
summary: Southern California Bancorp reported a net income of $15.7 million for Q3 2025, a significant improvement from the previous quarter and a turnaround from a net loss in the same period last year. The company highlighted strong deposit growth, loan originations, and a focus on derisking its balance sheet. Analysts have a positive outlook for the stock, with a Buy rating and an $18.50 price target.

title: Bio Green Med Solution Faces Nasdaq Delisting Notice
summary: Bio Green Med Solution received a Nasdaq notice on September 11, 2025, regarding its 6% Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock no longer meeting the minimum Market Value of Publicly Held Shares requirement of $1 million. The company has until March 10, 2026, to regain compliance to avoid delisting. Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, rates BGMS as "Underperform" due to financial strain, operational inefficiencies, and unattractive valuation.

title: Christian investor Robert Netzly fights 'spiritual money laundering': Ross Kerber
summary: Robert Netzly, CEO of Inspire Investing, discusses his firm's faith-based ETF approach, which screens companies based on "conservative, biblical values" including stances on abortion and LGBTQ+ issues. Netzly explains their methodology for biblically responsible investing and distinguishes between shopping at a company and owning its stock, labeling the practice of profiting from "improper stuff" to fund good causes as "spiritual money laundering." He also highlights their increasing involvement in shareholder engagement to address what he perceives as far-left ideologies in corporate America.

title: BlackSky Technology Holds Annual Stockholders Meeting
summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. held its annual stockholders meeting on September 10, 2025, where key decisions were made, including the election of directors and approval of executive compensation. The company's stock (BKSY) currently has a Hold rating from analysts with a $17.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates BKSY as Neutral due to financial challenges despite positive developments like international growth.

title: Cardiol Therapeutics Reports Q2 2025 Financial Results Amid Rising Losses
summary: Cardiol Therapeutics reported its Q2 2025 financial results, showing a decrease in cash and cash equivalents from $30.6 million to $18.2 million and an increased net loss of $8.35 million compared to $6.59 million in Q2 2024. The company continues to face high research and development expenses and negative cash flow, leading TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, to rate the stock as "Underperform" despite promising clinical developments. Cardiol Therapeutics specializes in cannabinoid-based therapies for inflammatory heart diseases.

title: Cardiol Therapeutics Reports Q1 2025 Financial Results
summary: Cardiol Therapeutics Inc. (CRDL) reported its Q1 2025 financial results, showing a net loss of $8.29 million, an improvement from the previous year. The company's cash and cash equivalents decreased to $23.29 million, while it continues to advance its clinical trials, including the Phase III MAVERIC trial. Management is focused on progressing clinical programs and exploring partnerships.

title: CXApp Enters $5M Agreement with Avondale Capital
summary: CXApp Inc. has entered a $5 million financial agreement with Avondale Capital, which includes an original issue discount and provisions allowing Avondale to convert the balance into CXApp shares. This agreement, dated October 17, 2025, could impact CXApp's stock issuance and financial strategy. A recent analyst rating on CXAI stock is a Hold with a $0.50 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates CXAI as Neutral due to weak financial performance and valuation concerns.

title: Enerflex Ltd. Appoints Paul Mahoney as New CEO to Drive Strategic Growth
summary: Enerflex Ltd. has appointed Paul E. Mahoney as its new President, CEO, and Director, effective September 29, 2025. Mahoney's extensive experience in the industrial and energy sectors is expected to drive the company's strategic priorities, including enhancing core operations' profitability and capitalizing on natural gas demand. Analysts currently rate Enerflex (TSE:EFX) with a Buy and a C$14.50 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, indicates an "Outperform" score due to strong technical indicators and positive earnings call sentiment.

title: EPWK Holdings Faces Nasdaq Compliance Challenges
summary: EPWK Holdings Ltd. has received three deficiency letters from Nasdaq on July 23, 2025, due to non-compliance with listing requirements related to minimum bid price and market value thresholds. The company has until January 19, 2026, to resolve these issues and plans to actively monitor its market value and bid price to regain compliance. EPWK Holdings operates an integrated crowdsourcing platform connecting businesses with talent.

title: Empire State Realty Trust Reports Steady Q3 2025 Results
summary: Empire State Realty Trust (ESRT) reported steady Q3 2025 results, with a net income of $0.05 per share and Core FFO of $0.23 per share, reaffirming its 2025 financial guidance. The company demonstrated strong liquidity, increased Manhattan office occupancy to 90.3%, and executed significant leasing activity, including $26.5 million in net operating income from the Empire State Building Observatory. ESRT also issued $175 million in senior unsecured notes and achieved a GRESB 5 Star Rating for the sixth consecutive year, maintaining a strong balance sheet with no floating rate debt exposure.

title: EZGO Technologies Granted Additional Time by Nasdaq to Regain Compliance
summary: EZGO Technologies Ltd. (EZGO) has been granted an additional 180 days by Nasdaq, until December 29, 2025, to comply with the minimum bid price requirement of $1 per share. This extension follows a previous notification concerning the company’s failure to meet the minimum bid price for 30 consecutive business days. EZGO is actively exploring options to regain compliance within the stipulated timeframe.

title: Expensify Announces Q1 2025 Results
summary: Expensify (Nasdaq: EXFY) announced strong Q1 2025 results, with an 8% increase in revenue, 43% increase in interchange revenue from the Expensify Card, and significant growth in cash from operating activities and free cash flow. The company increased its full-year 2025 free cash flow guidance to $17.0 million - $21.0 million and highlighted a 166% increase in quarterly travel bookings, alongside preparations for a major brand visibility event with the F1 premier sponsoring Brad Pitt's F1 team.

title: FrontView REIT, Inc. Terminates Co-CEO Randall Starr
summary: FrontView REIT, Inc. has terminated Randall Starr from his various leadership roles, including Co-CEO, CFO, and Secretary, for cause following an Audit Committee investigation unrelated to the company's financial performance. Sean Fukumura has been appointed Interim CFO. This leadership change is expected to have minimal impact on the company's operations.

title: Warren Buffett turns 95 as AI still can't replace him
summary: This article discusses how artificial intelligence has become a valuable tool in the finance industry for tasks like data extraction and market analysis, yet it still struggles to replicate the nuanced decision-making and "taste" of legendary investors like Warren Buffett. While AI-powered funds show success in beating benchmarks, human oversight remains crucial for final approvals and addressing the qualitative aspects of investment. The article also explores AI's role in private markets and how experienced quantitative investors view the current AI "revolution" as an evolution of existing algorithmic strategies.

title: Structure Therapeutics Reports Q2 2025 Financial Results
summary: Structure Therapeutics, Inc. (GPCR) announced its Q2 2025 financial results, highlighting a strong financial position with $786.5 million in cash, expected to fund operations through 2027. The clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company is advancing its GLP-1 receptor agonist studies and plans to initiate a Phase 1 study for its amylin receptor agonist by late 2025. The company reported a net loss of $61.7 million and increased R&D expenses to $54.7 million for the quarter.

title: Huize Holding Limited Reports Strong Q2 2025 Growth
summary: Huize Holding Limited reported strong financial growth in Q2 2025, with first-year premiums increasing by 73.1% and gross written premiums by 34.4% year-over-year. The company's total revenue surged by 40.2% to RMB396.7 million, achieving a GAAP net profit of RMB10.9 million. Huize attributes this success to its focus on a high-quality customer base, diverse product offerings, cost optimization, and the integration of AI to enhance efficiency and customer engagement.

title: Immersion Corporation Delays Annual Report Filing
summary: Immersion Corporation has delayed its annual report filing (Form 10-K) for the fiscal year ending April 30, 2025, due to an internal investigation at its subsidiary, Barnes & Noble Education, regarding potential overstatements in accounts receivable. Despite these issues, the company expects a significant revenue increase to approximately $1.6 billion, primarily from the Barnes & Noble Education acquisition, and plans to file the report within a 15-day extension. An analyst maintains a Buy rating on IMMR stock with a $14 target, though TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates it Neutral due to mixed financial signals.

title: Kala Pharmaceuticals Sets Date for Annual Meeting
summary: Kala Pharmaceuticals (KALA) has scheduled its annual stockholders meeting for December 11, 2025. Stockholder proposals for inclusion in proxy materials must be submitted by October 1, 2025, and nominations or proposals by September 28, 2025. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates KALA as "Underperform" due to financial difficulties, declining revenues, heavy reliance on debt, and an unattractive valuation.

title: KT Corporation Schedules Q2 2025 Earnings Call for August 11
summary: KT Corporation announced its Q2 2025 earnings call is scheduled for August 11, 2025, providing stakeholders with insights into its financial performance and strategic direction. The company currently has a "Buy" analyst rating with a $20.38 price target, though TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates KT as "Neutral" despite strengths in revenue growth and stable financial leverage. KT Corporation is a leading telecommunications company in Korea.

title: Apple's Free Cash Flow Surges, Implying AAPL Stock Could Be 20% Too Cheap
summary: Apple Inc.'s (AAPL) free cash flow surged by 10.8% year-over-year to nearly $99 billion in its fiscal year ending September 27, 2025, with revenue up 8%. This significant increase in FCF, coupled with a 25.85% FCF margin, suggests that AAPL stock could be undervalued by over 20%, leading to a potential price target of $325 per share. Analysts project continued revenue growth, supporting a robust FCF forecast for the next 12 months.

title: Better Artificial Intelligence ETF: Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund vs. Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF
summary: This article compares two Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs: the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) and the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT). It highlights their differences in expense ratio, performance, holdings, and risk profiles, helping investors decide which ETF aligns better with their investment goals and risk tolerance. XLK offers broad tech exposure with a low expense ratio, while CHAT provides concentrated exposure to generative AI with potentially higher returns and risk.

title: Norwood Financial Corp Reports Strong Q3 2025 Results
summary: Norwood Financial Corp (NWFL) announced strong Q3 2025 results, with fully diluted EPS increasing by 85% year-over-year to $0.89. The company reported improved profitability, including a 72 basis point rise in return on assets to 1.40% and a 64 basis point increase in net interest margin. Norwood Financial also highlighted 5.4% loan growth and 15% annualized deposit growth, alongside a successful brand launch.

title: Zai Lab Limited Announces Equity Incentive Grants
summary: Zai Lab Limited (HK:9688) announced equity incentive grants to employees under its 2024 plan. The company granted share options for 6,600 ADSs to two employees and 9,893 restricted share units to four employees, aiming to align incentives with long-term goals. The stock currently holds a "Hold" analyst rating with a HK$22.00 price target.

title: CleanCore Solutions Lowers Quorum Requirement for Meetings
summary: CleanCore Solutions (ZONE) has lowered its quorum requirement for stockholder meetings from a majority to one-third of outstanding shares, effective October 22, 2025. This change aims to simplify decision-making and could affect company governance and stakeholder engagement. Spark, TipRanks' AI Analyst, rates ZONE as Underperform due to ongoing losses, liquidity issues, and bearish technical indicators.

title: Vanguard VOO ETF Offers Lower Costs and Stronger Growth Than IWM
summary: This article compares two ETFs: the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO) and the iShares Russell 2000 ETF (IWM), highlighting their differences in costs, returns, risk, and portfolio makeup. VOO, which tracks the S&P 500, offers lower expense ratios and has shown stronger growth compared to IWM, which focuses on small-cap stocks. While IWM has higher risk, it also presents potential for significant growth through young companies, making the choice dependent on an investor's risk tolerance and investment objectives.

title: 3 ESG-Focused ETFs for the Socially Conscious Investor
summary: This article highlights three ESG-focused ETFs—iShares ESG Aware MSCI USA (ESGU), iShares MSCI KLD 400 Social ETF (DSI), and iShares ESG Advanced MSCI USA ETF (USXF)—for socially conscious investors. It details their AUM, holdings, expense ratios, dividend information, and performance, emphasizing the growing importance of ESG investing. The piece also cites forecasts for significant growth in the global ESG investing market.

title: S&P 500 surges to record high today: Why is S&P 500 rising and US stock market rallying to all-time highs?
summary: The S&P 500 reached a new all-time high of 6,850, driven by strong tech earnings and optimism about a potential US-China trade truce. The Dow and Nasdaq also saw significant gains, with chipmakers like Qualcomm and major tech companies like Tesla and Apple leading the rally. Investors are also anticipating Federal Reserve rate cuts and the upcoming earnings reports from "Magnificent Seven" tech giants.

title: Grantham Mayo's BCHI Fund Looks Beyond China
summary: Grantham Mayo's new BCHI fund is designed to navigate geopolitical uncertainty by investing in countries benefiting from a shift away from China as a manufacturing hub. This active ETF focuses on diversifying supply chains due to factors like rising labor costs in China and lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic, rather than solely reacting to tariff threats. The fund holds approximately 100 stocks across industrials, consumer discretionary, real estate, and financials in emerging markets.

title: Get a Free iPhone 17 Pro From T-Mobile With Trade-in
summary: T-Mobile is offering deals on the new Apple iPhone 17 series, including a free iPhone 17 Pro with an eligible trade-in and a free iPhone 17 with no trade-in required for new customers porting numbers. Customers can also opt to buy an iPhone outright and sign up for a more affordable Metro by T-Mobile plan. The article details plan benefits, trade-in values, and specifications of the newly released iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Air, and iPhone 17 Pro/Pro Max models.

title: 'TopGun' ETF Outperforms S&P 500
summary: The Brendan Wood TopGun ETF (BWTG), advised by Tuttle Capital Management CEO and CIO Matthew Tuttle, has outperformed the S&P 500 since November 2023. This ETF is comprised of the top 25 companies that a survey of thousands of money managers and financial advisors have the highest conviction to own over the next year. Notably, it includes companies like Transdigm and Royal Bank of Canada, while excluding Apple and Tesla due to waning institutional interest.

title: Internet of Things and Devices Poised for Edge AI-Driven Upgrades
summary: The article discusses the significant impact of edge AI on the Internet of Things (IoT) and consumer devices, highlighting its role in driving upgrades and innovation. It emphasizes that on-device AI reduces costs, latency, improves personalization and privacy, and enables real-time processing, making it crucial for everyday applications. The piece also details how generative AI will fuel smartphone upgrade cycles, with companies like Apple and Samsung at the forefront, and how various industries such as wearables, industrial IoT, and autonomous vehicles are set to benefit.

title: Global Equity Surge Propels iShares MSCI World ETF to New Heights
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is experiencing a significant rally due to strong performance in developed international stock markets, particularly driven by dominant U.S. technology corporations. The ETF, which uses physical replication and has a significant overweighting in the United States and the technology sector, benefits from robust corporate earnings and structural growth trends like AI. This performance is largely attributed to major technology firms, often called the "Magnificent Seven," whose projected substantial profit growth fuels optimism for diversified ETFs tracking developed markets.

title: Apple Stock at Record Highs: Buy, Sell, or Hold Ahead of Q4 Earnings?
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) is set to release its Q4 earnings, with its stock recently hitting an all-time high due to strong iPhone sales. Despite consistent outperformance, the stock has often closed lower after earnings reports in the past four quarters due to lofty expectations and potential profit-taking. While strong iPhone and Services revenue growth is anticipated, concerns about competitive headwinds in China and the stock's high valuation (33.5 times forward earnings) suggest caution for investors.

title: How ‘Bout Them Apples? As AAPL Stock Flies, This Option Strategy Can Help You Squeeze Out Even More Juice.
summary: This article discusses option strategies for Apple (AAPL) stock, noting its significant historical growth and recent volatility. It specifically details how investors can use a "married put option" or a "collar strategy" to protect against downside risk while seeking to optimize returns, especially in a low volatility environment. The author provides examples using specific strike prices and expiration dates to illustrate how these strategies can be applied.

title: Leveraged ETFs for Nvidia, Tesla, and Apple Stock: Here's Everything You Always Wanted to Know, but Were Too Afraid to Ask
summary: This article examines leveraged single-name ETFs, specifically those for stocks like Nvidia, Tesla, and Apple, explaining how they amplify daily returns. It cautions long-term investors against these products due to their design for short-term trading, high expense ratios, and the inherent risks associated with leverage, advocating instead for low-cost index funds. The piece highlights that these ETFs are not designed for periods longer than a day and do not guarantee their stated objectives.

title: Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (Sept 2025)
summary: This article provides a detailed stock price prediction and forecast for Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX) from 2025 to 2030, highlighting key drivers such as content success, gaming, live events, and advertising. It analyzes Netflix's past performance, including its IPO and growth, and offers specific price targets based on revenue, net income, and P/E multiples. The author projects significant upside for the stock, with a potential stock split before the end of the decade.

title: ACSI: A Compelling Thesis Doesn’t Make A Good Investment. (BATS:ACSI)
summary: The article discusses the American Customer Satisfaction ETF (ACSI), highlighting its strategy of investing in companies with high customer satisfaction and retention. Despite a compelling thesis, ACSI has underperformed the Russell 1000 index and various style ETFs since its inception in 2016, a situation exacerbated by its high expense ratio and weak liquidity. The ETF is noted for being concentrated in its top holdings, particularly in consumer discretionary and communication sectors.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Ameriprise Financial Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has reduced its holding in Ameriprise Financial Inc. by 23.77%, selling over 1.49 million shares at $491.25 each. Despite this reduction, Ameriprise Financial still represents 5% of JPMorgan's total holdings. This move reflects JPMorgan's ongoing portfolio management, while Ameriprise Financial, a diversified financial services provider with over $1 trillion in managed assets, maintains a strong financial outlook and is considered fairly valued.

title: Microsoft: Q3 Earnings Were Flawless, Stock Is A Buy (MSFT)
summary: Microsoft reported strong fiscal Q1 '26 results, exceeding revenue and EPS expectations, yet its stock experienced a 3% dip post-earnings. The company's business productivity and cloud segments showed significant year-over-year growth, with accelerated Azure growth defying maturation concerns. Despite recent stock gains, MSFT is considered a compelling long-term buy due to strong segment performance and positive guidance.

title: Major Stock Sell-Offs by Corning Executives!
summary: Corning (GLW) executives recently conducted significant stock sell-offs, with retired President Eric Musser selling 100,000 shares for over $9 million and Senior Vice President Stefan Becker selling 12,100 shares for over $1.1 million. This insider activity follows a strong third-quarter performance for Corning in 2025, driven by growth in Optical Communications and strategic partnerships. title: AAON (AAON) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of AAON (AAON), a heating and cooling solutions company, fell 3.7% after market expectations indicated a significant year-over-year decline in earnings for its upcoming report. While revenues are projected to increase, the anticipated 47.6% drop in quarterly earnings per share worried investors, leading to a sell-off. The stock is down 16.6% year-to-date and 30.1% from its 52-week high.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Adjusts Holdings in CMS Energy Corp
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has reduced its holdings in CMS Energy Corp by over 2.3 million shares, a transaction valued at $73.26 per share. This adjustment leaves JPMorgan with 18.44 million shares, representing 6.10% of its portfolio. title: Unlocking 68% Yield: Deep Dive into the YieldMax AMD Option Income Strategy ETF (AMDY)
summary: The article delves into the YieldMax AMD Option Income Strategy ETF (AMDY), highlighting its 68% annualized yield primarily from option premiums rather than direct AMD share ownership. While offering high income and tax efficiency through return-of-capital distributions, AMDY has significantly underperformed AMD's share gains and the S&P 500 due to its capped upside and uncapped downside. It is recommended for income-focused portfolios with a bullish long-term view on AMD's AI growth, but with a caution on substantial capital returns lagging equity performance.

title: GigaCloud (GCT): Icebery LTD sells $508k in shares
summary: Icebery LTD, an officer of GigaCloud Technology Inc (NASDAQ:GCT), sold 16,939 Class A Ordinary Shares for a total of $508,395 on October 29, 2025. This transaction was executed under a pre-arranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Xinyan Hao, GigaCloud's COO, is the sole shareholder of Icebery LTD.

title: BBEU: A Diversified Europe ETF With Double-Digit Growth Potential

Despite these advantages, BBEU generally underperforms the S&P 500 due to its limited technology exposure, higher defensive sector weighting, and currency fluctuations, making it better suited for diversification than as a core holding. The ETF also faces higher downside risk during market corrections due to these currency impacts.

title: SIXG: 5G/6G Play With High Risk, High Reward
summary: The article analyzes the Defiance Connective Technologies ETF (SIXG) as a high-risk, high-reward investment for exposure to 5G and 6G technologies crucial for the AI revolution. It details SIXG's strategy change in 2024, its holdings in companies like Apple and NVIDIA, and demonstrates its strong performance in bull markets contrasting with significant drawdowns in bear markets. The ETF is positioned as a satellite holding for growth-oriented investors, emphasizing the importance of understanding its high valuation and volatility risks.

title: Alphabet Stock Skyrockets on AI Frenzy – Is $300 Next?
summary: Alphabet's Class A shares (GOOGL) soared to $274.6, marking a 30% year-to-date increase, fueled by strong Q3 2025 results and aggressive AI investments. The company reported $102.3 billion in revenue and $2.87 GAAP EPS, driven by revived Search and YouTube ad sales and a booming Google Cloud segment. Analysts are largely bullish, with many predicting the stock could reach $300, despite ongoing regulatory challenges.

title: Is iShares MSCI USA Quality GARP ETF (GARP) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: This article evaluates the iShares MSCI USA Quality GARP ETF (GARP), a smart beta ETF that debuted in 2020. The article also suggests alternative ETFs for investors looking at the Style Box - All Cap Growth segment.

title: Zhihu Inc. to Report Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results on November 25, 2025
summary: Zhihu Inc. will announce its unaudited financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, before the U.S. market opens on November 25, 2025. The company's management will host a conference call on the same day to discuss the results, with pre-registration required for participants. A live and archived webcast of the call will be available on Zhihu's investor relations website.

title: Decoding Garmin Ltd (GRMN): A Strategic SWOT Insight
summary: Garmin Ltd (GRMN) shows strong financial performance with a 12% increase in net sales, attributed to its brand and product diversification across various sectors. Opportunities lie in expanding into emerging markets and leveraging advancements in wearable technology to maintain its market leadership.

title: Teradyne Is a Wide-Moat Chip Testing Provider With Increasing AI Upside
summary: Teradyne is identified as a wide-moat chip testing provider with increasing upside from AI demand. The company is a market leader in automated test equipment for semiconductors, maintaining strong relationships with major chipmakers like Apple and Taiwan Semiconductor. title: Corning Inc. Reports Strong Q3 2025 Results
summary: Corning Inc. reported strong Q3 2025 results with a 14% increase in core sales and a 24% rise in core EPS year-over-year.
