Other prominent figures like Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and billionaire Ray Dalio have also expressed similar concerns regarding a potential AI bubble.

title: ASML's stock price is dropping today after the semiconductor giant issued this critical warning about 2026
summary: ASML's stock price dropped significantly after the company reported Q2 2025 results that beat expectations but issued a cautious outlook for 2026. CEO Christophe Fouquet stated that while they prepare for growth in 2026, they cannot confirm it due to increasing uncertainties from macroeconomic and geopolitical developments, including potential tariffs. This warning overshadowed strong financial performance and a 15% growth forecast for 2025, leading to a premarket stock decline.

title: Meet the new Nextdoor: more useful, more helpful, and more timely
summary: Nextdoor Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KIND) has released a significant redesign of its platform, focusing on three core features: Alerts, News, and Faves. This update aims to make the Nextdoor experience more useful, helpful, and timely for its 100 million-plus users. The redesign includes real-time alerts for safety and preparedness, integrated local news from trusted sources, and an AI-powered "Faves" feature for personalized recommendations.

title: MP Materials and Apple Announce $500 Million Partnership to Produce Recycled Rare Earth Magnets in the United States
summary: MP Materials announced a $500 million long-term partnership with Apple to supply rare earth magnets made from 100 percent recycled materials. This agreement will enable MP Materials to expand its Fort Worth, Texas, factory and establish a dedicated recycling line at its Mountain Pass site, providing Apple with domestically sourced magnets for its products starting in 2027. The collaboration aims to strengthen U.S. manufacturing, advance circular supply chains, and reduce waste by recovering rare earth elements from recycled materials.

title: US stock market future slips as Trump’s 30% tariffs rattle global trade; Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq dip while Bo
summary: US stock futures slipped after President Donald Trump announced 30% tariffs on imports from the EU and Mexico, beginning August 1st, stoking global trade tensions. Investors are also closely watching second-quarter earnings reports from major banks, upcoming inflation data, and the growing rift between Trump and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Despite the market dip, Boeing saw gains while Apple and Tesla slid, and Bitcoin hit a new record high.

title: Should You Be Impressed By 3 E Network Technology Group Limited's (NASDAQ:MASK) ROE?
summary: This article analyzes the Return On Equity (ROE) of 3 E Network Technology Group Limited (NASDAQ:MASK), highlighting its impressive 51% ROE compared to the IT industry average of 11%. The company's low debt-to-equity ratio of 0.023 further suggests high business quality and effective use of capital without excessive leverage. While ROE is a key metric, the report advises considering other factors like profit growth rates and stock valuation.

title: XYLD: A Blend Of Ultra-High Yield And AI-Driven Growth (NYSEARCA:XYLD)
summary: The article discusses the Global X S&P 500 Covered Call ETF (XYLD), highlighting its ultra-high yield of 13% and significant exposure to AI and technology trends through major holdings like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple. It suggests XYLD is suitable for income-focused investors seeking growth with S&P 500 diversification and a strong tech tilt, emphasizing its long track record since 2013.

title: Cathie Wood Continues To Back Tesla As Investors Panic Amid Elon Musk's Return To Politics: Calls Robotaxi Bet A Trillion-Dollar Opportunity
summary: Cathie Wood of ARK Invest continues to support Tesla Inc. despite investor panic over Elon Musk's return to politics, reiterating her $2,600 price target, driven by Robotaxis and Optimus. Conversely, Wood has exited her position in Apple Inc. due to slower growth and concerns about its AI strategy following a key executive's departure. Wood has also lauded Tesla as the "largest AI project on earth" and Musk as the "most productive human being," while Apple struggles with its AI race.

title: EchoStar (SATS) CLO Dean Manson sells $825k in shares
summary: EchoStar's Chief Legal Officer, Dean Manson, sold 25,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for $825,000 at a price of $33 per share, near the stock's 52-week high. Prior to this sale, Manson exercised options to acquire the same number of shares at a lower price. This transaction comes amidst significant financial and regulatory challenges for EchoStar, including missed interest payments and an ongoing FCC review of its 5G network buildout.

title: 4 Charts on Nvidia’s Record $4 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Nvidia has achieved a record-breaking $4 trillion market capitalization, becoming the first company to reach this valuation thanks to the booming demand for AI hardware and software. Shares of the semiconductor giant have rocketed 280% over the past two years, largely outperforming the broader market and other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple. Despite new competition, Morningstar analysts believe Nvidia will remain dominant in the AI market, with the company currently rated as fairly valued.

title: Apple, Visa and Mastercard win dismissal of merchant antitrust lawsuit over payment fees
summary: A U.S. judge has dismissed a merchant antitrust lawsuit accusing Apple, Visa, and Mastercard of conspiring to suppress competition in the payments network market and causing inflated transaction fees. The judge ruled that the plaintiffs did not provide enough evidence but allowed them to amend their lawsuit. The lawsuit alleged that Visa and Mastercard paid Apple to prevent it from launching a competing payment network.

title: Apple, Visa, and Mastercard win dismissal of merchant antitrust lawsuit over payment fees
summary: A U.S. judge dismissed an antitrust lawsuit against Apple, Visa, and Mastercard, which alleged they colluded to stifle competition in the payments network market and inflated merchant fees. The judge found insufficient evidence that Apple unlawfully refused to launch a competing payment network. However, the merchants were given the opportunity to amend their lawsuit to strengthen their claims.

title: Agena Joel, general counsel at Playstudios, sells $14k in shares
summary: Playstudios' General Counsel, Agena Joel, sold 11,489 shares of company stock for $14,131, at an average price of $1.23 per share. This transaction was executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The company (NASDAQ: MYPS) has a market cap of $159 million, is trading at 0.65 times book value, and has a current ratio of 3.6.

title: Should Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, with over $1.05 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.16%. It holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and has shown strong performance, returning 7.89% year-to-date and 14.09% over the last year. The fund's top holdings include major tech companies like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple, primarily focusing on the Information Technology sector.

title: Nvidia's $4 trillion milestone caps rise of stock market behemoth
summary: Nvidia Corp reached a $4 trillion market valuation, highlighting its significant importance in the stock market and the technology sector, driven by a massive surge in its stock price since late 2022. This milestone gives Nvidia the largest weight in the S&P 500 and reflects the growing influence of tech companies, which now comprise one-third of the S&P 500's market value. Other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple are also nearing or exceeding the $3 trillion mark, underscoring the dominance of technology in current market valuations.

title: IVV Is a Great Choice for Most, but I Like SPLG ETF Better
summary: This article compares two S&P 500 tracking ETFs, IVV (iShares Core S&P 500 ETF) and SPLG (SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF), highlighting that both are excellent, low-cost options for investors. While their holdings are nearly identical, the author prefers SPLG due to its slightly lower expense ratio (0.02% vs. 0.03% for IVV) and more efficient bid-ask spread. The article reinforces Warren Buffett's support for low-cost index funds as a sound investment strategy.

title: Christopher D. Brown Joins 908 Devices’ Board
summary: Christopher D. Brown, co-founder of 908 Devices Inc., has been appointed to the company's board of directors. Brown previously served as the company's chief technology officer and vice president of Research & Development, and most recently as chief product officer until Repligen Corporation acquired 908 Devices’ bioprocessing portfolio. His extensive experience in advanced analytical technologies and innovation will be a valuable asset to the board.

title: Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
summary: Nvidia briefly achieved an intraday market capitalization of $4 trillion on Wednesday, making it the first U.S. company to reach this milestone. Although its stock pulled back to close just below the $4 trillion mark, Nvidia still set a new record for the highest closing market cap ever at $3.974 trillion, surpassing Apple's previous record. The company's stock touched $164.42 intraday but ended the day at $162.88, slightly below the $163.93 needed to close above the $4 trillion threshold.

title: Nvidia becomes first company to reach $4tn in market value
summary: Nvidia has become the first public company in history to achieve a $4tn market valuation, with its stock price rising roughly 2.4% to $164. This significant milestone is attributed to the ongoing surge in demand for artificial intelligence technologies, where Nvidia's chips and software are considered industry leaders. The company's market value has more than tripled in about a year, outpacing giants like Apple and Microsoft in growth speed.

title: Nvidia becomes first company to hit $4 trillion valuation
summary: Nvidia became the first company to reach a $4 trillion valuation, momentarily surpassing Apple's previous record, driven by surging demand for its AI chips. Despite closing slightly shy of $4 trillion, the milestone highlights its explosive growth and central role in the AI revolution, even as it navigates challenges like Chinese export restrictions. The company has seen its market value climb significantly in recent years, outranking other tech giants like Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta.

title: Procter & Gamble Stock Price Forecast PG Surges to $150.37 After Earnings Beat,Upside Toward $171
summary: The article focuses on the OMAH ETF, which offers a 14.88% annualized yield by combining 20 of Berkshire Hathaway's largest equity stakes with an active covered call strategy. Despite its short track record, OMAH has outperformed BRK.B and maintained capital stability during volatile periods. The fund targets income-seeking investors, balancing high yield with a diversified, defensively tilted portfolio.

title: Nvidia becomes first US company to reach $4 trillion market cap
summary: Nvidia has become the first public company globally to achieve a $4 trillion market capitalization, driven by soaring demand for artificial intelligence technologies. This milestone solidifies its position as a top-performing stock, surpassing Apple and Microsoft in market value growth speed. The company's impressive financial performance and market weight on the S&P 500 highlight Wall Street's confidence in the future of AI.

title: Leawood’s Town Center Crossing and Town Center Plaza shopping centers get new owners
summary: Federal Realty Investment Trust has acquired Leawood's Town Center Plaza and Town Center Crossing shopping centers, marking their first Midwest purchase. The Bethesda, Maryland-based company, which primarily operates on the East and West coasts, plans long-term investment and upgrades for the combined 730,000 square feet of retail space. Leawood city leaders welcomed the new owners, expressing excitement for potential improvements and new brands, especially considering the shopping centers' previous owner declared bankruptcy in 2021.

title: Garmin smartwatches add turn-by-turn directions with Google Maps
summary: Garmin has announced that the Google Maps app is now available for free in the Connect IQ Store, bringing turn-by-turn directions to compatible Garmin smartwatches. This new feature allows users to receive navigation prompts directly on their wrist while walking, running, or cycling, keeping their hands free and phone safely in their pocket. The integration also enables fitness enthusiasts to track their activities alongside navigation, syncing data to other health and fitness apps.

title: VGT ETF Explained: Is It the Best Tech Investment Today?
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT), evaluating its framework, effectiveness, and potential risks as a tech investment. It details VGT's holdings, performance against the S&P 500, and compares it to other popular tech ETFs like XLK, QQQ, and FTEC. The piece concludes that VGT is a strong candidate for a core tech holding in a growth-oriented portfolio due to its diversified, low-cost structure and alignment with innovation, despite its inherent volatility.

title: This Is Why I Would Buy SPXL
summary: The Direxion Daily S&P 500 Bull 3X Shares ETF (SPXL) offers triple-magnified exposure to the S&P 500, making it an attractive option for investors seeking aggressive growth. While highly volatile due to its leverage and daily rebalancing, the author suggests SPXL can be used safely by limiting its allocation in a portfolio and balancing it with un-leveraged ETFs like SPY. The article highlights SPXL's historical performance, quarterly dividends, and the importance of using it cautiously within a diversified strategy.

title: IWB ETF: Understanding the Russell 1000 ETF
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) offers comprehensive exposure to the 1,000 largest US companies, tracking the Russell 1000 Index. With over $41 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.15%, IWB provides diversification and solid long-term performance, making it suitable for core holdings and tactical trading strategies. EBC Financial Group also offers ETF CFD trading for leveraged exposure to funds like IWB.

title: App Store Fee Cuts Set To Boost Duolingo, Match, Bumble Earnings
summary: Bank of America Securities analyst Curtis Nagle predicts that reduced App Store fees, stemming from legal setbacks for Apple and the EU’s Digital Markets Act, could significantly boost the earnings of Duolingo, Match Group, and Bumble. These fee reductions, currently a major cost of revenue for these companies, are not yet fully priced into their valuations. Nagle estimates that a shift to off-app payments and cuts in app store fees could notably increase their EBITDA, particularly for Bumble in the U.S. market.

title: Expensify stock rating reiterated by JMP amid international expansion
summary: JMP has reiterated its Market Perform rating on Expensify Inc (NASDAQ: EXFY) following the company's expanded international support and despite a year-to-date stock decline and a recent earnings miss. The company is actively repurchasing shares, investing in AI, and leveraging a Formula 1 movie sponsorship, showing confidence in its growth and cash-generating capabilities. Analysts are monitoring the impact of macroeconomic factors and competitive developments in the expense management sector.

title: New Wells Fargo Study Shows Parents Give Their Kids an Average Weekly Allowance of $37
summary: A new Wells Fargo study reveals that 71% of parents with children ages 5-17 provide an average weekly allowance of $37. Despite this, 51% of parents struggle to teach their children about money, with many finding it difficult to let them learn from financial mistakes. The study also highlights a shift towards digital payment methods for allowances, even as cash remains widely used.

title: Short Tesla? Try CRSH for a Huge Yield Instead.
summary: This article suggests an alternative to directly shorting Tesla's stock (NASDAQ: TSLA) due to its high risk. It introduces Tidal's YieldMax Short TSLA Option Income Strategy ETF (NYSEMKT: CRSH), which aims to profit from Tesla's declines while generating income through options. Although CRSH boasts a high distribution rate, a significant portion comes from return of capital (ROC) rather than actual income, resulting in a low SEC yield and NAV decay.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Once Predicted That This Technology Would Replace Your Phone — A Decade Later, How Far Is Meta From Delivering On A 'More Natural' Future
summary: Mark Zuckerberg's 2015 prediction that virtual and augmented reality would replace mobile phones is revisited, nearly a decade later. The article examines Meta's progress and challenges in achieving this vision, detailing investments in Quest headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses, along with financial performance and competition from Apple, Google, and Samsung. Despite substantial losses in Reality Labs, Meta continues to invest in AR/VR, while also facing struggles like the discontinuation of the Quest Pro.

title: IWF ETF: The Smart Way to Access US Growth Stocks
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) provides investors with a diversified way to invest in large-cap US growth stocks, tracking the Russell 1000 Growth Index. Managed by BlackRock, it focuses on companies with strong earnings growth and high return on equity, primarily in technology and consumer discretionary sectors. With substantial AUM, low expense ratio, and a strong performance track record, IWF is a compelling option for long-term growth-focused investors, despite its sector concentration and higher volatility.

title: APLY vs. SCHD: Apple’s Mega Yield ETF or Dividend Aristocrat Power
summary: This article compares two ETFs, YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF (APLY) and Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD), for passive income investors. APLY offers a significantly higher yield through an options trading strategy focused on Apple, but comes with higher risks and capped upside. SCHD, conversely, provides more reliable, lower-risk income through diversification across mature dividend-paying companies.

title: IVE ETF: How It Tracks the S&P 500 Value Index
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) is a popular choice for investors seeking exposure to large-cap US value stocks. This article explains how IVE tracks the S&P 500 Value Index using a passive, full replication strategy with periodic rebalancing, highlighting its cost-efficiency and diversification benefits. Key features, top holdings, and performance data are provided to assist traders in understanding its role in portfolio construction.

title: It’s official: T-Mobile has the best network in America
summary: T-Mobile has officially been named the best mobile network in America by Ookla, a global leader in connectivity intelligence, marking a significant milestone after 12 years of investment and innovation. The company is celebrating by launching its T-Satellite service commercially on July 23rd, offering satellite-to-mobile connectivity, and providing a free year of DashPass by DoorDash to most of its customers starting July 8th. T-Mobile is also introducing an "Easy Upgrade" program to entice AT&T and Verizon customers to switch to its network.

title: Playstudios's agena sells $57,576 in stock By Investing.com
summary: Joel Agena, General Counsel at Playstudios, Inc., sold 40,980 shares of Class A Common Stock for a total of $57,576 in two transactions on June 20 and June 23, 2025. These sales were executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. Despite the insider sale, PlayStudios has recently received analyst upgrades from Craig-Hallum and Benchmark, citing optimism for new product offerings and a strong balance sheet.

title: Duolingo director hacker sells $4.7m in stock
summary: Severin Hacker, Duolingo's Chief Tech Officer and Director, sold 9,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $4.7 million on June 20, 2025, while also exercising options to acquire 10,000 shares. This comes as Duolingo's stock experienced a decline due to Apple's new Live Translation feature, though analysts like JPMorgan, DA Davidson, and Scotiabank have raised price targets citing strong user growth and monetization strategies.

title: IWF Is a Great Choice for Most, But I Like VUG ETF Better
summary: The article compares two growth-focused ETFs, the iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) and the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG). While both offer similar top holdings, VUG is favored due to its significantly lower expense ratio and historically better returns across most periods. The author recommends VUG for investors seeking to add growth to their portfolios due to its cost-efficiency and superior performance.

title: Texas Instruments plans to invest $60B in semiconductor fabs
summary: Texas Instruments announced plans to invest over $60 billion in seven semiconductor fabrication plants across Texas and Utah, marking one of the largest investments in the sector. This investment will significantly increase U.S. manufacturing capacity for 300mm chips, supported by $1.6 billion in funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, and will create more than 60,000 new jobs. The new fabs will produce chips for major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, and Nvidia, enhancing the country's position in advanced semiconductor technology.

title: Texas Instruments to Put $60 Billion Toward Semiconductor Manufacturing in North Texas
summary: Texas Instruments plans to invest over $60 billion in semiconductor manufacturing, establishing "mega-sites" in Sherman, Richardson, and Lehi, Utah, which is expected to create over 60,000 jobs. This investment is supported by the Trump administration to boost American manufacturing and involves partnerships with major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, NVIDIA, and SpaceX. Additionally, the article covers BGSF's sale of its professional division for $99 million and the upcoming opening of Flight Club, a social entertainment concept, in Addison.

title: Accenture is worst-performing stock in the S&P 500 on Friday
summary: Accenture became the worst-performing stock in the S&P 500 on Friday, despite reporting strong revenue and profits, along with optimistic guidance. The decline was attributed to investors' concerns over a 6% decrease in third-quarter bookings, which totaled $19.7 billion. Shares of Accenture PLC Class A were down 8.2% and on pace for their biggest drop since March 2024, having fallen 20% year-to-date.

title: Forget Monthly Dividends, These 5 ETFs Pay Investors Every Week
summary: This article highlights several ETFs that offer weekly dividend payments, catering to investors seeking regular income. It details specific ETFs like AAPL WeeklyPay (AAPW), NVDA WeeklyPay (NVDW), PLTR WeeklyPay (PLTW), TSLA WeeklyPay (TSLW), and the Weekly T-Bill ETF (WEEK), outlining their expense ratios, distribution rates, and underlying investments, which often include swap agreements and major tech stocks. The article also mentions the YieldMax AI & Tech Portfolio Option Income ETF (GPTY) as another option for weekly income.

title: Texas Instruments Partners With Apple, NVIDIA in Historic $60B US Semiconductor Expansion
summary: Texas Instruments (TXN) announced a historic investment of over $60 billion in seven U.S. semiconductor fabs across three mega-sites in Texas and Utah. This expansion, the largest of its kind in U.S. history, will create more than 60,000 U.S. jobs and produce foundational analog and embedded processing chips essential for various electronic devices. TI has also strengthened partnerships with major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, NVIDIA, and SpaceX, showcasing a commitment to securing domestic supply chains and advancing American innovation.

title: Should iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Value segment of the US equity market, launched in 2000 and managed by Blackrock with over $38 billion in assets. The ETF primarily invests in Information Technology, Financials, and Healthcare sectors, with Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon as top holdings, offering diversification and medium risk.

title: Tech Tactically Trimmed: Why I'm Holding MAGS But With Caution
summary: The author remains bullish on big tech long-term but advises caution due to current Magnificent 7 valuations and macro headwinds. While the MAGS ETF offers a unique hybrid structure, its performance can be replicated with a DIY approach. Valuations are stretched for some names, but Microsoft, Google, Apple, and Amazon still show upside potential, leading the author to rate MAGS a Hold, preferring QQQ for now.

title: Texas Instruments injects $60B into U.S. chip manufacturing
summary: Texas Instruments announced a $60 billion plan to bolster domestic semiconductor manufacturing across seven facilities in Utah and Texas, marking the largest effort by a single U.S. company. This investment aims to create a domestic supply chain for chips used in various electronics and is expected to generate 60,000 new U.S. jobs through partnerships with companies like Nvidia, Apple, Ford, and SpaceX. While the initiative is substantial for the semiconductor supply, industry analysts note that realizing gains from increased manufacturing will take time.

title: Texas Instruments commits $60B to domestic chip manufacturing
summary: Texas Instruments plans to invest over $60 billion in domestic chip manufacturing, building seven fabrication facilities across Texas and Utah. This initiative, supported by $1.6 billion in CHIPS Act funding, aims to produce foundational semiconductors for major tech and automotive companies like Apple, Ford, and Nvidia. The investment addresses rising compute demand driven by AI adoption and geopolitical considerations to boost U.S. chip production.

title: Apple supplier Jabil plans $500M venture for AI infrastructure
summary: Jabil, an electronics component maker and Apple supplier, is investing $500 million over the next several years to expand its cloud and artificial intelligence data center infrastructure in the Southeastern U.S. This investment includes large-scale production facilities expected to be operational by mid-2026. The move aligns with similar U.S. infrastructure investments by tech giants like Apple, Nvidia, and Foxconn, aimed at strengthening domestic manufacturing and diversifying Jabil's commercial portfolio to meet surging AI infrastructure demand.

title: Big movements in NuCana plc stock price on Wednesday moving 32.83% between high and low
summary: The NuCana plc (NCNA) stock price surged by 14.98% on Wednesday, June 11, 2025, continuing a four-day gaining streak. Despite a positive short-term Moving Average signal and a recent pivot bottom buy signal, the stock faces a general sell signal from its long-term Moving Average and is considered extremely overbought on RSI14. Analysts from William Blair downgraded NCNA to "Market Perform" in August 2024, and the stock is anticipated to perform weakly in the near future due to high volatility and conflicting technical signals.

title: How to Buy Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO)
summary: This guide details how to invest in the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), one of the largest and most popular ETFs, known for its low expense ratio (0.03%) and its goal to match the S&P 500 index returns. It covers VOO's holdings, reasons to invest or not invest, its dividend payments, and historical performance. The article also provides a step-by-step guide to buying shares through a brokerage account.

title: This Gen X CEO runs Eventbrite, the ticketing platform that has sold over two billion tickets—she loves Legos, hypnotherapy, and skin-care gadgets
summary: This article profiles Julia Hartz, co-founder and CEO of Eventbrite, detailing her career trajectory from MTV and FX to leading a global ticketing platform. It explores her personal interests, financial habits, and work-life balance while managing a successful company and raising four daughters. The piece offers a glimpse into how a C-suite executive spends her time and money outside of work, including her love for Legos, hypnotherapy, and innovative skin-care gadgets.

title: What Are Equal-Weight Index Funds?
summary: Equal-weight index funds hold assets in identical proportions, differing from cap-weighted funds that prioritize larger companies. While they offer benefits like reduced concentration risk and a value-minded approach, they tend to have higher expense ratios and can be more volatile. Despite underperforming cap-weighted funds in recent years due to the dominance of mega-cap tech stocks, equal-weighting can be attractive to investors concerned about over-concentration in large companies.

title: Why Investors Shouldn't Be Surprised By Liberty Global Ltd.'s (NASDAQ:LBTY.A) Low P/S
summary: Liberty Global Ltd. (NASDAQ:LBTY.A) has a low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.8x compared to the industry average of 1.4x, which might signal a buying opportunity. However, this low P/S is attributed to analyst forecasts of limited future revenue growth (1.9% per annum) that significantly underperform the broader telecom industry's anticipated 102% annual expansion, making investors unwilling to pay a higher premium for the stock. While recent revenue growth has been strong, historical three-year performance showed a significant decline, contributing to the cautious market sentiment.

title: Qualcomm to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4B
summary: Qualcomm has agreed to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4 billion, aiming to strengthen its position in the artificial intelligence and data center markets. This acquisition is part of Qualcomm's broader strategy to enhance its product capabilities for next-generation technologies and expand into new markets. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 2026 and will provide Qualcomm with Alphawave's high-speed connectivity and compute silicon assets.

title: Serviços Apple oferecem recursos poderosos e atualizações inteligentes ainda este ano
summary: A Apple anunciou uma série de novos recursos e atualizações inteligentes para seus serviços, que serão lançados com o iOS 26 e outros sistemas operacionais ainda este ano. As novidades incluem AutoMix no Apple Music, rotas favoritas e Locais Visitados no Mapas da Apple, rastreamento de pedidos com Apple Intelligence na Carteira da Apple, e a introdução da Identidade digital. Essas atualizações visam tornar o dia a dia dos usuários mais prático, divertido e personalizado.

title: XOVR ETF Adds Anduril, Joining SpaceX to Offer Pre-IPO Access
summary: ERShares, through its XOVR ETF, has added Anduril Industries as a new private equity position, offering retail investors access to pre-IPO companies. This move follows previous investments in SpaceX and Klarna, with Anduril becoming the second-largest private holding for XOVR. The ETF aims to provide diversified, liquid access to high-growth public companies and elite pre-IPO firms, leveraging a proprietary research model to identify category-defining companies.

title: MSTY vs. SPYI: Insane Dividend Yields or Tax-Smart Income—Which Wins?
summary: This article compares two dividend ETFs, MSTY and SPYI, for passive income investors. MSTY offers an astounding 94.37% distribution rate but has a higher expense ratio and is tied to MicroStrategy stock, while SPYI provides more diversification, a lower expense ratio, tax advantages, and a 12.5% distribution rate. The choice between them depends on an investor's tolerance for volatility, tax considerations, and preference for ultra-high yield versus diversified, steady income.

title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
summary: This article highlights two ETFs, the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (XT) and Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), as promising long-term investments for growth investors. XT diversifies across global innovation leaders with a modest expense ratio, while QQQ tracks the top 100 non-financial Nasdaq stocks, offering higher concentration in influential tech giants like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple. Both ETFs are presented as "buy and forget" options for potentially market-beating returns.

title: GlobalFoundries Announces $16B U.S. Investment to Reshore Essential Chip Manufacturing and Accelerate AI Growth
summary: GlobalFoundries (GF) announced a $16 billion investment to expand its semiconductor manufacturing and advanced packaging capabilities across its facilities in New York and Vermont. This strategic investment is backed by major tech companies like Apple, SpaceX, AMD, Qualcomm, NXP, and GM, and aims to reshore essential chip manufacturing to the U.S., accelerating innovation in AI-enabling and power-efficient technologies. The investment supports the explosive growth in AI and strengthens the domestic semiconductor supply chain and leadership.

title: Alumni Spotlight: Kate Pytlewski
summary: This article spotlights Kate Pytlewski, VP, Deputy General Counsel at EPAM Systems, Inc., highlighting her career progression from an associate at Faegre Drinker to her current leadership role. She discusses the challenges and rewards of in-house counsel work, particularly navigating global crises, and reflects on her positive experiences and mentorship at Faegre Drinker. Pytlewski also shares her thoughts on artificial intelligence in the legal industry and her personal interests and future plans.

title: Should SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The article analyzes the SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), highlighting its suitability for investors seeking exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market. It details the ETF's low expense ratio, sector allocation (heavily in Information Technology), top holdings like Microsoft, Apple, and Meta, and its performance and risk profile. The article concludes that QUS is a good option for specific market exposure and suggests alternatives like SPY and VOO.

title: Is iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The article analyzes the iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN), highlighting its performance, risk profile, and smart beta strategy. It details the fund's expense ratio, top holdings, and year-to-date gains, concluding that it's a reasonable option for investors in the World ETFs segment. The article also suggests alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: Will the MAG 7 Stocks Continue to Lead the Stock Market?
summary: The article discusses the continued influence of the "Magnificent Seven" (MAG 7) stocks—Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla—on the US stock market. It highlights their market capitalization leadership and their resilience following a market correction caused by tariff fears. The author suggests that the MAGS ETF offers a diversified way to invest in these leading technology companies and expects them to maintain their market leadership.

title: Why This High-Yield, 12% Dividend ETF Is a Must-Own Stock
summary: The NEOS S&P 500 High Income ETF (SPYI) offers investors a unique blend of potential share-price appreciation tied to the S&P 500, a high monthly dividend yield of over 12% generated through options strategies, and favorable tax treatment on capital gains. This combination makes it a compelling option for investors seeking both income and growth, particularly for those looking to leverage compounding and minimize short-term capital gains taxes. The ETF achieves its high income by investing in S&P 500 components and selling covered call options.

title: Better Dividend Growth ETF: Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF or iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF
summary: This article compares two prominent dividend growth ETFs: the Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) and the iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF (DGRO). It details their different index tracking methodologies, top holdings, expense ratios, and historical performance to help investors decide which fund is better suited for their dividend growth strategy. While DGRO offers a slightly higher yield, VIG boasts a lower expense ratio, making both solid options depending on investor priorities.

title: Maplebear Inc. appoints new CEO and expands share buyback
summary: Maplebear Inc. (Instacart) has announced Chris Rogers as its new CEO and President, effective August 15, 2025, succeeding Fidji Simo, who will remain as Chair of the Board. The company also expanded its share repurchase program authorization to $1 billion from $750 million. These changes come amid positive financial performance and analyst upgrades for the company.

title: Volatility ETFs Spike on Renewed Trump Tariff Threats
summary: Volatility Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) have seen a spike following renewed threats of tariffs from former President Donald Trump on EU goods and imported smartphones. This surge in volatility is also exacerbated by worries over a ballooning U.S. deficit and a Moody's credit rating downgrade. Investors are warned that these volatility products are generally suitable only for short-term traders due to contango issues, but current market conditions may present a temporary opportunity.

title: Canadian Stocks Reached An All-Time High This Week
summary: Canadian stocks have recently hit an all-time high despite prevailing fears of a recession and political uncertainties, driven by strong performances in financial, technology, and defensive sectors. The author emphasizes that rather than attempting to time the market, investors should adhere to a disciplined investment strategy and embrace volatility to build long-term wealth. For stability amidst economic uncertainty, especially for retirees, the article suggests a diversified global portfolio that includes U.S., international, and Canadian equities, focusing on defensive sectors and wide-moat Canadian stocks.

title: 3 Best Inverse ETFs to Profit in a Market Crash
summary: This article outlines three inverse ETFs that investors can use to profit during a market crash: ProShares Short S&P 500 (SH), ProShares Short QQQ (PSQ), and Direxion Daily S&P 500 Bear 3X Shares ETF (SPXS). It explains that inverse ETFs are designed to gain value when a market index declines, offering a way for bearish-leaning investors to mitigate losses or profit in a downturn. The article also highlights the risks associated with these funds, particularly concerning their performance over holding periods longer than a single day.

title: Big Mag 7 Rally Pays Off for QBIG
summary: The Invesco Top QQQ ETF (QBIG), holding Magnificent Seven stocks and Broadcom, has seen a 16% gain in the month ending May 15, outperforming the S&P 500 Growth Index. This rebound is attributed to clearer international trade policy and potential AI advancements, despite the ETF still being in the red year-to-date. A recent thaw in U.S./China trade relations also bodes well for QBIG’s holdings.

title: Should iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB), launched in 2000 by Blackrock, offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market with over $40 billion in assets. With an annual operating expense of 0.15% and a 1.12% trailing dividend yield, it is considered a cost-effective option for investors. IWB has a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and effectively diversifies company-specific risk with approximately 1011 holdings, making it a medium-risk choice for investors.

title: Cell Phone Satisfaction Hits Decade Low Mark as AI Promises Fall Short, ACSI Data Show
summary: User satisfaction with cell phones has dropped to a decade-low of 78, according to the American Customer Satisfaction Index (ACSI), despite new AI features. The study indicates that customers prioritize fundamental aspects like battery life, call reliability, and ease of use over advanced capabilities. This decline extends to wireless phone and internet service providers, with smartwatch satisfaction also sensitive to basic features.

title: Is iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU), launched on April 8, 2022, is a smart beta ETF focused on the Style Box - All Cap Blend category, aiming to align with Paris Agreement objectives through decarbonization and reduced climate-related risks. With over $2.12 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.10%, PABU primarily invests in Information Technology, with Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft as top holdings. The ETF has shown strong performance, up 13.72% over the last year, offering a diversified option for investors in climate-aligned strategies.

title: The Best ETFs for Tech Stock Investors | Morningstar Europe
summary: The technology sector experienced a recovery in early 2025 following a challenging start, driven by positive earnings and a China trade deal. Morningstar identifies seven highly-rated ETFs, including offerings from Xtrackers, iShares, SPDR, and Amundi, that provide investors with exposure to this rebounding sector. These ETFs are highlighted for their potential to outperform, with detailed performance metrics provided for the largest strategies.

title: Here’s Why Every Investor Should Consider Vanguard’s VIG ETF
summary: The Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) is a compelling investment for stability, growth, and income, especially in volatile markets. Launched in 2006, VIG tracks the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index, holding 338 stocks of companies with a decade-long record of dividend increases, excluding high-yield stocks to avoid yield traps. With a low expense ratio of 0.05% and strong performance, VIG offers a diversified, low-cost, and resilient option for investors seeking long-term financial success through dividend growth.

title: Is SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), launched on April 15, 2015, offers exposure to the Style Box - Large Cap Blend category with a smart beta strategy. Managed by State Street Global Advisors, it has over $1.49 billion in assets and seeks to match the performance of the MSCI USA Factor Mix A-Series Index, with an expense ratio of 0.15%. The ETF's top holdings include Apple Inc., Microsoft Corp, and Meta Platforms Inc., and it has shown strong performance, adding 2.29% year-to-date and 11.24% over the last 12 months as of May 13, 2025.

title: Alphabet: Testimony From Apple Search Executive Rattles Investors
summary: Apple's Eddy Cue testified in the DOJ lawsuit against Alphabet, indicating Apple may end its long-term Google Search partnership for Safari. This news caused investor concern, given Google's significant revenue-sharing agreement with Apple. Despite potential changes and AI's impact on search, Morningstar maintains its fair value estimate for Alphabet, believing the market's reaction is overblown and that Google will adapt with AI-infused offerings.

title: Google's parent company Alphabet shares plunge over 8% amid AI search competition, malware threats
summary: Alphabet Inc. shares dropped over 8% following revelations from an antitrust trial, citing increased AI search competition and new malware threats. Apple executive Eddy Cue testified about declining Google search traffic due to AI alternatives and announced future AI choices in Safari. Google also disclosed a new malware strain, LOSTKEYS, linked to a Russian hacking group, and partnered with Elementl Power to build nuclear plants to power AI data centers, addressing the anticipated surge in electricity usage.

title: Will Macroeconomic Shocks Lead To Business Cycle Recession?
summary: James Kostohryz discusses how individual investors can achieve alpha through asset allocation, particularly by avoiding bear markets and re-entering at favorable valuations. He identifies three major shocks facing the U.S. economy: trade war tariffs, fiscal spending cuts, and labor supply shocks due to reduced immigration, all of which could lead to a business cycle recession. Kostohryz advises investors to monitor real-time economic indicators, maintain cash reserves, and consider defensive positions or inverse ETFs to navigate potential market downturns.

title: As Investors Brace for Volatility, Look to Dividend ETF FDVV
summary: Given current market uncertainties like sticky inflation, high interest rates, and geopolitical tensions, many investors anticipate continued volatility. Dividend ETFs, such as the Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV), offer a potential solution for stability and income generation. FDVV invests in large- and mid-cap dividend-paying companies and can provide diversification benefits, offering a consistent revenue stream that can help offset market volatility.

title: 3 Reasons Every Investor Should Own Fidelity’s FTEC ETF
summary: The article advocates for investors to own Fidelity's FTEC ETF due to its diversified exposure to the information technology sector, significant growth potential, and stability derived from its broad diversification. FTEC offers immediate access to major tech firms, boasts 143% returns over five years, and maintains a moderate expense ratio and volatility compared to the S&P 500. Its portfolio of 283 stocks helps mitigate risks associated with individual company performance.

title: BlackRock, Inc. Reduces Stake in The Interpublic Group of Compan
summary: BlackRock, Inc. significantly reduced its stake in The Interpublic Group of Companies Inc by selling over 5.6 million shares at $27.16 each. This transaction, part of BlackRock's portfolio management strategy, decreased its holding in IPG to 10.70% of its total shares in the company. IPG, a global advertising leader with a market cap of $9.38 billion, is considered modestly undervalued according to GF Value and recently entered a merger agreement with Omnicom.

title: BlackRock, Inc. Reduces Stake in Williams Companies Inc: A Strategic Portfolio Adjustment
summary: BlackRock, Inc. reduced its stake in Williams Companies Inc (WMB) by 9.68% on March 31, 2025, selling over 10 million shares at $59.76. This strategic adjustment reflects BlackRock's ongoing portfolio management. WMB is currently considered overvalued according to its GF Valuation, trading at $58.57 with a PE ratio of 32.18 against a GF Value of $34.46.

title: PayPal Earnings Beat, But Slower Spending And Checkout Use Weigh On Results
summary: PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ: PYPL) reported mixed Q1 2025 results, with adjusted EPS beating estimates but revenue falling short. Slower spending and checkout use, along with competitive pressures and potential tariffs, are weighing on investor sentiment despite the company's reiterated full-year guidance and a fifth consecutive quarter of profitable growth.

title: Socket Mobile Introduces World's Smallest, Most Affordable Direct Part Mark (DPM) Barcode Scanner
summary: Socket Mobile, Inc. has launched the DuraScan D764, heralded as the smallest, lightest, and most affordable Direct Part Mark (DPM) barcode scanner on the market, designed for precise traceability across various industries. This new device excels at reading DPM codes on challenging surfaces and also scans standard 1D and 2D barcodes, providing a versatile, mobile, and cost-effective solution for inventory management and asset tracking. The D764 seamlessly integrates with iOS and other Bluetooth-enabled mobile devices through Socket Mobile's CaptureSDK, offering high-performance scanning without the need for cumbersome cables.

title: Landsea Homes Launches Sales at Pirate Village in Granbury, Texas
summary: Landsea Homes has announced the launch of sales at Pirate Village in Granbury, Texas, featuring 72 new single-family High Performance Homes. These homes incorporate Apple Home™ environment for smart automation and are located near Lake Granbury and the historic downtown square. A grand opening event is scheduled for Saturday, May 3rd, from 11 AM to 4 PM.

title: Is Occidental Petroleum Corp (OXY) the Best Stock to Buy According to Billionaire Warren Buffett?
summary: This article examines Occidental Petroleum Corp (OXY) as a top holding in Warren Buffett's portfolio, detailing his increased stake and the company's financial performance. It discusses Buffett's investment philosophy and OXY's operations, including its recent acquisition of CrownRock and expansion into carbon capture. Despite OXY's strong position with Buffett, the article also presents a counter-argument from Jim Cramer and suggests superior prospects in certain AI stocks.

title: The Magnificent Seven receives another ETF focused on covered calls
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched a new exchange-traded fund, the Roundhill Magnificent Seven Covered Call ETF (MAGY), which focuses on covered calls for the mega-cap tech stocks known as the Magnificent Seven. This actively managed ETF is the latest financial product inspired by the strong performance of these prominent technology companies.

title: Why Fidelity’s Dividend ETF (FDVV) Is a Safe Haven in Today’s Market
summary: The Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV) offers investors a blend of safety and income through exposure to diversified large-cap dividend-paying businesses. Its significant yield of 3.28% and relative resilience make it attractive for those seeking compounding opportunities and portfolio growth, especially in uncertain economic times. With a low expense ratio of 0.16%, FDVV provides a cost-effective way to invest in established companies that can withstand market volatility.

title: Mitigating Tariffs: 3 Stocks to Gain From a Weaker U.S. Dollar
summary: This article identifies three stocks — Coca-Cola, Apple, and Caterpillar — that could benefit significantly from a weaker U.S. dollar, counteracting the effects of tariffs. A weaker dollar makes U.S. products cheaper for international buyers, potentially increasing demand and turning currency headwinds into tailwinds for companies with substantial overseas revenue. The author explains how companies often report "currency headwinds" but that a weaker dollar can lead to higher sales volumes abroad despite lower margins.

title: 3 High-Value Companies With Triple-Digit Upside Potential
summary: Following an early April market selloff, several companies are presenting as undervalued investment opportunities. This article highlights three specific firms—Impinj (PI), Northern Technologies International (NTIC), and Seadrill (SDRL)—that experienced significant share price declines but possess strong growth potential due to improving fundamentals, new partnerships, or substantial backlogs. Each company presents a case for bullish investors to consider at their current comparably low price points, with analysts projecting triple-digit upside potential for some.

title: ROSEN, TRUSTED INVESTOR COUNSEL, Encourages Skyworks Solutions, Inc. Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action - SWKS
summary: Rosen Law Firm is encouraging investors of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ: SWKS) to secure counsel before the May 5, 2025 lead plaintiff deadline in a securities class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Skyworks Solutions made materially false and misleading statements regarding its revenue expectations, its relationship with Apple, and its ability to capitalize on AI in smartphones during the Class Period of July 30, 2024, to February 5, 2025. Investors who purchased Skyworks securities during this period may be entitled to compensation without out-of-pocket fees.

title: Why iShares China Large-Cap ETF (FXI) Is Falling
summary: The iShares China Large-Cap ETF (FXI) experienced a significant decline due to escalating U.S.-China trade tensions. New tariffs imposed by the U.S. and China's firm stance on retaliatory duties, along with export controls on rare earth minerals, have made investors wary of weakened growth prospects. The ETF, which tracks top Chinese firms like Alibaba and JD.Com, is also vulnerable to supply chain disruptions and concerns over a global recession.

title: LANDSEA HOMES CLOSES ON 78 HOMESITES IN THE MOONLIGHT MASTER- PLANNED COMMUNITY IN MARICOPA, ARIZONA
summary: Landsea Homes (Nasdaq: LSEA) announced it has closed on 78 homesites in the Moonlight master-planned community in Maricopa, Arizona. The company plans to offer single- and two-story homes featuring High Performance Home features including smart home automation technology (Apple Home™ environment) and energy savings. This expansion aims to meet the demand for quality, energy-efficient homes in the fast-growing Maricopa area, with sales expected to launch this summer.

title: LANDSEA HOMES CLOSES ON 78 HOMESITES IN THE MOONLIGHT MASTER- PL
summary: Landsea Homes Corporation announced it has closed on 78 homesites in the Moonlight master-planned community in Maricopa, Arizona. The community will offer a mix of High Performance single- and two-story homes featuring smart home automation technology and energy savings, with sales estimated to launch this summer. This expansion aims to meet high demand for quality, energy-efficient homes in Maricopa, an area known for its small-town feel and proximity to Phoenix.

title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sells $5.15 million in company stock
summary: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai recently sold approximately $5.15 million in company stock through a pre-established trading plan. The sales occurred while Alphabet's stock traded near its 52-week low, though Wall Street maintains a bullish outlook. Pichai's remaining direct holdings in Alphabet amount to over 2.7 million shares.

title: Growth or Bubble? Decoding the Rapid Rise of CXAI Stock
summary: CXApp Inc. (CXAI) stock is experiencing a significant rise, up 32.54%, driven by positive market sentiment and strategic advancements including the appointment of Terry Blanchard as SVP of Engineering. The company faces financial challenges, as shown by its Q3 2024 operating revenue of $1.897M against $5.223M in total expenses, but maintains a strong gross margin of 80.9%. The market awaits its rescheduled Q4 and FY24 earnings call for further insights into its AI-native platform and future trajectory.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Visa CEO Ryan McInerney sells $3 million in stock
summary: Visa CEO Ryan McInerney sold 8,620 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $3.02 million. This transaction occurred under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan and near Visa's 52-week high. The article also highlights Visa's strong performance, its bid to replace Mastercard for Apple's credit card, and efforts to integrate with cryptocurrency wallets and combat scams.

title: Rob Arnott on Deep Value and ‘Running Towards Lions’
summary: Rob Arnott, founder of Research Affiliates, discusses his deep-value NIXT ETF which invests in underperforming, deleted stocks, aiming to capitalize on their greater upside potential compared to frothy, expensive additions to indexes. He emphasizes the importance of diversification into cheap alternatives, even if uncomfortable, and views the financial advisor's role as guiding clients away from "stupid mistakes" like performance chasing.

title: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) Announces the Appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering
summary: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) has announced the appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering. Blanchard, with over 30 years of engineering leadership experience from companies like Apple, WhatsApp, and NVIDIA, will lead CXAI's global engineering organization and drive the development of next-generation AI technologies for workplace experiences. This strategic hire aims to accelerate CXAI's product roadmap and technical strategy, focusing on creating advanced Agentic AI solutions.

title: PTC Brings AI-Powered PLM to Hannover Messe 2025 with Windchill AI
summary: PTC is set to preview its AI-powered Windchill AI product lifecycle management (PLM) assistant at Hannover Messe 2025, alongside Codebeamer AI and ServiceMax AI. This initiative demonstrates PTC's commitment to advancing agentic AI across the product digital thread, aiming to enhance engineers' efficiency by leveraging product data for informed decision-making and task automation. The preview will include the Document Vault AI agent, designed to extract critical product information from Windchill-stored documents.

title: BCX: Examining Inflation Protection Benefits And Recession Risks
summary: The BlackRock Resources & Commodities Strategy Trust (BCX) is a closed-end fund offering commodities exposure and a high income yield, making it attractive for inflation protection. The fund has historically performed well during inflationary periods, outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, and trades at a compelling discount to NAV with a significant yield and monthly distributions. While distributions have been fully covered year-to-date, they were not fully covered for the full year 2024.

title: Digging into Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio
summary: This article analyzes Berkshire Hathaway's equity portfolio using Morningstar's Global Risk Model, uncovering its concentrated and evolving nature. Despite Buffett's historical aversion to tech, the portfolio is now notably technology-focused, primarily due to its significant Apple holding. The analysis highlights how Berkshire's investment strategy, though idiosyncratic, shows unique characteristics in liquidity, momentum, moat, value-growth, and volatility compared to the S&P 500.

title: Worried About the Markets? This Tech ETF Is Up Over 25% This Year and Could Still Go Higher.
summary: The Invesco China Technology ETF (CQQQ) has surged over 25% this year, outperforming the S&P 500 and the broader tech sector, driven by advancements in Chinese AI. Despite recent market downturns and concerns over tech valuations, this ETF offers exposure to undervalued Chinese tech companies with significant growth potential, especially in the AI sector. With a forward price-to-earnings multiple of just 19, it presents a compelling investment opportunity.

title: J&J boosts US investments by 25% over 4 years amid looming tariff threats
summary: Johnson & Johnson plans to increase its U.S. investments by 25% to over $55 billion in the next four years, driven by the threat of drug import duties from the Trump administration. This investment includes building four new manufacturing plants, one of which has already broken ground in Wilson, North Carolina. While some investors note that a portion of these commitments were already planned, J&J aims to enhance domestic manufacturing capabilities to mitigate potential 25% tariffs on pharmaceutical imports.

title: ACV Auctions CEO George Chamoun sells $5.37 million in stock
summary: George Chamoun, CEO of ACV Auctions Inc. (NASDAQ: ACVA), sold 350,000 shares of Class A Common Stock worth approximately $5.37 million across two transactions on March 19 and 20. The sales were conducted under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan established in December 2024. Following these sales, Chamoun retains 2,821,193 shares.

title: J&J touts $55B in planned US investments over 4 years, including 3 new manufacturing sites
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced plans to invest $55 billion in the U.S. over the next four years, an increase of 25% from its previous four-year spending. This investment includes building three new manufacturing sites, in addition to a previously announced biologics plant in North Carolina, and expanding existing facilities. The move comes amidst a push for increased domestic investment and follows similar announcements from companies like Eli Lilly and Apple.

title: Trump tally: J&J plans $55 billion investment to expand U.S. manufacturing
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced a $55 billion investment over the next four years to expand U.S. manufacturing, research, and technology. This move aligns with President Trump's goal of boosting domestic manufacturing and will include new facilities and expansions to existing sites. J&J's investment is part of a larger trend of major U.S. companies pledging significant spending to expand U.S. operations.

title: 4 tech giants look cheap ahead of earnings
summary: Ahead of their earnings reports, four major tech companies—Apple, Amazon, Facebook, and Microsoft—are considered undervalued. Analysts see Apple as undervalued despite recent revenue guidance adjustments, Amazon as continuing its impressive growth, Microsoft showing broad-based strength, and Facebook maintaining its competitive advantages in digital advertising despite recent controversies.

title: Deadline Alert: Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (SWKS) Investors Who Lost Money Urged To Contact Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP About Securities Fraud Lawsuit
summary: Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP is reminding investors of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ: SWKS) who suffered losses to contact them regarding a securities fraud lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Skyworks made misleading statements about its business operations and prospects, particularly concerning its relationship with Apple and its ability to capitalize on AI. Investors who purchased Skyworks securities between July 30, 2024, and February 5, 2025, have until May 5, 2025, to file a lead plaintiff motion.

title: US Vs. Europe ETFs: Is The Tide Turning?
summary: European equities have notably outperformed U.S. equities since the beginning of 2025, leading to a shift in investor sentiment, with European investors pulling out of U.S. equity ETFs. This divergence is attributed to geopolitical developments, China's economic rebound supporting European exports, and concerns over U.S. mega-cap tech valuations and tariffs. Despite these shifts, both U.S. and European ETF markets are experiencing robust growth, although European ETFs have grown faster due to lower percentages of registered funds historically.

title: Live Nation Loses Bid to Narrow DOJ Ticketmaster Case
summary: A federal judge in New York denied Live Nation Entertainment Inc.'s attempt to narrow the Justice Department’s antitrust case against it, which seeks to break off Ticketmaster. The DOJ and some 30 states allege Live Nation has illegally monopolized the live events industry, controlling a significant portion of concert venues and ticketing. A trial is scheduled for March 2026.
authors: Josh Sisco, Leah Nylen, Chris Dolmetsch

title: Rockwell Automation Poised to Gain From U.S. Tariffs & Onshoring
summary: Rockwell Automation stands to benefit significantly from U.S. tariffs and the growing trend of onshoring manufacturing back to the United States. The company, which produces industrial automation equipment and has over 70% of its products "Made in America," is well-positioned to capitalize on increased domestic production spurred by trade policies. Despite conservative guidance, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating, anticipating that Rockwell will mitigate tariff impacts and emerge as a net beneficiary.

title: Why FCF ETF 'VFLO' Looks Strong in 2025
summary: The VictoryShares Free Cash Flow ETF (VFLO) demonstrated strong demand in 2024 and is well-positioned for 2025, offering diversification, attractive valuations, and strong historical returns. VFLO targets large-cap U.S. companies with high free cash flow yields, excluding "Magnificent Seven" stocks, making it a valuable complement to broad benchmarks. Its performance in 2024, generating a nearly 22% return, highlights its potential to improve value exposure in portfolios.

title: What's Going On With FiscalNote Holdings Stock Monday?
summary: FiscalNote Holdings Inc (NYSE: NOTE) saw its shares trading higher after announcing a definitive agreement to divest two non-core assets, Oxford Analytica and Dragonfly, to Dow Jones for $40 million. This move is expected to reduce the company's senior term loan, strengthen its balance sheet, and streamline operations, focusing on core Policy solutions. Additionally, FiscalNote engaged John Lee, former head of contracts for Palantir’s U.S. government vertical, as a senior strategic advisor to support its AI and data-driven solutions for the public sector.

title: Berkshire’s Earnings: Diamond Hands or Paper Hands?
summary: This article examines the upcoming Berkshire Hathaway earnings report in late February, outlining both bullish and bearish catalysts for its stock (BRK.B). It highlights Berkshire's strategic investments, record cash reserves, and strong operating businesses as bullish factors, while portfolio reductions in Apple and Bank of America, legal challenges, and leadership transition uncertainty are identified as bearish concerns. The article emphasizes Berkshire's role as a diversified, non-tech investment with exposure to financials, energy, and industrials, suggesting that the earnings call will provide critical insights into its future direction.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Offloads Meta Shares Worth $14.4 Million In February
summary: Mark Zuckerberg sold 17,855 shares of Meta Platforms Inc. Class A common stock worth approximately $14.4 million on February 14, at prices between $726.68 and $740.71. These transactions were executed under a pre-established trading plan and follow previous sales in late December 2024. Despite these sales, Meta demonstrates strong financial health with a high gross profit margin and increased quarterly dividends.

title: Roundhill Launches 5 Leveraged Weekly Income ETFs
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched five new WeeklyPay ETFs (NVW, TSW, AAPW, COIW, PLTW) on the Cboe Exchange, offering weekly distributions and leveraged exposure to specific single stocks like Nvidia, Tesla, and Apple. These actively managed funds aim to generate 1.2 times the weekly returns of their underlying companies, providing income-focused investors with amplified returns and potential tax advantages through return of capital distributions. This innovation expands Roundhill's portfolio of weekly income strategies, with plans for additional leveraged WeeklyPay ETFs covering other major companies.

title: Major Aviation Merger: flyExclusive's $22M Strategic Takeover Reshapes Private Charter Market
summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) is set to acquire Jet.AI's (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business for $12-22 million in an all-stock deal, transforming Jet.AI into a pure-play AI company. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2025, involves spinning off Jet.AI's charter business into a new entity which flyExclusive will then acquire, while Jet.AI shareholders will retain their stock and receive new flyExclusive shares. This strategic move aims to provide flyExclusive with growth capital and enhanced shareholder liquidity, leveraging synergies between the two companies.
